JSWBSPjQ5B7cxE50K4BesQ.text: Love this place and the home cooked meal feel, minus doing the dishes and all the work. Loved the Chicken Alfredo and of course the salad.

HPudoJ84mQjWRWPERUe8ew.text: Went again last nite.  Again, the place was packed and without reservations, you are SOL.  But we made reservations and got seated in about 10 mins.  Service is good, despite them being super busy.  People complain about the food being mediocre, but that is to be expected from a mid-range, family style restaurant.  I think their food is better than Olive Garden, and Bucca de Beppo.  I have no complaints about this place if I want family style, cost-effective dinners.  If I wanted a high-end dinner, I would go to a fancier Northern Italian type of place and pay the price for such food.

vNQe2lzjUny9YN48K2vgIQ.text: Yup it's confirmed... Rigatony's is definitely a 5!  We had the sweetest waitress Nancy.  This time we went for the Chicken Florentine, Eggplant Parmigiana & the Carb Smart Chicken Linguine.  Everything was delicious!  Just found out they have a punch card so I will definitely be making some use of that!

Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Eggplant Parmigiana w Linguine

PwbnkDNyim3wFhs43EoxyA.text: best trio sangria yummy sausage and penne pasta vodka sause excellent salad and bread

XShe1rabvHGGS44RQwy1PQ.text: Me and my family/friends are big rigatonys fans however, lately this place has been very hit or miss which is sad because it used to always be delicious. Sometimes I'll go and have a delicious meal, then the following visit the pasta sauce is watery and the service is slow. It's a very popular place and there's almost always a wait, even on weeknights so no doubt the food is good it's just that lately they've been having consistency issues.   Overall the food has been good the majority of the times I've visited (which is why I gave four stars)  But for an Italian restaurant the wine list is terrible. There's maybe 10 options to choose from total and none of them are actually quality wines. However they have plenty of food options to choose from and all of them include the yummy complimentary salad and bread with your meal.  Give it a try and hopefully you'll catch them on a good day!

0xd7pYJMDMY3HjEmV4Ooow.text: Me and my family were very disappointed in Sarah our server. We had friends from out of town and wanted to take them to a nice dinner. Sarah was horrific. She was extremely rude to my mother and her friends. She was so condescending that I almost couldn't believe it was happening.  As a server for 15 years I would never treat any of my tables with the lack of respect that Sarah showed, they are paying your bills Sarah.    I would think twice Rigatony's for allowing this person stay on your staff.

ELd6XJkfrmrzpyKu6tIm0g.text: I really wanted to like this place but the food just wasn't that good.  I guess I don't see why everyone thinks this place is good for Italian.  We have been there twice now and both times were the same.   Let's start with service.  This was the high point of the night.  Our waiter was very nice and attentive.   Now the food.  We started with a fried zucchini appetizer.  The zucchini was nicely done.  Crisp outside and dusted with cheese.  I did like this dish.   The salad sounded promising.  Greens, olives, cheese, onions, and sliced Genoa salami with a balsamic dressing.  Sounded good but it had no taste whatsoever.  They must have waved the vinegar over the dish and called it good.  The salad just had no taste.  Almost felt like I was eating mayo.   I ordered the baked rigatoni with sausage.  The menu  described it as being served with a garlic spiked red sauce.  This sounded good and our waiter said that it was a marinara sauce.  No creme.  There was nothing garlicky about the sauce.  I think they actually added butter to the dish.  Not even close to a red sauve and it was just blah. No taste again.  How can you advertise garlic spiked and have it taste like butter??  My wife ordered the pizza with some pasta on top of it with meatballs.  It was ok.  The meatballs had some taste to them (mostly salt) . The crust was nice.   I grew up speaking Italian and eating Italian food.  This ain't it ; not even close.  I am trying to figure out what people see in the food.  To each their own I guess.  Return factor is 10%

0Hfze797xbe7Aeb4b8QtPg.text: This is the only place I go when I feel like eating some pasta or lasagna. Olive Garden usually leaves me with indigestion, but not this place. Salad is great and service so far has been great too. Could b a little pricey but we usually end up getting a box for half our entrees, so we get to eat some more at home later! Which is always good.

4LwdWyw6QYU3Gw1XnJ63Pg.text: I have been going to RigaTony's since I was little. It was one of my grandpa's favorite restaurants  and now it is one of mine. Although we live in Gilbert, we try to come in as often as possible.  18 miles is a small sacrifice for their amazing salads, pasta and dessert. The food has always been amazing but the service is spectacular as well. Marissa is our favorite, always willing to go the extra mile for us. She knows her menu and is able to help with my food sensitivities. She remembers our orders, all modifications  included. Thank you!!!!

YUfKhnFfPPhnERoTm6nMXw.text: Their Antipasto Salad is best I have ever had and is served with entrees. It is precision chopped and  tossed with an excellent creamy balsamic vinegar  dressing (tastes like a great Italian) with plenty of salami, pepperoni, and ham slivers, olives, peppercini, tomatoes and fresh mozzerella cheese.  Served with small loves of fresh Italian Cibatta bread and Olive Oil and Oregano for dipping. These are UNLIMITED with an entree purchase.  I had meatballs and and pomodoro over linguini, and my girlfriend had creamy pesto and sausage over penne. Both were delicious with large portions and on an early bird special for $8.95, and $10.95 for dinner.  Great atmoshere too. Now my favorite Italian restaurant!

dQsuxASJ4GKXJXN6LT0vCw.text: Have been here many times with family and/or friends since my first review. Consistently terrific Italian food with a varied enough menu to make everyone in my party happy! Lunch is still a fantastic deal. For less than $7 you get a large salad with meats and cheeses, fresh bread, and your choice of pasta options. Service has always been top notch.  Questo e il mio posto preferito per mangiare Italiano! (This is my favorite Italian place to eat!)

mfNIx4HiDDK6s5srFNZFJQ.text: Salad tonight was old.  Gluten free pizza was horrible.....soggy...could not eat it at all. Very surprised as we have dined in there a lot but this was disgusting.

5pd21E7Bq6sCeVDfey1-6g.text: Tonight was my wife and my first time at this restaurant. The food was amazing, wait time was a couple minutes. Our server, Jacob, well...subpar. He was quick to get our drinks and our order, wife was able to change her dinner after she ordered. I ordered a mt dew, he asked if I wanted another mt dew, wasn't informed that another charge would be added. He asked the tables around us if they wanted extra bread, never got that question. Another server asked her table if they would like to try a sample wine, never got that question. It took him a while to get our check, we ordered cannolis and he hands us our check, took him a while to get back to us. He takes our check, looks at it, puts it in his apron and goes to the next table to take their order, he finally comes back with our check and cannoli 7-10 minutes later, after taking the check. We talked to the manager, manager was amazing, haves us a $10 gift card.

JFMZIxxh0NJhWLXzR6eppw.text: Food was very average; I was disappointed. We won't be back. If you are looking for authentic Italian food, this isn't the place to try.

mtxH4Ehw7jKEmb4ho7mQGw.text: We had an excellent experience at lunch today.  Andrew was friendly and attentive to our table.  It's refreshing to find a restaurant that did we didn't leave wishing something had gone better or differently.  Will be back!!

RKkv3x9erb51pL9Bygu0fg.text: We moved to Arizona last year and have been looking for a good Italian restaurant. So glad we found Rigatony's. Nice restaurant with excellent service. My husband had spaghetti and meat sauce with meatballs added. I had chicken Florentine. Both dishes were delicious. Our meals came with a bowl of salad and bread and was also delicious. On our way out, we bought a bottle of their dressing. We will definitely be going back. Great find!

nRWg4KmQgSr9Nm84ulvG9Q.text: This place is GREAT! They give you salad with homemade dressing to start your course. This is followed by your pasta of your choice. The red sauce is sooooo homemade. Of course theres the bread you get for dipping in oil too! We love the lasagna and the combination dinners. We fill up on salad & take some leftovers home. Feels so good having more the next day!

O2ozCDvmpilXBDzO_-37SA.text: Awesome experience! A friend and I were in town for work and wanted some good Italian. Thanks to Yelp we found Rigatony's and we were not disappointed.  Our server Frankie was phenomenal. Welcomed us warmly and told us a little about what made Rigatony's so special...and she was right. Food was superb. Ambiance was great. Left feeling very happy with the whole experience.  We come to Phoenix a couple of times a year for conferences and we will definitely be coming back.  Great job to all at Rigatony's!

54SWR1oR0WVaAiOEHCpMAA.text: My wife wanted Italian food for our anniversary dinner so I googled Italian food in Tempe. This brought me to Rigatonys. We arrived early and got a table for two. We were created by Jesse promptly and he took our drink order. After deciding on what we wanted, I had the baked manicotti and by wife had rigatoni, we placed our order with Jesse who was already bringing our salad. The food was amazing, Jesse was awesome and the bill was very reasonable. I live in the west valley so driving 24 miles for this dinner was very well worth it.

ryMyeo5OGGJXqh0I2m9Nig.text: Cute atmosphere, like home. Our server was super nice we had dinner today for my moms Birthday.   We had the Chicken Parmesan, Margherita Pie, Baked Rigatoni, and my Vegetarian brother had the Spaghetti with marinara and veggies, and we had antipasto salad that was included with all entrees. Everything was delicious. I also had the Sangria Trio all three were delicious.   I just think we should of saved room for dessert as I had my eye on the chocolate cake snd Spumoni, but we couldnt finish all the food!

A5_t4g7RpDvG1L_h3nASHQ.text: I've been coming here since I was a kid.... Absolutely THE best salad in the world and the dishes are outta this world!

X_ea8anuYZLhuAqdk_baSg.text: 1. Baked Rigatoni is where its at. great marinara with cheese mixture. 2. Lasagna is average at best. 3. Salad is great. different than Olive Garden. Clams good too!

SePzWam0hvMGzAL_lIIKlA.text: Anytime I feel like some good Italian food our family heads to RigaTony's. The antipasto salad to start off your meal is amazing and the warm fresh baked ciabatta bread, we just cant get enough. The Capellini Checca is my favorite dish by far, especially when you are looking for something different then the basic Italian food. On my last visit I was even told the story of how the drink the Eleanor had come to be, and it was definitely worth putting on the menu, We have never gotten anything but outstanding service, and whenever friends and family come to town RigaTony's is always my recommendation.

-PVl2knXouKfAdOMiiJnqg.text: So I was having an Italian craving for my Birthday dinner, and some friends in Chandler suggested RigaTony's.  They live only 5min away, but had never been there.  They said it always appears to be busy, and this Wed. Night was no exception.  We signed in and took our buzzer for a 25 min wait....and then magically a table for 4 opened up in the bar!  Service was very pleasant and prompt, waters were kept full, empty plates cleared quickly.  All of our entrees were delicious, my fettuccini Alfredo was deliciously rich and cheesy but not heavy, and my husband loved his Baked RigaTony with and marinara and Alfredo sauce together.  We passed on dessert, only cuz we were all too full, and the manager Jenny came to check on us before we left. Our waiter had told her we were first timers, so she wanted to make sure we enjoyed our experience.  We assured her we would be back; she further explained that this was her family's place and if we ever needed anything again to ask for her by name.  We were walking out the door and she ran after us to give us complimentary dessert.  She wanted to make sure we got the "full RigaTony's experience".  We all agreed no more national chain Italian for us!

mRRjofJf0zavtexgaE3RvQ.text: Eek! methinks not is damn about right. Ordered the make your pasta item with chicken pesto and angellini pasta and the tiramisu.   One of the worst Italian foods I have had and the chicken was definitely rancid (I am quite sure that it hadn't been stored at the right temperature and had been lying there collecting salmonella for quite some time).  The tiramisu was such a disappointment what happened to the layers of ladyfinger and the delicate touches of coffee.  This reminds me of the time I tried watching Gigli.  The only saving grace was the history of the owner(displayed on theor menu) who allegedly was a thief and a bum. Seems like he was known for making business fail. How ironically True....

en99f5BzdFkAZfvW5RxaZw.text: Great food at a great price. Not the best Italian food but definitely a step up from all of the national chains. Also great lunch prices

jMqZtmD1kGdAZfFbygF_jQ.text: Used to frequent Rigatony's before moving from Chandler. Always got a good portion at a reasonable price. Now the prices have gone up and the portions have gotten smaller. Our waiter was more interested in chatting than serving. He forgot my drink order. Food is still good, but not the exception it used to be.

utl33nBTxTaxPNRYbOeVZw.text: I originally wanted to take my girlfriend here for valentines day last year because of the good reviews, and it being so close to my house. However, they were booked up for valentines day. A couple months later, my girlfriend randomly suggested going here for dinner, so we decided to try it out. We were both thoroughly impressed. The food is outstanding. The salad and bread that comes with your meal is the best part. We usually fill up on them because they are bottomless. The salad is always super fresh and tasty. We also tried the fried zucchini fries, which is one of the best things I have ever had. We both usually get the chicken with lemon and artichoke. The chicken is always juicy and moist. The service here is excellent, especially from Marisol. She is by far the best server there. Every time we go there, we ask for her. She is so friendly and welcoming. She always talks to us as friends, not customers. She usually remembers our orders too. Overall, this restaurant is one of the best Italian restaurants in Arizona. We will continue bringing our business here!

TG9heqEeBDUMCH5z6kgewA.text: Great food!!!!!  Poor wine selection, especially for an Italian restaurant. This was even after they redid their wine list. And if you want to taste it first they bring it in a shot glass which kills the flavor.  Still the cheese ravioli was amazing.

YQIJg7NBBMv7-px0r9peqw.text: Still as fantastic as ever!  Great new location. To quote yelp's rating system... "Whoohoo! As good as it gets!"

NVlGpW8JpqWPSw_aOJcGwg.text: One of my favorite italian restaurants.  I'm convinced I can survive on their antipasto salad and cibata alone.  I always switch back and forth between two favorites: spaghetti and meatballs or the baked rigatoni. I also really like the chicken marsala.  And if you ever have room, do yourself a favor and order the cappuccino pie. So delicious!

M29De4w46Nc6PmORWonYLQ.text: No matter what day or time we  come in, the food is always great. There are usually lines out the door at night depending on the day but always worth the wait.  Natalie is our favorite server, she's great!

aHjzu6pzUnOLE1261AWzkQ.text: Last night was my second visit to this wonderful local spot, the first since they moved. I specifically requested this trip because I enjoyed my first meal. I was not disappointed. The antipasti salad is a meal on its own! I had the Capallini Pescatore which was wonderfully prepared. The mussels and clams were very fresh and perfectly cooked. The tiramisu and cannolis were also perfect! Great service as well. Will always make this a must go stop when I'm in the area!

Rgs5F_rjWAPJxJKrTF1ghw.text: This place has it all! Amazing and delicious food, and friendly service! The house salad is soo good! I have had the shrimp scampi and it's very good! Family owned and it shows. I LOVE this place! :)

4wTwiLtzUSrM9UDIwvFVCg.text: Love it.  They have this south beach entree, where it's wheat spaghetti, with chicken, shrimp, spinach, and a light winey sauce.  DELICIOUS!  And, totally fits in with my diet.  I left without the heavy pasta feeling in my belly. Yay!

xmWwHJffMf7GGCIjhsYVWw.text: YUM! The food here is amazing. True Italian comfort food. Generous portions at  great prices. I have used them for catering several times and have always had a positive experience, but my experience today motivated me to Yelp. A teammate called in an order for 14 people last night. I picked up the order and when I got to work, my teammate said we were missing food and utensils and had called to have it fixed,  so I had to go back. When I got back to the restaurant, the manager advised me that the order was correct, but because there was a miscommunication, she was going to make it right and provided me the food we "thought" we were missing (discovered it was indeed our fault, not RigaTony's). I really appreciate the staff going the extra mile to make it right! And lunch was wonderful!  Thank you!

77VWIgQLt8bbR2T4YrZm3w.text: RigaTony's has been a standby for me for as long as I can remember. I even went there for prom night, many years ago. I've been to both of the old locations, and more recently to the new one, and I've tried a good deal of their menu.  I find that the quality of their food is usually pretty damn spot-on. I've been disappointed with my food only once or twice; my normal favorites like the Chicken Picatta are absolutely fantastic and topped with a great mix of tomatoes and capers and such, and perfectly cooked and breaded. The Italian Sausage is fantastic, and the stuffed shells are great too, but the alfredo is usually a bit... tacky. The sauce is a bit thick in that it's usually lopped on top and doesn't mix well, though it's pretty tasty even after that.  There's enough special about this place to keep you coming back and enjoying yourself. Instead of the industrial strength, flavorless slabs of breaded sad-chicken I've found at other nearby Italian places, the overall quality is really enjoyable for "mid-range" Italian food.   The prices are fantastic: $16 or so for a "Tour of RigaTony's" that includes the picatta, sausage, shells, and alfredo is spot on, and easily two meals. The bread is incredible (ask for some scampi butter instead of the oil for a fun treat) and the salad and house dressing are REALLY good.   The service is hit-or-miss. I haven't been to the new location during any sort of dinner rush, just once a bit later where our server was just fine, but I've been disappointed by the service (especially at the old Brown location) so many times that I've taken to just taking out. RigaTony's travels well, and their carry-out deals include the salad, bread, and usually a dessert, including their tasty chocolate cake.  Not much of an oenophile or drinker in general, so I can't comment on the wine selection at all, but overall, you can have a tasty experience here with generally high quality food all around. Little improvements could make things a lot better, and I'll have to report back the next time I visit during dinner on the service, but I've been going for years and I love the place.  (Oh, one final thing: their lunch specials are INSANE. They vary from day to day, but you can be in and out in about a half hour for $7 with some GREAT food!)

YPO_26spG74adrtjNUl79Q.text: This is one of my favorite places of all times. When Rigatony's moved from Arizona Avenue, my husband and I thought we would go less. It was further away from our home and we were scared it would lose the charm and good food. It has been quite the opposite. We visit our favorite server Frankie at least once a week...and sometimes twice. We have been known to even show up three times a week, but that borders on addiction, so I hate to admit that. I would love to eat pasta three times a week, but cannot. We will order grilled chicken, steamed broccoli and the house salad. I will give credit to my best friend Robin who recommended that healthy alternative with the ability to still get our "fix". We have ordered party packages for gatherings at our house more times than I can count. Every dish I have ever had is incredible. Out of town guests??? We always bring them here. We take credit for creating a few addicts that insist on a visit when they are in town. Frankie sees us and asks if we are getting the usual and if we aren't then she can usually guess what the alternative is. CRAZY GREAT service. We love Christian who was once upon a time was "only"  behind the bar, but has taken on some managerial duties. The wine dinners are SO awesome and creative. Mike is always there to ensure our experience is awesome every time. Devoted diner cards have earned all kinds of discounts. They recognize us when we walk in, ask about our grand kids and are truly a family restaurant. Who could ask for more?

xbic2lux5zZtllvJhRXgow.text: Our first visit here was an accident, I guess there is no Riga Tony's in the bay area (where I'm from), but was pleasantly surprised. The only reason it doesn't get all 5 stars is because of the incredible wait that we had the past 5ish times that we've went. It's usually always busy and we end up waiting no matter if it is a weekday or weekend.   My favorite is the choice of 1 or 2 lb. of clams on the appetizers, deeelicious! Too bad the shells count for most of the weight, but the lemony, oil sauce that it's swimming in really adds flavor. We've always had pretty slow service, not that they're not friendly, just kinda slow...I remember got sat (after a 30 min. wait), and waited another 20 min. before the waiter greeted us. The food made it up though. They have a wide variety of different pastas and seafood, but the clam linguini is sssoooo scrumptuous.  Love love love the bottomless salad. Much better than Olive Garden. lol  One time the waiter spilled all 3 large waters on our table and got us wet, but they cleaned it up right away and the manger came over, apologized, and said the appetizers were on them. Can you say.. awesome?   It always seems like a different story whenever we come here, not sure if that's a good or bad thing...

8RJDzil86HWI2xfF3TpLuQ.text: This place is like the Olive Garden but better.  It was one of the better meals (but not the best) that I had in Arizona.  All dinner meals come with all you can eat bread and salad.  The salad is good (very similar to the OG bottomless salad) with a mild creamy dressing.    The dinner portions are large.  I had the baked stuff shells, which were what you would expect.  Large shells full of creamy, herby ricotta goodness covered in marinara.  I passed on the baked Rigatoni which the place is famous for, I was told it was good, but it's not really my thing.  D had the veal cannellonni which he said was really good.  I was a bit suprised to see a full side of spaghetti on his plate with it.  J had the cheese ravioli covered with a mixture of the red and white sauces that come on the baked rigatoni - she declared it wonderful.  In fact the waiter who had never served it with that sauce combo said it looked so good he was going to try it out.  The wine was not good, tasted like it had gotten too hot - which I imagine is a common affliction for AZ wine drinkers.    We were stuffed by the time we left.  It's got a nice ambience, the waiters are really nice and for 3 people our bill was only $66 which in my opinion is a great deal.

nyJzPqQjuMdss-Yy5tDQtA.text: RigaTony's used to be good... however they recently got rid of their shrimp scampi. What's replaced it, the shrimp and scallops scampi sounds great.  Nope. Their original scampi dish was the pinnacle of the genre. This new dish - think scallops cooked to varying levels of doneness, from burn to questionably undercooked. The shrimp joins this melody of scallops in a boat of liquid butter, not joined with the pasta in any form.  RigaTony's continues to have a huge following.  The lines are out the door. They have no reason to cheapen the dish.  Raise prices and keep the quality.

Zm40G9nP5ZvwDiTzqL5epQ.text: Mom and I came here for lunch after church today! She ordered the lasagna and I had the baked rigatony and it was delicious omg and they served our meals with HOT AND SOFT BREAD YAAAASSSS IT WAS SO GOOD and came with an antipasto salad which was enormous. We loved everything! Flavorful and good portion size as well! Definitely will be coming back!!

XdKVCG-IHO68hW_a-ZXbPQ.text: Third time's a charm!!! It's official rigatonys is our official Italian restaurant from now on! Today we had Marcy as our server she was great! Started with the dunk'n go nuts that was their fresh baked bread with three sauces pesto, marinara, alfredo. We shared their manicotti dinner with added mushrooms and garlic broccolini mmmmmm....and a side of sauteed garlic spinach. Three different visits all three visits we're great! the food was great, the service was great Everytime so we're sold! We live a hour away, but make it a point to visit our friends and eat here when we're out here! Thank you again for being consistent and having great service! Yum yum yum see you next time.

yhaPF9_CjwHgwPn3bt3M7w.text: Great Service by Host Gwen and the Gentleman Up front. Ordered takeout that was pretty good, and most definitely would like to come and sit down for the Full Diner experience.

uHec6zXAKWRFCCoVUVmL6w.text: First time to RigaTony's and it won't be the last!  Everything was incredible.  All of the wait staff and the bartenders were super friendly.  The antipasto salad (served with all entrees) was one of the best salads I've probably ever had-very fresh and flavorful.   My husband had the salmon linguini and it was out of this world with flavor.  I had the Baked RigaTony and it was equally amazing.   Great food.  Great service.  Reasonably priced as well!

bsKkxXqO2-WBJnNAoc9VjQ.text: Very competent Italian food. Attentive service and good bar selection but beer is fairly limited. Fried raviolis very nice as appetizer. RigaTony's pasta dish very rich and hearty. Chicken Marsala and short ribs very filling. Bread and salad above average.

YndDxTBqKInGUCWiFnCdUg.text: Great Italian food, great prices. The service is always very nice.  Nice possibility to sitting outside, it's feel almost like in Italy.

C9-ZzEPmdr9Z3TaBeIXbig.text: Brought a client here for lunch, and it was so good!   The portions are very generous, especially the side salads. That alone could be a meal.   I have the manicotti, and it was perfect!   Client had the salad, and she seemed to enjoy it.

V_pthGymKq7J5dBVoNoYvA.text: Never had a bad meal here. The pork chops are incredible. Not over seasoned and cooked perfectly. Also a big fan of the spaghetti and Italian sausage.

hc5kV39hajSuwvXGXeElsw.text: Delicious Italian food with a stylish and well decorated environment. We came here for my daughter in law's birthday and were served with a variety of tasty dishes that everyone enjoyed.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. How this place makes me feel.

vnj3izwOs8D8k5QczDP-9g.text: I was really excited to go here since I saw all the good reviews.  It was a let down to say the least.  I am from Jersey and this place couldn't pass for Olive Garden.  The bread was the only thing that was worth it.  If you are in the mood for Italian, skip it!!

gJ2n5jZC3EELppaQZ8d-HQ.text: Came here for an early dinner with my husband, our two young kids and a family friend. We were seated almost immediately and our waitress was Marissa. She was training several other employees. She took our drink orders and returned promptly to take our appetizer orders. We ordered the eggplant bruschetta, fried calamari and fried ravioli. Everything was AMAZING. The fried ravioli was my absolute favorite. When Marissa was taking our appetizer order, she asked if I wanted my 4 year old's food delivered at the same time as the appetizers, as opposed to having it brought out with the entrees. I've never been asked this before when dining! Ever! That totally made my experience perfect. She is just an awesome waitress. Our entrees took no time at all and were all delicious. I can't complain about any part of our experience, except that the bathroom changing table wasn't clean and was out of liners. Marissa was one of the best waitresses I've ever had, the food was fantastic and I will definitely be coming back.

cs8lRDh7UVvFqdiexLzK5w.text: Oreganos is probably one of the most famous restaurants in Arizona but I wish everyone who went there would go here. This is Oreganos 2.0 or 3.0. The food quality, the authentic aesthetic, the portion size, and the selection of menu items are incredible. Whatever your favorite Italian dish is get it here I'm sure it'll be amazing, not to mention their apple bread pudding desert. You have to leave room to try that. Don't second guess about going here, just go. You won't regret it.

6PABkTxKxhfBvZ9493QitQ.text: Shoutout to RigaTony's for the excellent free meals they're serving up to all government employees currently not working due to -45's government shutdown.

2v7ZpQS3hhJvJieeGuVXbA.text: I love his place! Friendly atmosphere, reasonable prices and interesting decor inside. I love coming here after Sunday morning church and I always get full because I eat all the bread and delicious salad before my good comes out, waaay better than Olive Garden for sure!

qdLcC_ilXBSvlHhb3UZi5w.text: It just doesn't get any better than this! From the minute you walk through the front door and are hypnotized by the tantalizing aromas you become part of the RigaTony's family. The staff treats you like family as they have been by owners Mike and Chrissy. When you receive your food it is like being at the family dinner table. That incredible salad...Oh my heavens! I have to keep reminding myself that I still have an entree coming because I can just get lost in that salad...AND they will bring you more - just like at home. This week we ordered the baked Rigatony dinner with chicken to go. Served with salad and bread. Well, we couldn't go home without their freshly made cannoli for dessert. This was a True family dining experience. I don't think a week goes by when we  either have a meal at one of their family dining tables or order a meal for takeout. This family owned business puts their heart into every plate or bowl that leaves that kitchen. It doesn't get any better than that!

SuejTjf6CYmmyNVr5oa43Q.text: Valentine's special? Surf and Turf with Filet Mignon and Shrimp as explained by waitress. More like beef tips and shrimp over pasta. Beef was super tough, some of it you couldn't even cut through. Must have purchased beef thru discount house as it didn't even resemble filet mignon. Don't know if this was just for Valentine Special or what. If it ever comes up on menu, don't order! Absolutely the worst! Ruined whole dinner for me.

oLf_XK8kTsr8MEnXcXw8Xw.text: Had a great experience here with my friends. The place is cozy, and food is amazing! I got the sangria sampler (which I definitely recommend), and the staff was friendly! Our waiter was great, suggested some things on the menu because it was our first time there. Really authentic Italian food, it warms your heart eating it! Definitely check out if you're in town!

tc397xIC0eD5UQDU23oruQ.text: Baked rigatony will change your life very good and fresh! Big slices of spicy sausage. Nice place inside.

37A8WpLhzxg_oN6vYQSVVA.text: By far our favorite Italian place. We take all of our friends and family here. Has been around forever. Very professional and amazing food you won't regret dining here.

ZQfIRiL2oSDOdre_uif0aw.text: By far one of the best places I have been to in the valley. I recommend everyone try this place at least once. Awesome bread and very affordable!

u4XjmHMnujC_rfqDysFQdg.text: Had my first visit with some friends tonight who have been before. Our server Ben was fantastic. We were not the easiest trio of diners, and I have never seen a more patient server. The food was also great with generous portion size and fair pricing. I will definitely be back as soon as possible!

qjejPKUBuZem1eLU35EVSA.text: This place was great! The lasagna was really good. Probably the best I've ever had and I've had some in Rome.

MawimgMUp2IAiAxy3n_glw.text: Always come here when visiting from Connecticut.  Great service. I'm Italian and this is the real thing

N8kM0aQmM4gJM6kZbxSbbQ.text: I'd give 5 stars but there was just one thing I think should perhaps be reevaluated/changed for future parties/reservations. I wanted to celebrate my birthday here so I asked my boyfriend's mom to make reservations for my birthday. They said to her they wouldn't be able to reserve unless the whole party was there and seated. Now, I had a party of 14 people ( most of them elderly) so this seemed like quite an inconvenience. I understand the reasoning but I think for large parties, they have to be more accommodating (perhaps to judge on a case-by-case basis based on party size?). In the end, they managed to seat those who arrived early and reserved the rest of the table for the rest of the party to arrive, which was nice. The food here has always been amazing! Everyone tucked in happily into the salad, and even my boyfriend, who isn't a salad fan, loves it. The bits of salami (Pepperoni?) tossed in between the greens was delightful (it even tastes good when I had them for leftovers a day later)! The bread came, warm, and served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar--perfect to snack on before the main meal. I was a little hesitant to order a new dish to try because the last dish I had--the Capellini Pescatore--was amazing! I decided to go ahead and order the Shrimp Capellini and it was absolutely yums and did not disappoint at all! So happy I took a chance! My boyfriend's dad's dish was probably the one that was the least tasty. The Chicken Marsala was pretty juicy and tender, though the sauce was a tad sweet for his liking. The mashed potatoes didn't taste very good. Other than that, the dishes as a whole, seemed to please everyone. My dessert was the apple bread pudding with caramel sauce and ooooh this dessert is OUT OF THIS WORLD! It warms your tummy with its sweetness. I love it so much! My boyfriend is a big fan of the cannoli here as well. My guests, some of who'd never been to this place before, were very happy with the serving sizes and the taste of the food and said they'd definitely come back! The staff was very pleasant and efficient the whole time we were there. The food was served in a timely fashion. It's not overly loud or noisy so it's a good place to go on dates as well. The service and food here is always commendable. I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone looking for good food and good service and an all-around good time!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. My delicious Shrimp Capellini!
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. My boyfriend&#39;s dish! I think it was the Atlantic Salmon pasta dish? Pretty good, but I liked my Shrimp Capellini more :P

axVhDtJOA6zDeqMyTFP-lA.text: Family friendly, excellent service and owners who were friendly and took the time to chat with us.  The calamari was great! Even our 3 year old grand-daughter and 6 year old grandson loved it.  The waitress told us that we could order sundaes for the kids (not on the menu, so ask for them).  They cost $1.50!  I highly recommend this restaurant.  However, don't go on Saturday (especially with children) as the wait can be long.  Go on Monday with kids because they eat free.

GtpR-VL38WMqpXS3Zb1LuA.text: A team lunch, and 3 of us has gotten food poisoning.  I was the first, called yesterday and spoke to manager Christian who sounds like a high school kid who only kept saying "we'll look into this" and "go see a doctor".  Finally I said I'm calling you in good conscious that there's an issue with your food, and finally I told him I will know when I need to go see a doctor.  Talking to this guy was like being in a car accident, where he kept side stepping to admit any responsibility or even basic acknowledgement that the restaurant could make you ill within minutes of leaving.  The next day, I learned 2 more coworkers are ill, one who is ill with fever and throwing up.  I just called again to update Christain, and literally I quote him "awesome, excellent.  We'll look into this".   FOR THE LACK OF PROFESSIONALISM OR COURTESY, I will not be eating here again and will redirect my peers to do the same.

hJRmizVrF4PEY6ohMtd2EA.text: Was very impressed tonight. The place was crowded on a Sunday night. Food was great, quantities great and service was good. We had a large group of 10 and the place accomdates large groups. The salad that comes with entree was awesome. All the food had great flavor and was very resonably priced. Go to Rigatonys it will be worth your time and money.  Food 4 Service 4 Quantity 5

_NSkW87CmzJnajLWe7u7bQ.text: If you are not sure what to order, you should try the Tour of Rigatony's, you will not be disappointed!

Ao8trJ3sqtfmgojtbFPRew.text: Pasta is SO fresh. I love the cheese ravioli with tomato cream sauce. Bread is excellent too. Nothing bad on the menu!

1cce7NN0zpJBvRCbGcVB7w.text: This is the go-to Italian place for my wife and I on date nights in the east valley.  They also have great lunch specials each weekday.  The baked rig is the best and the salad and bread that come with every order are fantab!  As a special touch they have about a dozen different fresh herbs going out front that you can smell while you wait to be seated.  Be prepared  for a long wait on almost any day of the week for dinner.

wIZl9XA3cOMJvWvOmJADXA.text: Incredible dinner experience. The salad is a great start, I had the Chicken Marsala and it was very rich and tender. We started at the bar and were greeted with smiles from the bartenders while we waited for our table. Great service, once seated at our table we were met with a very attentive waitress. She was laughing and having fun with the customers. So refreshing to see!! This was my first time here and I would definitely go back. If you are looking for a great meal and friendly staff then sit back and enjoy this place. Highly recommended!!

mNn7r5Rfa2pshtaStbbRZg.text: I went here not knowing what to expect. Anyways, the antipasto salad was really good. My family loved the hot fresh bread. I would say the pasta was good. Not great. The one thing I loved was the Italian sausage. It had a little kick to it and was good. The service was good. I'll be back for sure

0bjIrcWXeSdxRm1WKgpflA.text: Wait can be very long in the evening but lunches are good. Food here is amazing. Excellent Italian food is hard to find & you can find it here. I typically order the seafood Alfredo as it is very addicting with shrimp, scallops, & white fish. I think it would be even more awesome with crab & lobster if they can manage it.

JCOIPWR6WLmmPv5pKGEn2A.text: Average, mediocre Italian food. But they truly set themselves apart with their asinine policy of charging extra for those that choose to split a dish. I don't understand how this is justified, instead of offering a lower priced option that comes with a little less food. If you want to charge a split fee when you have an alternative on the menu, I can understand that. But forcing everyone to order their own entree or charge them extra is ridiculous, and even if I thought their food was better than average I would never go back to a place that has such a bad policy. Pretty sure it doesn't cost you more to prepare the dish whether I split it or not. Will not be returning.

w5jDxI6foRCZzEAymlneCw.text: Just attempted to have lunch. I asked for the chick parm and the pasta with light on the Marinara it came out heavey sauce when I brought it to the goofy waitress she laughed at me. When she came back with the second order I asked her why she laughed and she denied it. I had one bite in my mouth and a big goon manager came over to defend the girl and argue with me. I stuck the knife in the chicken and bolted with the goon manager following me out the rotten door. People who like this amateur place are Olive Garden fans.  Welcome to the Valley of the Dummies!!

VUiVUXVsOn2rekEsRxRKpg.text: We really like this restaurant. The food is consistently good and the service is too. We love the relaxed neighborhood atmosphere, perfect for groups and for families with kids. Bread and salad with your meal is a nice touch, they have a punch card system for a free entree, and a great patio. The missing star is because the pizza is kind of expensive, they often have looong wait times, and they have few if any beers on tap.

0wMp-Ic3y3FBE_2Ap7BOyA.text: Great find! Fast service, great food, and did I say great food?? I tired the Tour and it was not only tasty, but stuffed me! Reasonably authentic experience.

7XUYr2wfL75bdMC5ZCJuEg.text: I'm visiting from out of town and found this gem. It was great from frozen belini and fried ravioli to the salad to the Tour of Rigatony (of which I shared with a friend...more than enough food). Amazing food and great atmosphere and service!

P8ld9iaaXxOTq17yyeqiYg.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurants in Tempe. A lot of vegetarian options. Few different salad options along with Brussels sprouts and few different pasta options with artichoke hearts and basil. Very nice bread served with olive oil. Tiramisu was very tasty.

0RZCt97lWkfpdy1E-gMbRg.text: I love Rigitony's. They have good, homemade pastas. They have great lunch specials. Its affordable and fresh. I have not had the pizza. My favorite is the baked spaghetti and meatballs. Fresh and chunky marinara is amazing. I would take this place over most major italian places.

8HwtOjW5waWhabOSzjFpUw.text: By far the best itallian food in the valley. When you get tired of Olive Garden and Carrabas come home to this place to find out what you have truly been missing. Come early cause you may have to wait as they are always packed, parking lot too... Me and my family have eaten in and out several times and cant find one single issue in the past three years. Their service and prices will make every second waited well worth your while.  Perfect date nite spot to take the little lady, ask for their wine menu and go to town with lots of imported favorites direct from Italy!

iSpucyiJB7kXfjlmJkrTUA.text: Nice place, I like the remodel. The service was great, food was good. The lunch specials include several good deals. I went for a late lunch so service was fast with only a few customers.

FkY-lfxaYYz2yGqo7UAvhg.text: Excellent service, GREAT food!!!  Blows Olive Garden outta the water.  Breadsticks are better, salad is better, desert is better, and larger portion at similar, if not cheaper prices.  All this without the average Joe riff-raff.  Only con, tight confined dining area.  Good location in Tempe/Chandler though, but thats cuz i live 1 mile away   :)

2GFmJpEcfprnMS2FeOO2nQ.text: My first time to RigaTony's and I'm a fan. Great service, good food (Chicken Parmesan with Spaghetti with Marinara), and decent price.

iQUEXSjSFfneyX2FXQtDXw.text: A Chandler favorite.. and one of my favorites as well!  I love (you guessed it) the Rigatony w/sausage.  Make sure to dine in because the salad is included and its AMAZING!  They have great "dinner for two" meal combos too.  One time they messed up our take out order and gave us Rigatony Pizza instead of the Rigatony pasta dish.  We ate it anyways and loved that too.  I have yet to be disappointed by anything on their menu.

uOSi3YmqicH0SXi6LcM_Ng.text: Okay, Food gets a 4 star- SERVICE gets ONE STAR! It's too bad I like their food so much or I would vow to NEVER return. Every experience (about four or five) has been a complete nightmare. There service has been soooooo slow! I mean, 2.5 hours for two people to sit and eat Italian food is just not okay! And that is after you wait 30-45 minutes to sit down. The servers seem to lack experience and don't tend to your table very well...you can expect to be waiting for drink refills and wait and wait and then beg. I have even talked to managers there about their awful or lack of service and it was like they could care less what I was saying. I even emailed the Owner or Manager per the email address on the site about the worst restaurant experience in my life (and I dine out at least once a day) and I did not even get the courtesy of a response. A simple, I'm sorry to hear that happened to you would have been all I was looking for. I was so upset I have not eaten there since. I dont' care that their food is good; service is key, and treating your customers like they're disposable is not okay with me. If you are thinking about eating here, please carefully consider if you want to have a good chance of ruining your night and that you may also have a disaster experience at this restaurant. Hopefully this will save someone some agony.

eLZ0etwLUTtXGWS-35Y2ew.text: after reading all the good reviews on yelp, we thought we would give it a try.  i have to admit, i was very underwhelmed. we got the 4 cheese penne, which just looked like they have taken cream and poured it over pasta and then topped with a few sprinkles of parm cheese.  it had almost no flavor.  the portion is also much smaller than i would have expected for $12.50. we also got the baked rigatony with chicken, and it had a very odd flavor.  i couldn't put my finger on what it was, but i really didn't enjoy it at all. probably the best part of the dinner was the bread, which had a nice garlic topping.  it was nice and soft and fluffy. i'm glad we tried it, but i we won't be going back.

es0zjdtMVwWg3iz3tc0VgA.text: The new and improved RigaTony's is open for business.   Located in the former Tres Margaritas location in South Tempe, the restaurant looks like it has been redone from top to bottom and feels more open.  There is a nice bar area and while not opened yet they are working on some outside seating just in time to enjoy the spring weather.  The food is main stream down home italian.  The place was busy and I asked the server and she mentioned since opening on April 1, they have had up to 2 hour waits. I am sure it will settle down but it would not hurt to call for a reservation for dinner.  I will definitely be surprising a friend with a trip here for lunch.  Overall a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

HeJjc0Og0rSy7Q-i8TLy5A.text: Best authentic Italian food ever. Moderate prices, friendly staff and great food. Can never go wrong with the Tour Of RigaTony's plate.

z-qptveJjj8_z3hjxFxUCg.text: Reminded me of a toned down Buca-di-Beppo , good atmosphere , pleasant staff and copious amounts of food. The olive oil with the bread was very good. Salad was good Lasagne...ok The choice of wine was a let down.

JUjwddqEeaukEenD-rFWpA.text: Very good Italian food.  Never had a bad dish there.  The atmosphere has just the right feel to it.  Not chain restaurant, but not overly quirky either.  Just a nice comfortable place to sit, eat and converse.

M5RX-LPCjliff7FP0pIWCw.text: Surprise! A decent, reasonably priced Italian restaurant in Arizona. Finally, I can have the fresh, filling pasta I have been craving without driving to Scottsdale, worrying about what I am wearing and having a heart attack when the bill rolls 'round. I had the linguini in clam sauce - the tomato sauce! I don't like the white clam sauce and can't ever find the red sauce - let alone one so perfectly spiced. The rest of my table thoroughly enjoyed their dishes as well - especially the baked pasta speciality, which my husband said he will get without meat next time because you don't need it. Why not five stars? Because it was crazy loud, the old booth ate my ass (I felt like I was sitting on the floor) and the waitress seemed like she'd rather be anywhere else. Thank goodness for the food!

ANwkiPlzmYTqNWnMXCMfWQ.text: I had lunch here with my buddies on Saturday afternoon and the service from our server was great.  We had ordered the clams for an appetizer it took a little bit to get to the table the sauce was great and clams were good.  One of my friends ordered the Raging Bull, my other friend ordered the tour of rigatony's and I got the veal picatta because I love good veal and usually get it at other italian restaurants.  The salad starter and bread that come out before our meals were good and we were hungry and excited for our main entrees.  As our meal came out, everything looked great so we started eating and the first couple bites of my dish were good the pasta wasn't overcooked the sauce was sweet and complemented the veal picatta.  After the first couple bites, my third bite was a really chewy piece of meat and didn't taste right and that is when I spit it out and looked at it in my dish and saw that it was raw!  I couldn't believe it so I showed my friends and they both agreed we should tell the server it was raw.  So we called her over and the first thing she said was "Oh my!" I apologize can I get you something else so I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs thinking after eating that I didn't want to run the risk again so I'll get something easy that should be an issue.  The manager on duty came by and asked me about it and she said have you had our veal before almost as if I had never eaten veal before.  So I replied I've eaten veal numerous occasions and have not had it here before so she said well a lot of customers love our veal.  I said that may be True and I liked the first couple bites until I got into the center and it was raw.  So she said she notified the chef and he knew about it.  She asked if I would give them another chance to get me the same thing and I said I had already ordered the spaghetti with meatballs since I didn't want to run the risk of getting raw veal again.  After that the server approached the table and I wanted to confirm I wasn't being overly picky and the server said "Oh yeah it was raw and I apologize I think it was because they usually pound the meat to make it thinner and the middle part was thick and that's why it wasn't cooked thoroughly.  So I said no problem thank you for getting me the spaghetti and meatballs.  We asked for our check shortly after that and that is when I noticed that they didn't charge me for the veal but they charged me for the spaghetti and meatballs.  Now I'm not one that looks for free meals ever but if there was ever a chance for this place to make it up to me, it would have been on a simple spaghetti and meatballs dish especially when the manager challenged my taste in how the veal dish was cooked. I have to admit I was a little offended.  I eat out all the time and I've never ever had a manager say something like that to me.  My friends couldn't believe it and said that I could have gotten sick and which I agreed so we paid our check and left.  I've been here numerous times and never had any issues in fact I like the place and tell my friends to go here all the time but after this experience I will NOT be coming back.  I couldn't believe the nerve of this manager.  I think the server even understood because as we were leaving she said I think the manager wanted to talk to you.  After having her speak to me like that I did not want to hear from her again.

AwXvs-r9sLucoLBaQx9ZPQ.text: Rigatony's is a staple in my family. Since they have moved locations it has been busier and little longer wait..but it is definitly worth it!! At their old location it was so hard to park and in the middle of downtown Chandler which I personally hate driving through..so when when we found out they were moving we were pelased. In Danielle T's review she said it was a chain and it definitly is not..it is a family owned restuarant here in AZ. Anyways...they bring out Amazzzzzzzzing bread and salad to start! Just the way we like to start our meal :) I always get the Veal with Lemon and Artichokes which is just TO DIE FOR! I always want to venture out but can't ever manage to make myself do so. The husband always orders the Baked Rigatony w/Sausage and he loves it also! The house Chianti is also delicious according to the husband...I dont know though since I dont like red wine. I dont know how anyone could ever say this place is lower quality than Olive Garden? I really feel like she had no place or point of view to be writing that. Rigatony's is AWESOME and we will keep going back :) :)

GQpGRgErWel-xp4rIgK_KA.text: Rigatony's is a great neighborhood place with service as good as its food. Try their excellent appetizers, the antipasto salad, the shrimp scampi and the grilled chicken linguine. They also make killer risotto and great tomato cream sauce. The portions are large and the prices reasonable.

t1yaW_xbf62o8Xg8UXZgPw.text: Food was alright. I got the clams with linguine in white sauce. I prefer whole clams with their shells in this pasta dish but the one here came with the canned clams. It was a little too greasy for my taste and it had too much parmesan cheese on top of it. The salad and bread was pretty good. Probably won't return.

zupPBVu8Lq9JVaWh9vT_1A.text: LOVE!!! This place is awesome. It's great itialian at a decent price in a casual atmosphere. I've never had a bad meal but the Linguini in white clam sauce may very well be my favorite along side the lasagna. They have an excellent house salad as well. I've heard the pizza is good but we've never tried it. Yum... I love this place! I'm so glad we live so close =)

Pqpnp4V9ayNphmZ1wgMShQ.text: Has the good "home-made" taste to it's Italian food. Friendly waitresses, quick service.

XMAslMvD-qbOPzs6NoPTfA.text: Top notch Italian food. I have to admit that when I go there i am not the most adventurous of eaters. I typically get the pasta when i go there, but their angel hair pasta bowl is the best I have ever had. the sauce is deliciously flavored, though more a mix of Chunks of tomato and tomato sauce, while most places just serve up sauce. I'm not a huge fan of places that offer large pieces of tomatoes in places they don't belong, but they aren't heavily found so it doesn't really bother me here. I do know i have friends and family that go here and have been going here for years who order all kinds of dishes and they seem to always love it. The atmosphere feels like a cozy Italian Kitchen and the wait staff is always around.

GY71vuIpBxoRpK3EeqOxxg.text: This is probably my favorite place in the valley to get some Italian food or satisfy my pasta cravings. The lunch menu is cheaper than dinner, but the quantity of food is less. That being said, especially with the bread and salad served prior to the main dishes, you'll still end up with a full stomach + possible leftovers.   I've been to RigaTony's a handle of times and have never had an experience worthy of less than five stars. Food is incredible, as it's both fresh and flavorful. Any dish you get it customizable. Add a sauce, replace a sauce, replace the meat, anything. This is place is suitable for anyone looking to find pasta for vegetarians or those who are looking to have a meat-free meal.   Service is exceptional and the prices are fair. Definitely one of my favorite places in the entire valley.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Antipasto Salad half eaten
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. The best Ciabatta Bread

8g4-_oe0memxv9ykK-4RXA.text: Rigatony's has never been a let down! Their salad is AMAZING! I always get the pizza that's on the lunch menu. Everything I have had here has been good and never have been disappointed

p7lwUPb6KOchQUarJP_IDA.text: Went here on a whim for a friends birthday. It is amazing! This is the BEST Italian food I think I've ever had. We loved everything we had. We had the appetizer trio with fried zucchini, Tortellini and raviolis. They served it with a creamy dill sauce, red pepper sauce and marinara. Delicious. Fresh bread with garlic spread on top. House salad with delicious salami strips and tasty creamy dressing. I had the stuffed manicotti with a pink sauce. Dessert we had apple bread pudding. Everything was fantastic!!!!!!!

wWWOMrUjYhNaZ3__lU1hRA.text: Fantastic pasta choices, tasty.  Salads and soups are also delicious.  Menu covers a wide variety of choices.  A great place for business meetings and celebrations - including larger parties.    Check it out.

HPIDUuDblBCfJD6eD5s6Aw.text: OMG! This is the best Italian seafood we had found in the valley. My husband and I grew up by NY and LA (respectively) eating amazing seafood and never had been able to find a spot in the valley with this quality and flavors. Unfortunately their decor is not the best, they can use an update but hey if you're looking for a great hearty meal, this is the place.

u6o6PsdIXmakpxg_fzNL4A.text: This is a great place for authentic tasting Italian cuisine! The entree appetizer was fried ravioli and was simply scrumptious. The Smoked Salmon Linguini was absolutely delicioso!  I recommend you call ahead for reserve on the weekends because everyone agrees with this place. Will be back for sure!

FZpsC1RO5wF97SZhpj4MSA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. I go every once in a while and decided to go on Sunday during the lunch rush with my kiddos. The food is excellent especially the salad, which I could eat forever and ever. Literally I'm not joking, that's what I feed my kids every night; RigaTony's salad. It's that good and they love it. Gotta love my little rascals!!  But you wanna know what's even better.... our waitress Christina!!! She's pretty great. Overall would recommend her 10/10. Knew what I wanted before I knew it. Brought the bread and salad, had a good attitude, was polite and was nice when my kids were a pain, like I said gotta love them little rascals. Anyways if you go to RigaTony's see if you can get a table in her area as she's just amazing with customers.

5nJgsW8K9JBNZVkL95CasQ.text: The free bread and salad is to die for!!!! I hate that it's so good that I can't control myself so by the time my food comes, I'm somewhat full already.   I don't think there's anything I tried that I don't like so whatever you are in the mood for, just expect it to come out yummy! And especially the sausage!!!   Customer service is amazing! Very accommodating, we had someone in our group that doesn't eat pork so they made her a separate salad with no salami. We also had some substitute and special request (extra sauce on the side because I'm a saucey kind of gal) and the waiter was more than happy to help.   Definitely would return!   Ps my favorite is the clam appetizer and the tour of Rigytonis because I'm indecisive at times.

5PS19CLdlUr4PQxQZfGr4g.text: First time there its a ok place i got there pizza it was okay the thing i did like was there bread. But the restaurant was cute and r waitress was really nice

qKHPfgJ45xMvmX5SqNU71Q.text: Great as always!  Arrive early or expect a wait. Food is homemade and very reasonably priced. And they have a punch card system!

YHs1iFVRVp1zoLCGkiJ6jw.text: We totally forgot about this place for years and discovered it back again.. it's so good to be back.  Foods always so good and so generous.
