EApXeVTlokfeK6HHArQjmg.text: My husband and I wound up here unexpectedly after last night's flooding put our original choice's kitchen out of commission. Rigatony's happened to be close by and on the way home. Absolutely loved it - has the feel of a comfy neighborhood restaurant and   actually serves bread before the meal (rare these days) AND antipasto salad with lovely thin trips of Genoa salami. Service was great - we got a pound of the steamed clams - as fabulous as those in New Jersey where my husband grew up. We each got a baked hoagie - I got chicken and he got sausage - honestly, so large we could've split one. Such a pleasant, unexpected experience.

iOXHu1plEVVqta7f7-LbmA.text: Rigatony's is probably the best Italian in the Tempe/Chandler area.  They have an amazing salad that comes with every meal. You can even buy a bottle of their dressing!  I've been here many, many times and ordered a lot of their menu.  I have not been disappointed.  My favorites are their Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo, Chicken scampi, and cheese ravioli.  They get very busy for dinner, especially on weekends.  Get a reservation or you'll be waiting an hour or more.

cfEeN6z8vbXTOoobbtC1Xw.text: I have been in here three times with three amazing meals. You just can't go wrong! That chicken marsala though . . . I wish my stomach held more food just so I could keep tasting it! The table salad is like no other. Try a Moretti beer for a delicious treat that is hard to find anywhere. The service is always stellar. I can't say enough things about what a great experience this is! Just go already!

yYSn29l-fHu-nI5wtmqT9Q.text: Only because I couldn't give zero.  Over an hour wait at the table.  Unlimited bread is really 4 pieces.  Sigh,  still waiting.

DqN1rkcX5dwYjMHQPAXvMg.text: Went here for the first time yesterday. We were seated promptly and our server, Carlo, was the best. Food was delicious and the portions were much bigger than expected. My son's hoagie was the size of the plate and my seafood pasta dish had plenty of shrimp and scallops. Nothing was disappointing. A new neighborhood favorite!

QtDxpzc-IvvTxdT4JvCoqg.text: We were looking for Italian food later on a Sunday evening and we were lucky enough to find RigaTony's.  Their food and service is amazing!  Love the fresh salad!  We'll be back the next time we're in Phoenix.

q0u4HrvC61-AYGZil89M7Q.text: RigaTony's Authentic Italian restaurant is a great experience!  They have great service, and the prices are great!!  My husband and I love to go there for lunch and feast on their lunch plates!!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. October 22, 2018 with my love!!

e-J5-i8JjLS6QOP2bK2MiA.text: Advertised as authentic Italian. NOT AT ALL. The quality is similar to what you might get on a buffet or in a cafeteria type setting. My noodles where hard and the chicken tasted old. The service was great. I can't blame the waitress for the food. If you are looking for a cheap meal this is the place. I prefer quality over quantity. So will never return.

sg2DJXxVRQqKNJO8aO0K5w.text: Best Italian restaurant in Arizona. I've been coming here since 2015. My go to order is the shrimp fettuccini Alfredo. Seriously the tastiest fettuccini Alfredo I have ever tried. Every time anyone asks me for a good Italian restaurant here, I always tell them rigs!!! My family from Texas is obsessed with this restaurant. Whenever they come down, I always take them here and everyone just loves it so much! RigaTony's has the best salad & bread hands down. I would always come here after school for a salad to go, everything about this restaurant is amazing. Service & food, no complaints. I love going here during lunch time. Portions are great. They never disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo

UvGGyYWlA7LSJ7guB1UW8w.text: Great food decent prices. Fast service and the bread is amazing! Fresh and the serving sizes are good too. Enough for maybe 2 people depending how hungry you get. Overall I am glad I found this place because I have been wanting a new Italian place to go to!

uORC59CjXotnRGlxTJBB8g.text: If you want good Italian in the Phoenix area this is where you need to go. The food was delicious I left very satisfied. Portions are huge. Will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Complimentary salad for the table.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. The seafood pasta is really really good!!!

n9gylch4qgDgCXSCmx0c3Q.text: Location: Riga Tony is my favorite Italian restaurant in Arizona. It is located nearby Warner and 101 freeway with plenty of parking. The restaurant is very well decorated. Each table has different unique lamps hanging from the ceiling with lots of booths for a party of four as well as big tables for huge parties for families and friends.   Service: servers have excellent service and check up on tables very often. They constantly stop by to pick up dishes that were done and refill your drinks at your request. This place is extremely busy during lunch and dinner time up with up to an hour wait. I suggest you to call in few hours ahead to avoid the wait.   Food: I always get their 2 lbs garlic clam as an appetizer at every single visit. When you finish the clams, you still can enjoy it by dipping their delicious bread in the garlic clam sauce. If you aren't a friend of garlic or on a date, this dish is probably not for you. Their salad is absolutely tasty.   Rating: what more can I say? This is the BEST Italian restaurant in town!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious Garlic Clam

c0D9WXyyU0-STCZnDYeINA.text: We love this place generally bit tonight the service was not so good.  Our waiter was so not in the mood to talk or listen or apparently be at work. Everything came out correctly but he had absolutely no personality.  Kinda ruined my time there. I wanted more salad but never had the opportunity to ask for it. I also wasn't done eating and he took my food to put it in a box to go.  Kinda just felt like we were bothering him.

sKbZ2iCDLJh_xZhkolb39Q.text: Rigatonys is such a cute dinner and lunch place. The service is always quick and their food is amazing. Last night I had the seafood fettuccine with the red pepper cream. That is absolutely my favorite sauce. Never disappoints. Dinner is served with salad and bread and you can never finish the portions.   If you're a regular, get the stamp card!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seafood fettuccine with red pepper cream

usnM_R1l_UplfiHeMAKEtA.text: I highly recommend this place for an amazing Italian food with a high quality service.

LmLQzeRuiHtS2YOM306LpA.text: Favorite place for Italian food, the Calamari is excellent and I have become a huge fan of the Tour of Rigatoni plate as it's a fantastic combination of the best the restaurant has to offer. Very good service as well as stylish and their bread is very good.

ui1LbpHu2pk17WGdtXNfOg.text: Things have changed. I am a "card carrying" Diner Deluxe Member of Rigatony's restaurant. We have been good customers of theirs for many years. The food is as good as ever but the service, atmosphere and price has changed, and not for the better. One of the perks of being a Diner Deluxe Member is that you can make reservations for party's of two. A couple nights ago we arrived at our reserved time a few minutes early. We were told it would be a "few minutes" before they could seat us. That is normal and fine with us. But our wait exceeded a half hour. Many parties of two that had no reservations were seated before us. When our "turn" finally happened there was no "sorry for the wait" or any indication there was a problem. It seemed we were more of a problem for them than a valuable customer. The price of food has gone up, it is too crowded for sure, and it has become a less than pleasant experience for us to dine there. It is unlikely we will return.

M6MOdoHT9xemWtvVGQc33Q.text: The anti-pasto salad is the best ever! Great service great food great value. There is almost always a wait in the evenings but they do take reservations which I definitely recommend. Mid to late afternoon it's not that busy during the week but weekends are also crowded. Daily specials give you a chance to try Everything at a discounted price.

R0DqNHO-QvLKfROhocou0A.text: Looked at reviews on Yelp & decided to stop in. We were promptly seated & were asked what we wanted to drink. After a quick browse through the menu, we settled on the Eggplant Parmesan, the Baked Rigattoni with chicken, & the Cheese Ravioli with the tomato cream sauce. All of these meals came with an antipasto salad and bread.  The food came came out in a pretty quick amount of time. Everything was good. The Eggplant Parm tastes a little bit off ... I think because it was slightly undercooked. The sauce it was covered in was pretty good, however. The Baked Rigattoni was kind of the same way - the garlic sauce with the chunky tomatoes tasted good but I was not impressed with the chicken. It was tasteless & could have been left off. Lastly, the Cheese Ravioli was good as was the tomato cream sauce, however it confused me as to why there was an additional cost associated with it.  As far as the restaurant itself - it is very much a family place & has that atmosphere. The decor is very outdated. I'm undecided as to whether or not I'll be back. It was good .. Just not exciting enough to go back. Not anytime soon anyway.

Sa4SA3uC83plQsQXSfGOCw.text: I have eaten in and really enjoyed. I have done the take out deal and it was so good too. What was also great was catering with them. I was at an aniversary party for Lori and Jeff Lane at their home. It was so very Yummy.

UHkXBwtMZtXS61TGH677Hw.text: Been eating here since their original location for 12 years. True. Authentic. Italian. I'll make this review short and sweet, otherwise it would be multiple paragraphs long and no one would read it. My family is from New Jersey, I love Italian, I AM Italian, best Italian restaurant in the valley. from the homemade dressing on the exceptional salad for which I have actually purchased by the bottle and took home, to the tender love and care they put in each dish, its exceptional. Some of my favorite dishes are as followed in no particular order- fried ravioli, anything Alfredo, penne rosa with sausage, shrimp capellini, and although I don't eat them, my grandfather sears by their mussels and clams.  How much more Italian does it get than that? PS I no longer live in the east valley, and still drive 40 minutes when I'm able just for a meal. Lunch specials are also great ! Thanks RIgatony's!

041F6wbQFEKHLXBG_EPohQ.text: Introduced my mom to yelp tonight and had her pick a spot for her birthday dinner- this is the spot she settled on.   While family style restaurants aren't really my thing, I will say that this place is a nice example of one. The place was nice and clean, we got a table right away and were greeted by a friendly waitress.   My mom went with an early bird special that included bread and a nice antipasto salad. There was also happy hour wine for only $3, you can't beat that even for well wines that's a great deal. Dinner came out quickly and was quite nice- very much like an Olive Garden type menu. They brought out a lovely apple bread pudding dessert for her as a birthday treat   If you want a family style affordable Italian place, you'll enjoy this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mom and her bday dessert

bmWmmfbZQyA3NjePsLap8g.text: The two of us went early on a Saturday evening (4:45) and were surprised when the hostess told us it would be a 30 minute wait. The wait seemed to be a factor of multiple large groups of prom-bound teenagers with reservations and separately, an obscene amount of takeout orders (mostly salads and some sort of sub sandwich?). Our 30 minute wait time ended up being 50 minutes, but we were hungry, and we were already so deep in, we continued to wait.   Immediately when the gentleman seating us brought us to our table, he stated they would like to give us a complimentary appetizer of our choice as a thank you for waiting (note, we did NOT complain about the wait time since it seemed like the restaurant was just having an unusually busy sort of night). We opted for the fried raviolis and were happy campers for the remainder of our dining experience.   We enjoyed the fried raviolis, complimentary bread and delicious (unlimited?) antipasto salad, a raspberry flavored Italian soda, a couple of beers, the Taste of Rigatony platter, and the deep dish lasagna with meat sauce. We also had the chocolate hazelnut cake to go.   Our server was busy but very friendly and attentive. The prices were impressive for the quality and portion size. Not sure if they take reservations for small parties, but it might be worth a shot next time we go (either way, there will definitely be a next time!).

_3h5OKFhxVle5pK_6P_2Lw.text: Love this place. I have always driven by this place but never stopped by.  Great place. Seating outside is a little noisy next to the road.  One of the best Italian restaurants I have dined at.  Try the fried ravioli  and baked rigatoni. Home made pasta and sauces blend beautifully. Definitely recommended. The chicken Marsala is good too. Replaced the pasta with mashed potatoes.

5B3kvGdlSHsD48R77LLhtQ.text: They said the wait was 40-45 minutes but got seated an hour and a half later. And when I checked in for the time at 50 minutes they said it'd be an extra 20. Then continued to add 10 minutes after that 20 was done. Never coming here again. Good thing there was a delicious Dunkin Donuts right next door.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. They said the wait was 40-45 minutes but got seated an hour and a half later.

bKetyA8WZi3wdi3qbHI6mg.text: We just moved to Tempe from Scottsdale and every time we drive by this place the parking lot was packed  so we had to check it out. And so glad we did! Delicious food at a great price that includes yummy bread and an amazing antipasto salad. We are regulars now, have been there for happy hour and dinner a dozen times and it's consistently good. The wait staff is very friendly, nice to eat at a family owned restaurant that's delicious. Make reservations or you will have a long wait!!

rwMzMZ5SZdpRJoZciMbWTA.text: First off, let me start by saying how pathetic and funny some of these negative reviews are. A vegan going to an italian restaurant? Are you kidding me?! Cheese and meat are just about the main ingredients in all italian food! Anywho, I hope everyone can see past those kinds of reviews.  The wife and I went in here on a late Sunday afternoon. Our server, I believe her name was Sophie, was phenomenal! Genuinely happy to serve us and extremely tentative. We ordered the house Chianti, RigaTony's plate, and manicotti. The wine was very good, the salad was one of the best salads I've had in a restaurant, the rigatoni was excellent and the manicotti was so delicious! We were treated to a free cannoli because I went on their website and entered my phone number.  We will be back!

xuvWrrwMjtjyQeI_H533vA.text: We've been to RigaTony's more than a few times. Grandma C likes to switch it up sometimes so instead of going to O.G. we come here. On this visit there was a wait. It was a Sunday night around 6:30 and we ended up waiting about 15 minutes before being sat. It was really no problem because there were some supper nice people waiting as well. We just chatted it up until our buzzer went off. We ended up getting sat at the same middle table that we've been sat at 3 times before. It's kind of funny that we've been here 7 times but have only sat at 3 different tables.  This time our server was Tricia seemed a bit "distracted". Not a bad server but you could definitely tell there were a hundred places she would have rather been.  We enjoyed the pasta salad the comes with the meals. Actually, my favorite thing about RigaTony's.  C ordered Spaghetti with Meat Balls, Sub Rigatony ($13.95). Not sure how they came up with the price but I guess subbing Rigatony costs an additional $1.49. The pasta was cooked fine and C likes the sauce and meat balls just fine. Not sure the portion size was worth $13.95. Grandma C and K both ordered the Penne Rosa ($14.50 ea). Basically it's Penne with broccoli, peas, mushrooms & sausage in a tomato cream sauce, topped with asiago cheese. K liked the dish well enough. The pasta was cooked correctly. Her only comment was that the portion size did not warrant the price. Grandma C thought the dish was too spicy. I'm not sure if the spice was in the marinara or the sausage but either way she was less than happy with the dish. I ordered the Linguine with Clam Sauce ($14.95). I liked my dish. The pasta was cooked correctly. There were a lot of clams in the dish and the parmesan cream sauce was pretty tasty. Another thing that I was disappointed in was the bread. The slices are just too big and really doesn't have a flavor that's any better than your local grocery store variety. One last note. C ordered a Strawberry Lemonade. We got charged 50 cents for the Strawberry flavoring. I searched my pockets but there weren't any more nickels and dimes. Apathetic Service. Great Salad. Average Pasta. Good Linguine & Clams. Lousy Bread. Portion size not warranting Prices. Nickel & Dimed. 2.5 Stars.

6cH5PVb6l9CysM511NLNIg.text: Pretty consistent food every time. You get the salad and bread with your meal (meh). The service has always been great. I ordered the four cheese penne once and it came with a thin watery white sauce which was very disappointing. However, if you know what to order and what to avoid you can get great food. The baked rigatony is great although they used to offer the choice of chicken, sausage or broccoli. Now it comes automatically with sausage. I really like the spaghetti capone which is a very basic dish: butter, garlic, olive oil and anchovy. They make this well also. One more great option is quinoa or whole wheat pasta for those avoiding wheat. You can also sub the pasta for green beans, which I have done and with the delicious tomato sauce it's a more filling and nutritious option.

4rMZBwLgUsTSR-yQsll5Qg.text: havent ate many different things here but this place gets 4 stars solely based on and because they offer the king of all sammiches. cicero street combo sammich. the king of all sammiches, italian sausage, meatballs, marinara, mozzerella, pepperonis, and behold the frizzled peppers ftw. nomnomnom!!!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. cicero street combo sammich, the king of all sammiches. nomnomnom!!!

9VJKgNDcbPwmgfunpDjtZQ.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would. Service is everything, and unfortunately they significantly missed the mark. We had a reservation for over 3 weeks for the private dining room. We arrived about 10 minutes before our confirmed time only to be told that our party was moved to a regular table. The manager/owner was unapologetic and merely offered an appetizer for this mishap. What made this even more frustrating is the reservation was confirmed the day before. As much as we love the food, we won't be visiting this establishment again.

ax2pkrfYeaHUROCYYK_H2A.text: Rigatony's is an old standby for our family. We ate the Chandler location all the time when my mom worked in that area, and my husband and I ate at the Mesa location near our old house when we were first married. Now Rigatony's is only located in Tempe in what seems like an old Olive Garden. It's not a place that I would go to voluntarily, but it works really well for family dinners with relatives who have simpler tastes. Anything to avoid going to a chain restaurant!  My mom always gets the baked rigatony with sausage, their signature dish. I've had it with broccoli, but it's not quite the same. The cheese ravioli, however, is a good vegetarian dish (or you could add a meat sauce). It's homemade and had lots of ooey gooey cheese inside in addition to the creamy ricotta. Their marinara is good, and I like the chunks of tomatoes in it. My husband gets their gluten free quinoa pasta and is happy with it. My dad was very happy with the cappellini pescatore. He went through half a loaf of ciabatta to soak up the garlic sauce. The house chianti is a good value because you get a liter carafe which is an extra glass more than a standard bottle. Like the restaurant, the wine isn't a standout, but it does the job just fine.

ZV9dI3-j97bkvi2oQdrKIA.text: Stopped by RigaTony's while on vacation in the Phoenix area. What a gem! This was probably the best meal I have ever had! The baked rigatoni with sausage was amazing; just enough heat wth the sausage to make it a little spicy. My husband had the seafood linguine which was also top notch. The salad and bread were both incredibly fresh and added to the meal. Service was good and the wait time was reasonable. Overall, I'll be back every time I'm near Phoenix and I'll dream of the Alfredo sauce until I return!

WzlyjZq4u_FsGvgl5fophA.text: This was my first time here. Went with a large group of friends to celebrate a 60th birthday. I was greeted nicely, had fun looking at the fun little gifts in baskets near the front,pastas, sauces, treats etc. I got a few gifts. Then walked to our area as first to arrive. Nice table, service was exceptional. All of us Separate Checks all of those different kinds of orders different drink orders no one the same. They kept track of everyone they kept on top of service the entire time they were kind and friendly not in the way but being also very present. We asked him to take pictures of our group together they did period from beginning to end it was great service great staff I would absolutely go back to this place. It's set up Italian style or at least it feels that way. Every kind of pasta and sauce Italian food Galore. The price was Fair. I will definitely go back

LtvW1Rl54T0KVIYYumJXwQ.text: Not bad, sat at a bar table. Food was mediocre at best. If your a New Yorker you will agree. As our local pizza joint is better than this.   Liked the salad, could have used more. Bread was weak. Clams good. Chicken Marsala tasteless.   Bartender / waiter was very attentive.

dd9LKjO0S2EDBN4v5r9axA.text: We have been there many times. We have always had excellent service I usually get the Chicken  Parmesan. Last night we met some friends we were a a little late. Our friends already ordered their meals. The sever put a hold on the meals so They would come out together.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rigatonys

VG6dsi9kyXIUnw4xQiRzMA.text: Best Italian restaurant in the Valley. You get a salad with every meal and the main dishes are always superb; especially the Chicken parmesan.

QGaq9RuWnXTIqbYO0Fc_-w.text: Showed up with a large party one late afternoon and the hostess went out of her way to help us get settled in a very professional and friendly way.  We were taken care of by all employees wonderfully and enjoyed a memorable and tasty meal.  Their patio is a marvelous space and even in warm weather is comfortable and shaded in the afternoon with a misting system.  This place is a real family friendly Italian gem!

HVBdqltw1vrXp3NLX8GLiA.text: I love this place because of the good food, salad is excellent and everything else. Can't complain about the service especially the waiters who has been here for a while. They help you by making suggestions and making pleasant conversation.  Today was an exception. We were waited by someone who is fairly new, and just did not have a friendly attittude. I almost left the place.  Management please speak with your newly hired female waitress.   Thanks.

m1EQRQd0AV-2VY2l4PAhdw.text: Excellent food and great atmosphere! The Rigatony Dish is fantastic! We order it every time! The bread is delicious and we have never been disappointed.

eWoequiUN1PvUCA7IBFa-Q.text: Delicious food and always great service !! I love the salad fresh bread and spaghetti and meatballs. I would recommend this place for those who like Italian

L_W-3Pf0BXULHruc9T5xow.text: The staff is super accommodating and patient! I was able to pull off a last minute surprise dinner for my mom with the help of the awesome hostess (I wish i knew her name) and our server Jess!   The food was great! The fried calamari was so tender i was tempted to order one more as just my meal with their enormous salad portion. My brother and i shared the fettuccine, and i was surprised that they split it for us into different bowls! (How much more accommodating can this place get?)   For desert we got the cannoli's and apple bread pudding, which were both amazing and gone in under 60 seconds.

rCkaoA8ykwket8ZA0o2JfQ.text: We did a catering order for our Halloween party and the food was okay no supper impressed the food could use a little more salt and more flavor. The crew was very nice when I picked up the food but overall it wasn't a WOW!! Although the salad was AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. The spread of dishes from rigatony&#39;s

_SIZ1tT2QJx0OFj_xuQ7kQ.text: Very good Italian food. Fast service from the kitchen. Ask for the family style menu. You can't feed four people cheaper than that. Great job Rigatony's staff!

rbHvtPDuKqXDB7O0bIlgSA.text: The worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. The manager has no class and was hostile when asked why two people ordering and appetizer and and entree are being charged a $3 share fee. She approached us on the defensive and had the host with her.  I have never felt attacked by any restaurants staff ever in my life. The manager needs to be fired. Never got to  even get a drink. Our server was Erika who seemed nice but there was no reason to escalate to such a horrible manager especially over a $3 SHARE FEE. AWFUL WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD. AS A GUEST I WAS HUMILIATED.

iaCpkzZUrnmoKSC1IJVUvg.text: Oh the pasta-bilities..... That's what we had for lunch. Built our own pasta bowls. Angel hair pasta with clams in a garlic and butter sauce.  Sooo good and I couldn't finish the whole bowl due to the fabulous antipasto salad and bread. That lunch was so delicious.  Olive Garden eat your  out uggggh.

qMWh2dK139aWjiGFX8-a7A.text: LOVE RIGATONY'S! This is our family's absolute favorite Italian restaurant. About a year ago my husband told me he wasn't a huge fan (which shocked me bc we'd been going for so long and he never complained) but then we went to Olive Garden for some event and he said that now he truly appreciates RagaTony's after tasting Olive Garden's food. Their house salad is awesome! We will buy bottles of their dressing when we leave (but it has to be consumed within a week bc there are no preservatives in it.) We will get the "Tour of RigaTony's" when we go. It has chicken piccata (that one is my favorite), lasagna, fettuccini, and some sort of sausage. For dessert I love their Cappuccino Pie (which is very rich and there's a lot of, so split it with someone or with a group!) or their bread pudding for the non-coffee fans.

Q--srxg_s8dEu0AAOXTg1Q.text: Just went in here to ask the bartender for a menu to decide if I'm going to eat here. And I asked her for a menu and she wouldn't look up from her side work to greet me or take a moment to hand me a menu. I walked out and decided to go to the hostess stand to inform them of my experience. Told the manager and he told me none of his staff would treat anyone that way. So basically he was calling me a liar! I said sir! Look at her that is how she remained when I went up to her. She is frowning and looking down! Same stance as I explained to you!

YewcfcxbM7Pw6FBYbHEkdA.text: I've been coming to this restaurant since 2001 and it's the first place I recommend to anyone visiting from out of state. Every plate I've ordered is delicious and absolute authentic Italian meals. You immediately taste the difference and how truly special this place is at first bite. There is a few promos going on right now with purchasing gift cards. One is, if you purchase a $50 gift card, you receive a free Baked Rigatony for 2 people. I didn't realize however, that you may not use the gift card until 12/24. But because this restaurant is such a one of a kind eating establishing, I want my good friends to enjoy it right away and that meant sacrificing my freebie Baked Rigatony coupon. I politely asked in person if the free Baked Rigatony coupon could be switched to have the 12/24 date, but I was told no after asking politely in person. I'm not sure what the harm would be in asking to switch it, but it is what it is. And I could honesty say that this is the only down side to Rigatony's: they are so popular and ever so busy that they could do without with a loyal customer here and there. When I came in today in person, I wasn't able to actually speak to a manager. Seating hostess when to go find a manager and with a big smile on her face, she took off the 12/24 date off of the gift certificate and collected my Baked Rigatony for 2 coupon. I guess the answer was a "No."  I don't feel the love after almost 20 years, but I'll be back! :-)

EZ32rZkvKH0lioujnfMkuA.text: May 3, 2018 It's been ten years since my last review of Rigatony's- and probably since my last visit- that I see that the two locations have merged into just one and has a new Tempe address- well, seven years' new! I swear the current location used to house an Olive Garden-- I remember walking under the cobblestone arch distinctly... Very happy to report that the antipasto salad is still terrific, perfectly dressed with an Italian vinaigrette made in-house! yelp.com/user_local_phot... Table bread, topped with a healthy dusting of cheesy/buttery herbs, was good, and the only thing that would've made it better is if it was served warm. yelp.com/user_local_phot... I liked that server Alexis poured out the delicious olive oil for me. I'd arrived between 4 and 5 pm, and that made me qualify to order from the Early bird special- the Pick-A-Pasta for $9.95. Entrees come with antipasto salad and ciabatta. Vacillated between ordering the fettuccine with meat sauce and meatballs, or the penne with Alfredo and chicken, until Alexis found out that the meat sauce contained celery (and possibly mushrooms, too), so it was the Alfredo, and it was heavenly! yelp.com/user_local_phot... Roux was perfect consistency and wasn't overly-salted. The chicken was cooked well, too- not too tender and not too chewy. Would order this again, but not until I try other pasta-bilities! New-graduate Alexis was a delight to have as a server. However, I did have to wait a long time for my check. The restaurant was busy, with large parties filling up the room I was dining in. Since I was distracted by messaging a few friends and relatives, I'd not noticed that from the time I'd had my fill and asked for boxes to-go and for the table check, to signing the check, 45 minutes went by! I felt bad, because the long wait made me arrive a few minutes' late to meet friends at Mango Rabbit for boba tea...

YOIx4sezrCLUuV4AFkxT-g.text: I don't know how I've been in the Phoenix area for almost a decade and this is my first time trying RigaTony's. All I can say was the whole experience was INCREDIBLE!  I love mom and pop style Italian food and this is the real deal. We got the fried hot peppers to start, and they served us delicious warm bread with dipping oils and salad while we waited do our entrees. Everything was so good and each ingredient added a lot of flavor.  I ordered the baked rigatoni based on a recommendation and it was so flavorful and delicious. My husband ordered the manicotti and said it was perfect. We didn't have room for dessert, but their cosmo and red wine blend paired well with everything.  We will be back - sooner than later!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baked rigatoni!

5QFJcNfO-6HIcqqKk8Wrog.text: I heard so many things about this place and I wanted to check it out.   My husband and our kids went in a Saturday night around 5pm. It was already getting busy there. Lots of to go orders. To me, as I was waiting, this must be a good thing because obviously people like this place.   You get salad and bread with you order. The salad is so so so good. There's salami chunks in it. Like, I'd go back just for the salad. The bread is coated with some seasonings on top and it was served warm. It was so good.   My husband got the tour plate and he loved it. I got the baked rigatoni and it was BOMB. I also got a raspberry coconut Italian soda and it was so good!   I already want to go back here and as I'm writing this review, it makes me wanna go back nowwwwww!

rJhUvmqEZxbtyvxkWNd_RA.text: I've been at this restaurant about 4 times and never have I had such Sweet spaghetti sauce in any Italian restaurant before.  I asked the server what was making this sauce sooo very sweet and she said they always put honey in the sauce...Honey ???? I've eaten at many Italian homemade sauce before, and never did I ever hear anyone put honey in their sauce.............Well to say the least it was very un enjoyable !!  Everyone else at the table ordered other items and the salad and bread were very delicious.

U4FrBxJJZRGpTilMH03vwg.text: I want to thank you, RigaTony's, for always saving me with a quite regular dinner option to-go order.  When in the area and there's no time to cook dinner, I can easily pick up your Lasagna Feast dinner to go, and it's always fabulous, including the Hazelnut cake.  Always ready within 15 mins, and we stretch it out into two meals, since there are only two of us.  Just want to let you know how wonderful it is!  Oh, and when we have the time, we love to dine at the restaurant as well!  :)

MLTRNJcFZ2JJtIiLz-ZaPQ.text: We have dined here many times and it's always been delicious.... so when it came time to plan a 21st birthday family dinner we decided we wanted to eat at home but we wanted to have good food that we would all love, and Rigatony's was our choice. So, I ordered the food from the listed to-go family dinners, and we picked it up last night at 6 and brought it to the house. It was packed up so well, everything was exactly as we ordered it and it was so delicious and we fed 10 people and still had leftovers! I was very,very pleased.   We love dining at Rigatony's and I would also order the to-go family packs again.

2Voz0F2-4npnlUC8zQymHw.text: Had a great chicken parm with salad and their excellent bread. The service here is impeccable. Love the atmosphere here as well. Definitely will be coming back again.

5XIgu07UaR5TWtys34Jqyw.text: I love Italian food, I'm not Italian. Was a little disappointed. My family has been there, they said it was great!  For me not so much. Service was great, atmosphere as very nice. For me the food was not all that spectacular to me!  I will go back with my family. But not by my self.

Eq2fRzBtoYL7GyPYp_y1SQ.text: Been coming here since before I even moved to Phoenix! Took a chance from my usual favorite dish to try the Seafood Checca..Delicious! Kim did a lovely job of taking care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seafood Checca !

Ruai1mO7j6R17j7VXZ1oVQ.text: Prologue: My fiancee and I were considering where to dine out for date night and also in the mood to try something different in our immediate vicinity. Our online search yielded this result along with some good reviews.  The Plot: We started by sharing an order of the Fried Ravioli appetizer followed by the Chicken Cutlet Picatta and the Smoked Salmon Linguini entrees. We finished the meal with Cannoli for dessert, and then decided to try the Tiramisu as well.  The Scene: Their complementary salad bowl and bread deserve the good reviews they've received. There was plenty for the two of us with lots of salami along with other traditional ingredients that reminded me very much of the salad we had on our dining table at home when I was growing up.  I thoroughly enjoyed the ravioli appetizer, which was fried just enough to be crispy but not tough or chewy. The filling was still moist and the tomato cream sauce on top was light and flavorful but not too strong or acidic, and generous enough for there to be plenty left over for mopping up with some bread.  The non-breaded chicken cutlet was moist, tender, cut easily with a fork, and was topped with lots of mushrooms, tomatoes, and capers. I am very particular when it comes to pasta with sauce and I was completely satisfied all around with the Fettuccini Alfredo.  My fiancee also thoroughly enjoyed her linguini, a generous portion of pasta that was served with chunks of smoked salmon topped with a tomato-dill cream sauce and capers, which complimented the salmon very nicely. As with the fettucini, the consistency and flavor of the pasta and sauce were both very good.  The Rest of the Story: The restaurant had a nice, cozy feeling of home and the service was prompt and courteous.  Having grown up in an Italian household I've enjoyed my share of good cannolis. Therefore, I know it takes lots of practice to prepare them well. Never the less, I  was still optimistic about our order, one of which was made with a traditional ricotta filling and the other with a peach flavored filling. I must say that I did enjoy the traditional ricotta filling, however the shells were not quite up to par, most likely from having been prepared too far in advance of when they were served.  My fiancee is a fan of Tiramisu and so she wanted to try that as well. Although it was good, she was disappointed by the small portion size for the price. She also speculated that it was from Costco and, although I'm pretty sure that wasn't the case, I had to agree that it seemed to be commercially prepared rather than made from scratch on the premises.  Epilogue: It was an enjoyable meal and it was nice to be able to dine out so close to home.  Our review initially showed promise for being 4 stars, however we decided to downgrade it to 3 stars after having been a little disappointed by desert as well as the $70 tab for dinner for two, which consisted primarily of pasta, salad, and bread.  Photo Design: by Billie Z.

Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Cutlet Picatta

qZJL0M6eY5qSk-bjaECl0g.text: I encountered a very low level of service here today.  I called for a simple takeout order around 3pm on a Sunday and was put on hold by the young lady.  After she did not get back with me in over 10 minutes I left and went and got gyros at Arby's instead.  The funny part is I was calling them from out in the parking lot and there were not many cars in the lot at this non busy time ..

TWL_0H54PTAIS2utv4uxMw.text: Wonderful!! First time eating here after reading many positive reviews and was not disappointed!! I needed a restaurant that would take reservations on a crazy weeknight before high school graduation. Family visiting from our of town and I wanted to impress them. The food was DELICIOUS, the portions were large and the prices were amazing! Our server was great! He kept all the drinks full and was polite and speedy. We got in and out with plenty of time to make it to the ceremony and find parking! Will definitely be back again! So many yummy options to choose from!

U959fIfnfDxUAcK0q5lt3g.text: First time going to this restaurant and wow... let me start off by saying that the chocolate hazelnut cake is very rich and delicious! It's a pretty large portion, but if you have a sweet tooth, you definitely won't want to share. Their selection of pasta is great for any family! Very authentic and good for a family dinner or even a date night.

eTnOZVH4hJJdTWKpyGnOCQ.text: Less than impressed.  Service was terrible, food was mediocre.  Arrived and was told 30 minute wait which turned out to be almost 50 minutes.  The hostesses were less than cordial and the waitress was not pleasant.  And these gals were young...they all just appeared miserable and definitely not enjoying having to work.  Salad was pathetic, filled a pasta bowl half way with some lettuce, about a half red onion, 2 pepperoncinis and 2 olives and a ton of dressing, for a table of 4 who we all have entrees, then basically threw some bread on the table and walked away.  Did not ask if we needed anything, Did not check if we needed oil or parmesan cheese or oregano.  Daughter ordered Pesto over campanelli with grilled chicken which did not look appetizing, it was over oiled and lost flavor, the chicken was sliced,over cooked/dry and they gave what appeared to be a half of a breast.  I ordered the special which was sausage, mushrooms, pappardelle, truffle oil and cream sauce.  The pasta was okay but the rest of it was poorly put together.  There sausage was crumbled and sparse, there was about 10 extremely thin slices of extremely small bella mushrooms.  Hubby ordered the tour which was just 4 different options slopped on a big plate. The sausage was surprisingly spicy but almost too much for an italian sausage blend, everything else was bland and he did not enjoy any of it.  Other daughter ordered smoked salmon pasta which she said was okay but not great.  We were greatly disappointed in the entire experience especially since we were celebrating my daughter's birthday.  We decided to skip any dessert at this establishment and go somewhere different.  We would not recommend this restaurant nor go back.

eRJXZPJItZ5pouifRJaKRw.text: Great family restaurant!  Fantastic food and service!  Baked rigatoni is awesome! The bread and the salad are just as special! One of my all time favorite places!!

ot3_XH-E5BnYCBYqAx1A_Q.text: All the good stuff that's written on yelp is absolutely True. The food is authentic. When I had to find a place to pick I was a little hesitant and scared on what place to pick since we were going for a family dinner with my in-laws. I didn't want to be the person who was blamed for picking the awful spot. In the end everyone was really happy and everyone enjoyed their meal. Our waitress was super nice and was on top of it. She had six tables and the service was phenomenal. I love that salad and bread is unlimited. We got Risata Champagne and that stuff was delicious. The pricing here is great and portion size is more than plenty. Be sure to make a reservation here because it gets crazy packed. I wish this place was closer to me but the 40 mile drive was worth it indeed. You won't regret coming here I promise.

_lTfa33jelaOFh_oHseUbA.text: RigaTony's serves very good food and I have always had pleasant wait staff. I go for lunch and am a lasagna fan, and think RigaTony's is delicious. I've also tried the pizza, which is good also. The restaurant has a Buca Di Beppo vibe, which I like. My biggest problem is none of these places have Valentino Rossi on their walls. What gives?

_xipwP1vZ8LKWoaTH0HrNg.text: Loved this place!  It felt like we were eating in our Grandma's kitchen.  The limoncella is a must try.  My family loved the salad which is saying something since I have 2 teenaged boys who don't normally like salad.  Three of us had difference spaghetti options.  the meatballs were fabulous.  I had the baked rigatony.  It was a perfect portion with a creamy marinara sauce, Italian sausage and lots of melted cheese.  We are definitely making this a family favorite!

KKoy1MVtUQ2-HdJsRyWxEg.text: The food is very good with unlimited  salad and bread.the only downside  was the service. Our server ask what we wanted to drink.we already know what we will order but  it took 15 minutes for him to come back then take the order

Tkni1-I39haPrzLSQ885Tg.text: My go to Italian place in the Phoenix East Valley of for over 15 years even back to their Mesa location. Great salad, homemade bread and delicious authentic Italian food. What more could you ask for? If you're hungry you can't go wrong with The Tour of Rigatoni. Great lunch specials too. On Friday and Saturday night expect to wait probably about an hour but it's worth it.

yH2RuZLjheEkZrSQnqa-tg.text: They have the best salad and bread here! We often come here with my in-laws with a larger group and they are always accommodation. Good servers, nice and friendly. They have a good menu and I try something new every time. I am usually too full from salad and bread by the time the meal comes! Delicious.

oD5akHtpCOKPnGC5c8AIoA.text: Had an excellent experience.  The server was very attentive and the food was delicious.  The atmosphere was quite cozy and a nice departure from other Italian restaurants that I consider over-the-top.  Or, maybe I should shut my buca.  Can't wait to go back....

hRtPux_0XkKBiy2r--hP6w.text: With some hesitation in my part, my wife and I drove from grandale to check this place out. I'm glad that we made the trip. Only good things to say. Great food, great service, clean store. The one thing that did suck was that I could not make my mind up on what to order. When I settled, I chose the Italian chops, the best pork chops that I have ever eaten. I am looking forward to our next 30 mile trip to rigatonys very very soon

kZSwfi0W3e9XbrixbmmWPQ.text: After an hour wait I was expecting something fantastic and no such luck. Food was decent but nothing worth returning for. An huge letdown.

B-qi4Q7eGUVpPdkHT26m_Q.text: Absolutely amazing food and amazing customer service! Saraab was our server and she was awesome!!! She knew exactly what to recommended and everything she recommended was mind blowingly delicious! Everything made from scratch in house! 5stars for sure!

5NwW3KNbG9aNs7jVWaHjGw.text: RigaTony's is a mile from our house and even though there are other choices it's our go-to for local Italian. The dinner specials are terrific; great food, great prices.  We've never waited more then10 minutes to be seated and the service is top notch.  They have a loyalty program for regulars which we use and appreciate.  1 star deduction for a relative absence of healthier menu options (which I know is tough for Italian).  There always a fish plate and an option for whole wheat spaghetti but the single low carb menu option is only so-so.  All in all, RigaTony's is a winner.  Don't miss your chance for a restaurant meal that feels a lot like home.

l4QV45FQ5q87x4cfLK220Q.text: This is by far the best Italian restaurant in Arizona!

_o8wB4wEk6lMFdGOXap_UQ.text: Don't get all the 5 star reviews AT ALL!!! We went there for our friend's birthday because she and her husband love the place. What a disappointment! The salad was average, the bread was mediocre and the main course was overpriced and tasteless. My husband ordered Seafood Fettuccini and said that the fish was tasteless and the whole dish lacked flavor. Well, I tried it and compared to mine it was a bouquet of flavors! I ordered Capellini Pescatore described as "clams, mussels and shrimp in white wine, lemon, butter, and garlic sauce" and got this blob of angel hair swimming in broth like tasteless liquid with tasteless (have to use this word over and over again) mussels, clams and shrimp. Very disappointed! I don't know how you can possibly call any of that food "outstanding". Will definitely not be back! The only good thing about the place was the service - the waitress was very nice and quick. But if you actually wanna go have some good Italian food don't bother, it's awful.

Y49sXfYAqd0pneKHCVgmtA.text: The pork chops are awesome.  The red sangria is evil & delicious.  The fried zucchini with the hot peppers is an amazing appetizer.  The pasta dishes are all great also.  The place gets full during peak hours so you might want to plan ahead for that.

e4AfpvssKhVyPBbrA79Mgg.text: By far one of my favorite Italian restaurants! The best thing to get here: Good old Spaghetti and meatballs! The sauce is sweet but robust, chunky, and just plain good! But the star of the show is the meatballs. They are soft, have great flavor but are somehow very light. Best meatballs I have ever had! Some other great entrees are the lasagna which is meaty and rich and the rigatoni with what else, the meatballs! Baked rigatoni with marinara and Alfredo and lots of meat of your choice. The best comfort food out there! Their Alfredo is pretty good as well. Years ago when I was in high school, I was obsessed with their lobster fusilli but they took it off the menu  :(  Why does that always happen to me? So anyways, I guess I am just hoping that someone from Rigatonys will see this review and decide to bring this dish back. Although... at this point, I love their spaghetti and meatballs so much that I don't know if I would order it. Haha. And of course, I cannot complete my review without mentioning their salad and bread. The salad is so above average. Mixed greens, cheese, olives, tomato, onion, and salami make for an amazing salad already but when the house Italian dressing is added, oh my god, out of this world. The bread is warm and I love dipping it in the olive oil with oregano and basil and maybe even a little balsamic. Lastly, their they have a very good tiramisu but I don't think I can ever order it knowing what their bread pudding is like. The bread pudding is one of the better ones I have had, and with bread pudding being my favorite dessert, I have to get it if I am going to have dessert. Rigatonys has a great flavor and the right amount of spice and the apples add a different texture to it. Its very good!  A few tips: You can actually buy their salad dressing and tiramisu just by going to the hostess stand. Also, Rigatonys used to be located at Knox and AZ Ave but the new location is much nicer and bigger.

aEW3lJ7O_5rUxwZZDA-rmQ.text: Food gets FIVE STARS, Service takes two stars away. I know they are always busy, but then get more staff!  I do love and crave the shrimp Scampi.

VDTZ9_tfBijO0csFiM44yQ.text: This place is very cute and has a great vibe upon immediate arrival but is quickly lost to rude service and cheap ingredients! I had a very bad experience my first time here (late Sept) and thought that perhaps my snotty waitress swayed my palette to dislike the food. So, I decided to give it another try before I posted anything on FB or twitter. Well, the experience was NOT better! So bad in fact, it inspired me to re-visit yelp as well as hammer FB and twitter. I should begin by stating that I love Italian food and was inspired to deviate from my favorite 3 spots (1.Andreoli's 2.Harley's Bistro 3. Michelina's) because of the great reviews and an intriguing FB ad..big mistake! Where to start...their apps are pretty much bread or fried bar food. The sauce for the lasagna still tasted of tin from the can which it was poured from. Our sausage fettuccine alfredo was runny and bland. Basically, the ingredients in virtually everything we had tasted cheap and processed. There was nothing authentic or homemade about this place. FAIL!

y9p0GQxRGLC_WrXbAmmwOQ.text: Enjoyed a girls dinner out...  Our waiter, Christian, was so patient with us.  2 of us arrived and did not know if anyone else was going to show up.  Then as our food was arriving the 3rd showed up and then as we ordered dessert the 4th showed up.  What a challenge and he was so easy going with our long extended dinner.  The new location is a bit loud as the room is quite large.  As always the bread is tasty if you order a side of alfredo sauce for dipping.  The salad is always so fresh and you can get it unlimited for your meal for $8.50 but it is always such a nice starter.  This was a first for ordering a latte and it was actually very good, I was pleasantly surprised.  And the dessert, yum!  3 out of the 4 of us loved it.  We will definitely go back for another girls dinner and ask for Christian-he was fabulous!!!

mezoYHiaIaodM8wYCaVlkw.text: I tried this place on the recommendation of a co-worker, and I brought 3 family members.  The first contact with our waitress was her carrying 4 shots of the house wine, and after she found out that only two of us were over 21 years old, she poured the 4 drinks into two glasses and I enjoyed it immensely.  I even ordered a glass of it.  She either didn't hear me or she forgot, and the wine never arrived (oh, well).  We ordered an appetizer (baked ravioli), and the waitress brought us a large salad and we only ate half of it.  A short while later, our entrees arrive, and each one was awesome!  I could've enjoyed each one.  By this point, I'm so stuffed full, that I could only eat half my entree, and we all asked for boxes.  We ordered dessert, and even took half of that home!  I had already paid at this point, and we waited for an endless 15-20 minutes until the waitress noticed that we still needed her to bring us a box for the dessert.    And now, the big three:  Service:  Excellent.  Our server gave detailed answers on every question we had while we ordered.  She was attentive to refill our drinks, yet not to the point of being annoying.  Price:  Super expensive.  Most of the entrees were $10-15, so this can only be a family restaurant for special occasions.  They will easily miss the entire market of routine family meals, because of their high prices.  Taste:  Everything we tried was liked by all.    In the end, I will be going back, since both the food and atmosphere was excellent.  I'm ready to try something that we didn't try the first time.

2Lolmstf3tVETjrPktTjog.text: Took my mom for lunch today,on a scale of 1-10,I give it a 12!!! everything was FANTASTIC!!! We had the lunch special..manicotti,came with a huge salad filled with all types of antipasto,THE BEST warm crusty  bread (all you would like for no extra charge) and for $1.25 shared a big cup of homemade soup that was delicious!! By the time the entree came we were almost full but managed to eat half the portion.The portion was HUGE!!! The service & atmosphere are great!!!! And all this for 2 people under $20.!!!!! I don't know how they do it,but they were packed at lunch & I can certainly understand why! This is now our new favorite Italian place. You just can't get any better! Being from Chicago we're very critical about food quality,especially Italian food,and this was the best we've had here in Az. We will definitely be back.Great place and prices to take out of town guests.

-crE_Elvwe4nCyFMbvyZOQ.text: I've tried it a few times because I REALLY wanted to like this locally-owned neighborhood spot but I always end up REALLY disliking it.  There are always big crowds here.  For me, though, the food is just too heavy, greasy, and bland.

a0v8o_qTUQY2sJF-cnw_CQ.text: Had I only known how good the all-you-can-eat salad would be, I'd have made that my meal. It was sooo delicious, and I am used to eating high-end meals (I work in a 5 star place). I ordered the Chicken Marsala, which was better than average/ok, but my friend ordered the Chicken Piccata which I have to say was the best I have ever had. Extremely flavorful.   True, it is a boisterous place, so if you are looking for quiet ambience you should go elsewhere. But if you are out to have fun with your friends...RigaTony's is a great spot! Great food, lots of fun!

s_lSwHlUzy-Bz_AC-Vj7xA.text: I eat there about 3 times a week!! The antipasto salad and bread are addicting and can't be beat!

QyJR5i3n6K6AHVCso337Fw.text: I'm a fan of Riga Tony's the way Chicagoans are fans of the Cubs or the Bears. They are your hometown team and you will keep going even if they let you down on occasion. Riga Tony's is in my backyard. You are not heading here to have great italian food. Tthink '70's Italian-American, the standard spaghetti and meatball, the usual chicken parm.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good, think italian diner good. The high points are the fresh baked bread, the awesome iceberg lettuce, lunchmeat salad - think '70's italian salad, and it is really good! The  entrees are all very well priced and you get great value for the price. If you are looking for a great middle of the week place that will treat you well, feed you well and not drain your wallet, Riga Tony's is the spot! Go CUBS!

Im8wOeC2izug70psid1dhg.text: walking distance from my home = good stuff inexpensive good food  = happy tummy with no regrets multiple healthy options  = leaner roger with no regrets  from the outside rigatony's is suspect, heck even once you get inside it looks suspect but the service and food is solid. i generally get pasta and either marinara or pesto sauce. always comes with a salad and bread. everything else i have had there is delish too but heavy and i am trying to stay lean.  pass on the wine, its just too cheap to be drunk.

n98FQdTssGqhHWyphX5azA.text: We have been going here and enjoying the food for a long while.  It was our work group lunch spot.  However, recently we experienced 3 times in a row terrible service.  From the waitress not using our "devoted diner" card because the last waitress made a mistake on the date.  Is that the customer's fault?  The way she informed us was not polite, she ignored our table until the check was ready and it was super awkward.  Then recently we were seated, ordered right away when she was taking drink orders.  However, we waited 15 mins for water and salad.  Then 30 mins for the food.  By the time it was 1:05 the food came out and we had to put in box right away to make our work meeting on time.  I understand they are busy, but when everyone around you were seated at the same time, already eat, paid their check, and we havent got our food???  Poor customer service, and maybe management really needs to make sure their waitresses pay attention to customers who sat around for a hour.  I will miss there food, but this isnt worth this treatment.

4l0Bc3cdGsgGEN3ix-GmEA.text: I didn't have high expectations, but the food was surprisingly good.  The salad that comes with the meal is actually a meal in itself.  Very good.  Ordered the spaghetti deluxe (meat sauce, sausage, meatball).  Turned out to be a lot of food.  Very good.  Also ordered the short rib.  Again, very good.  First one they brought out was a little tough, but the next one was spot on.

2Qfil__Lt3HxJzrwphl54w.text: We moved away and come back when we're in the area. We love everything on your menu. Whitney was our great attentive waitress. We'll be back!

k_ftaGb4T8fyOcJy_HaVPg.text: What a great Italian restaurant. The wait staff is attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Food is excellent with generous portions. Definitely up for a repeat visit.

lUwD_QBTFUjJ6d37Udh21A.text: So surprised with this local Italian restaurant, it was so tasty.  Great $8 deals with pasta and antipasta salad and fresh baked seasoned bread. Must try it.

_BnlRKcA_-PH9xGknPQ1Jw.text: Last night was my first time here and I will come back again. Starting out with the Salad & the bread they were so good the food was superb so delicious out of this world. Tricia was our waitress and she has great Customer Service Skills. I felt like I was in the Godfather movie the way the restaurant was set up I just loved it

Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lasagna &amp; Alfredo Fettuccini was the best
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

mNvR-X-6h4a2zwhtqCBbig.text: I love their Baked Rigatony with sausage.  It has a nice spiciness to it.  The marinara is excellent.  Their Italian sodas are very good as well.  It is extremely busy on the weekends.  Plan to wait if you don't have a reservation.  Tip:  Order the dressing for the salad on the side.  I think they tend to drown it with dressing.

n-KMkwhoPd4twosrkmS4LQ.text: Very good southern Italian food. Meals come with a great salad that is served family style.  The salad together with the bread are worth coming to RigaTony's.  The portions are generous.   The service is attentive without being an annoyance.  The overall result is a very good meal at a great price.  I had the chicken cutlet picatta.  It was tender and tasty and smothered with mushrooms and capers. Others in our group had the lasagna, the eggplant parmesan and penna pasta.  All enjoyed their meals and took home much of what was served.  Just expect to have a wait before enjoying your meal.  This is a very popular restaurant.

N4uh5OraQuIXDh2z7LMxhA.text: This is my favorite place to go for Italian food. Always consistent every time. Salad is amazing. Got a ravioli with creamy pesto sauce last time that was delicious. This is a regular place of mine and my fiancee. You definitely have to try it!

Akg8NAaMfvwDpagfZjgpqw.text: The salad here is so amazing!!! I love their fresh crust bread and pasta dishes too. My favorite Italian restaurant in AZ so far. There's always a lil but if a wait at dinner time but that's expected. The staff are all very helpful and friendly as well. I love ordering the pasta but I could eat that salad everyday of my life.

7hWjRFizpU9PFXVfG9q_DA.text: As I've said before, we are New Yorkers & expect good food and good service.  We got BOTH tonight at RigaTony's.  Our waiter, Tyler, was exceptionally attentive.  He offered us two little glasses of the house Cianti to try.  It was happy hour and many of the drinks were 1/2 price (always a treat).  The bread was very fresh  & moist; dinner comes with an antipasto salad, which was exceptionally tasty.  Hubby had seafood linguini (shrimp & scallops) in pesto sauce; he loved it.  I had chicken parm with spaghett.  Very good.  We splurged for dessert today - apple bread pudding and spumoni.  Our bill was $64 + tip, which we felt was very reasonable.  It was a lovely dinner and we hope to return once again before going home.  As mentioned, Tyler helped make our dinner extremely enjoyable and memorable.

NqdiLsUAz9Aif13E9jZWuQ.text: Dinner was great and our server Taylor was exceptional. He made us feel like we were in a fancy restaurant even though we had our kids with us. A restaurant is only as good as its people and all their staff has been good but Taylor anticipated our needs before we even asked.

0wrtn7pGLZ3Z6MoNJ3QrDg.text: This is one of my friends favorite restaurants. He raved about how he is his family have been coming to here for years and told me that its way better than Olive Garden. I was not disappointed. The wait was a bit long, but it was definitely worth it. Sophie, our waitress was super friendly and very efficient. We loved the service she provided for us. Both our entrees were good, and we loved it. Will definitely recommend this restaurant to other friends and colleagues.

Ftj-vTVzBNPzt2jYHhBlAw.text: Parking: Parking is great super easy.  Intro to Walking In: You walk in a prepare to be seated. You'll feel the ambiance of an Italian restaurant when you are seated.  The Food:  Monday special Chicken Parm and to Spice up things with more meat I added a meat ball. For starters, I was introduced with a salad and it appears to have some type of sliced meat in it. Not impressed with the salad, definitely not fresh and it doesn't take a whole lot of time to rip apart lettuce to make a great tasting fresh salad. The shredded cheese did not taste fresh for the day, must be of been pre-shredded in a bag thrown in with the salad that was made a day or two ago. Thumbs down on the salad. Fresh bread comes out with added olive oil to the plate for dipping, it was good nothing bad about it. Next, the lunch comes out. I immediately dive into the Spaghetti with an amazing sauce. The sauce is excellent and above average. I then cut into the meat ball and I notice the small pieces of diced onions and can't wait to devour it. I took a bite and can only guess that maybe these meatballs were made yesterday and warmed up today due to the mild coldness of it. I would give you a 5 on the meatballs because of the packed flavor, if they had made fresh to order or at least fairly hot for the lunch plate. I cut into pieces and mix into the spaghetti which topped it off very well. On to the Chicken Parm, I cut into the parm and it looks possibly fresh. I bite into it enjoying the same great flavor of the sauce from the spaghetti and the very fresh cheese thinking not too bad. However, I get into the chicken itself and it seems very bland and not as crisp as I would enjoy it to be. It almost seems as if it was a frozen Chicken Parm. It could have been the seasoning was not flavorful as well.   The Waiter/Service Experience:  Waiter very attentitive during lunch time rush hour. Brought my drinks in time and advise the manager of the Chicken Parm. I asked him if it was frozen and not made fresh to order, he said made fresh to his knowledge. I let him know it tasted as it was frozen and that it was very bland but not to take anything off my bill. I was offered to have another one remade and I took the offer. The one to go did taste better than the first one for sure. Now, as a manager you should always greet yourself and make that offer. However, because it was offered I give you kudos for it and to the waiter for even bringing it up.   Overall Experience and Why not a 5: The Salad was definitely not something to come back to and the Chicken Parm should come out like that all the time. The meatballs should come out pretty hot not warm/cold. The service, was great and the ambiance is great. I could not come back with a group of people to have them tell me the salad was awful, especially if it's for starters. Fix these minor issues and you'll have great customers coming back for more and more. Otherwise, you're below average and going to Olive Garden is not such a bad thing.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Need Fresh Salad and Fresh shredded Cheese, takes 2 minutes or less to do to make this a wonderful Salad
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wonderful Bread
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. wonderful Meatballs and Sauce

YXuJ9LALGFxVuxw6Dn7p9w.text: There's nothing tony about RigaTony's. Mediocre food, lackluster service, and tired surroundings make for a downscale experience.

SMl8kHCozFcK4qoS70NEgg.text: Best lunch specials in the area, bar none. Incredibly reasonable prices, and if you don't want the special of the day, you can have any of the other day's choices for just $1 more. Includes unlimited salad (VERY good salad at that) and bread. Service is great, though the place does get packed. I particularly like the Chicken Parm and several of the sandwich options. Lots of good choices, and it's all good.

sj1gV3rh2HTNCsOogifFLQ.text: Although our first visit, I knew right away it was a hoping joint. People lined up, forty-five minite wait. But got buzzed at twenty-five minutes. I had the spaghetti with meat ball, sausage and meat sauce. Me wife had the four cheese penne. For desert, we shared the four layer chocolate cake and capachino 'bowl' ice cream. Way awesome. And the service was great. Definitely going back.

WAfV4TOkFi28AQPIvi932A.text: Where do I even begin?! This is simply my new favorite Italian place!  They have great deals on happy hour and the food is always good. The portions here are large enough to share. But definitely try your best to save room because the cappuccino pie is too good to pass up!

t2eXbuHZCtfiZxQG7sWLzA.text: Five stars for everything! Our waitress was fabulous. Very attentive, kind, and speedy service. All of the food was delicious. Best Italian my family has eaten. Starting with the antipasto salad and bread, followed up with the generous sized entrees. So yummy! Will definitely be returning.

C_D0WWVkw_Le2CNyc5UwjA.text: This was my first visit to Rigatony's.  The restaurant is easy to find and has ample parking. The inside is quite homey and warm. We were seated at a table that was sectioned off by a large tapestry/curtain. Each time people walked by, the tapestry would hit us. The room also echoed terribly, with the most obnoxious voices towering over us like someone gave them a microphone. I honestly don't remember the name of our server (a blonde girl, that doesn't help. Lol) , but she was abrupt and pushy with a fake smile. She brought our menus and was very pushy for us to order. She kept rolling her eyes at us and was obviously aggravated that we were taking our time. I got one water refill during the appetizer, and never again. We asked beforehand to split the bill. With only 4 of us (2 couples), it was silly of me to think that two bills would be an issue. Our friends split the Tour of Rigatony's, which they love and said was fantastic. They also upsold the bread and antipasto. I didn't think either was special. Our antipasto didn't even have any meat, and had one pepperoncini. My husband ordered the shrimp scampi and thought it was great. I ordered Shrimp Cappellini, but asked to substitute the haricot vert for the pasta. I didn't get it. Since she dropped it and never came back, I ate the shrimp and nothing else. Aggravated. My food was boxed for me while I was in the restroom, and our party ordered dessert. The spumoni was ok. The pistachio cannoli was amazing. The cream was ridiculously good. I would try this place again, but would run from the waitress. I wish I remembered her name so I could warn everyone.

8oMlVFepR1qZjNe-ZdMeuw.text: I've been living within two miles of this place for several years now and only just discovered it a couple of weeks ago. I've been many times since then because this place is absolutely AMAZING! Everyone at my table (8 of us) said it was the best Italian food they had ever had. Not only is their food amazing, but also their pricing and service is equally amazing. Try it for yourself, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

44bEyOrxw0Ulrc9XlqB1KQ.text: Tried RigaTony's out based on some Yelp reviews while visiting from out of state. Food was amazing, service was great! Just wish I would have had room for dessert! Portions are very large!

RAHhR44pXQxblhWYfVoJKg.text: We love coming here as a family and with friends. The food is always great and we love their salad!  However I do wish that they accepted reservations. Not being able to make a reservation makes it challenging to come in as often as I would like to.

GzWCP61t8TLEb4oupTalng.text: Sorry folks but I can barely give this place a star. The salad was good, bread was average and not hot- a big indicator for not having a great meal. The waiter was nice but called the salad anti- pasti salad. Oh, you mean antipasto!   I knew we were in trouble when I asked how the eggplant was- the waiter said it's great and as a matter of fact, a customer earlier today said it was better than The Olive Garden. It was ok, a bit salty though  My husband had the combo plate with sausage, fettuccini Alfredo, manicotti and chicken piccata- thinking we'd try few things and something was bound to be good. Well, the sausage was ok but the rest almost inedible  Yes I'm an Italian snob for context.   If you like Olive Garden, you may just like this place. Sorry RigaTony's just being honest

rRUq7blG7cfyCvpmjWr_UA.text: This is a awesome place!    I love the feel of it.  It feels like a family owned establishment.   Get the fried zuchinni!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried Zucchini.  Delish!

2Y9YKIcQNJpS5nO-DYM4Yw.text: First time customer. Service was excellent. The food was the best Italian I've had since I moved to Arizona 3 years ago. Leave room for the desserts...they are worth the extra time on the treadmill today.

3K7reSPqUHowS7xWCHQyIA.text: They start with a sample of Chianti which was a nice surprise. The service was great Randy was pleasant and  very timely kept all glasses full. The bread and salad  was good, I would definitely come for the Italian soda it was so great. Tiramisu is perfect, Spumoni very flavorful.

NchL9evJh7iIqQsjom-TTg.text: Love RigaTony's! Love the atmosphere, food never disappoints! The salad is my favorite! Wonderfully customer service. If you plan on going during the busy times it's wise to make a reservation :)

B1JMiyRtqRtpaa3tt_6ICg.text: Good food and good service. Nice atmosphere! The plate sizes don't match the cost of the food.  I would recommend this place to anyone though!

J0ofmBw805tpblKPXeGqeg.text: My wife and I have always enjoyed our meals at RigaTony's! The food is delicious no matter what you order, they have a full bar, great ambiance and everyone is very friendly. Because this establishment is so fantastic, there is usually a 25 to 30 minute wait before you seat. On this visit my wife and I went to the bar, had a drink and an appetizer, and when we were done with those, our seats were ready. Not a bad way to spend your wait!

tC_DtQ0VLq7Nen6B1jvYkw.text: Authentic Italian food service was good attentive and friendly the food was delicious there were four of us and they were able to accommodate all of our tastes including a younger person

GpJsU9NbqH75wQePDaGQPw.text: Always great service and food.  Took family that was visiting from TN and they loved it!

UPJovC7Ll26SghbCINRSfA.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat at, It's a busy place but well worth the wait. I had the pizza and anti pasta salad it's the best! If you save room for desert try the bread pudding, it's delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

v-jXtTi8oJkvyibmQ3CgUA.text: Monday 5pm family of 4, seated immediately. The waitress showed up right away for drink orders. We got calamari, ravioli, salmon and angel hair, baked rigatoni, kids spaghetti & meatball. Food was great, delivered quickly. They also gave us a humongous salad bowl to share as well as some nice warm crusty bread while we waited for the entree. My 6yo ate free since we went on a Monday which was a pleasant surprise. Service was friendly, fast, excellent. Place was clean and looked old school.

JWu6riuON5i-mq3KQIvUcA.text: Food is good and service was quick. The only complaint is no beer on draft. Would recommend for Italian food

wC_OhrprApOgKgFtL3gqmw.text: Dinner was delicious!!  Zucchini was crisp and loved the sauce... Better than ranch!!  Marrissa is fabulous!!  Great experience!

c2MYWiQFzwyJvOub_bvxkA.text: Authentic?? Really wanted to like this place. The decor is amazing the staff is amazing. The salad and bread outstanding!! Then we get our entree I ordered lasagna my husband spaghetti and "meatballs" my husband gets about a one cup serving size of noodles with 1 "meatball" wow that's it. The Plain marinara sauce had lots of extras like zucchini big huge chunks of garlic. We asked the waiter if it was plain marinara and he stated yes. But that it had garlic. We were not thinking huge chunks of it. Then my lasagna the noodles were starchy and not good at all the whole thing had a weird taste to it. Authentic I say not! It's really to bad because we are desperately looking for a great Italian food place.

Jhp1suceAOmghnqXECArZw.text: First of all, Whitney C is a phenomenal waitress. The best waitress I have ever had at any restaurant I've ever been to. The food was outstanding, perfect taste and perfect amount. Whitney never let our water glasses get empty nor get upset when we constantly asked for more bread, salad or dressings. My friend and I sat outside and made the experience 10X's better with all their beautiful decor. I highly recommend going to this restaurant! This was my first time there and I am defiantly will be going back! I love it! We went there around 5 pm for dinner on a Sunday and there was no wait! and it was pretty packed

viNJ1rO6Q7gHpXY1VKw26Q.text: I asked what was in the anti-pasta salad in the soup & salad. Was told lettuce, black olives, parmesan, pepperoncinis - so I ordered it with the potato/cheesy soup. Was asked if I wanted them brought together or one then the other. I said both at the same time. They forgot the soup. I figured it was coming shortly so I waited and then finally ate the salad, slowly with my few friends. It had ZERO parmesan - what makes the salad worth eating. It had mozzarella - big bland deal. Two measly black olives and it was mostly lettuce with just a sprinkle of the other on top. The dressing was disgusting (no choice) so I ate it plain - okay as I often have it plain, except when I eat it plain, it has parmesan, which takes it from bland to tasty. The mediocre salad was finished and I waited and waited. Finally, I got up and went and told them that they forgot about my soup. Was asked what kind - then I got it, after more waiting. The service was dreadfully slow. The soup was bland, and they brought more salad but I didn't have room for much more - I wanted the soup, and I wanted it first - too late for that. I asked for butter for the bread. It was too hard to spread - kept falling off the bread so I gave up and had the oil for dipping. One dip and that's it. They expected all 8 of us to share two saucers for dipping. Do you double dip? How about with a sick person? One of the group kept hacking away - was ill. Had to get up again and go and ask for individual saucers for dipping so that we did not have to double dip with the whole group. Never did the server ever come back and ask if everything was okay. TERRIBLE SERVICE & the server ought to have been accurate and knowledgeable about the menu and she was not. Mediocre food at best. No, I will NOT return. A friend ordered a pasta dish. In the bowl, it looked like just a heap of pasta, no veggies, nothing but a barely detectable smooth sauce. My impression: They make the dishes as cheaply as possible to derive as much profit as they can. There are so many places around that provide much better food, much better value and much better service.

J7zWwd1dWTlYOh_PG4UEtQ.text: Phoenix has been my home away from home lately since my boyfriend comes for Air Force drill every month so I've decided to go on a bit of a Yelp search for the best places near by. We had a craving for some great Italian pasta so we decided to check this place out after seeing all the great reviews.  The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the meal. She also gave us some punch cards at the end of meal to use for return visits.   I loved the atmosphere. It seemed kind of similar to a Boca's with the decorations but more of a family owned feel.  To save the best for last, the food was amazing! We had the calamari to start which came with a classic & spicy marinara as well as some lemons. I thought it was very good and portion size was very generous. My boyfriend had the make your own pasta special which came with an antipasti salad and rosemary bread. (Available daily 2-5 pm) We ended up sharing the salad and bread since the portion size was huge. I went with the Baked Rigatony and omg, delicious!!   I can't get enough of this place and I'll definitely be back soon!

pT5CPPJ_8XYEEhKQ4v-Y6w.text: Please keep in mind I like this place.  I like it enough to want to spend a LOT of money here for a special treat for my staff.  I will not likely eat here again.  Here is a letter I wrote to the management: ========================================== Today I attempted to obtain a reservation for next Tuesday. We have a party of 16 who will be looking to celebrate the end of the tax filing season.
