I was informed that it is against policy to take a reservation of that size, opting instead to ensure you have room for walk-ins.   I have no doubt that your restaurant is successful and that things are going well. However, I find it strange that any company would turn away guaranteed revenue in favor of the unknown on an evening in the middle of the week. Perhaps if it were the weekend, I would understand, but on a Tuesday?   When my staff called two weeks ago attempting to schedule, they were given the same answers I was this morning. I simply could not believe it, so I had to call myself. They were given the answer of "we need to make sure we have enough staff on the floor." I would expect that, if scheduled in advance, you would be able to plan for your staffing. I would also assume that a previously unscheduled staff member would be happy to come in for a two hour shift in exchange for a guaranteed tip of over $150 (at 20%).   I look to Rigatony's as a great neighborhood restaurant that would be outstanding to plan a special occasion such as ours. Apparently I was incorrect, unless the party is 12 or less people.   I wish you best of luck in the future.

h0CHH5hWO9SXIYd6eHG2SQ.text: I forgot how disappointing this local chain is. I won't make this mistake again.  We went on a busy Friday night, when the restaurant was packed. Parking was more plentiful than either of the old locations, but that was probably the last plus of the evening. (Well, not quite -- the bathroom was clean.)  The restaurant is poorly laid out and VERY loud. Every seat was full, making it nearly impossible to hear my boyfriend two feet away. Sitting at a table next to the main pathway along the large dining room wasn't much different from sitting on the edge of the food court in Grand Central Station. If you want to get hit in the back of the head by a half-dozen knock-off purses, this is the place to go. Our waitress was impossible to hear, but she managed to catch our orders. She didn't look us in the eye the whole evening. Her annoyance at this job was absolutely clear, and I don't blame her. The place has a miserable ambiance. I'd hide in the kitchen too.  The salad was fine, though it would have been nice had the waitress had let me speak (to say I wanted to remove the onions) before she started tossing it. The bread was good.  I ordered the Capellini Checca, which was absolutely shameful. This restaurant has decided to take the "cutting corners because we don't care" route that Chef Ramsey sees so often. There was about a cup of water in the bottom of the large bowl of angel hair, and the advertised "fresh roma tomatoes" were actually canned but chopped whole tomatoes. (It's June -- tomatoes are in season, for goodness sake.) It was a flavorless mess of powered garlic, a shard or two of basil, overcooked store pasta, water, and "tomatoes".  You'll be far happier at Olive Garden.

r5_xxn9BhcePzZa9BXb5YA.text: Great neighborhood Italian restaurant. It's a little "Olive Gardenish - is that word? But the food is tasty and service is quick. I usually sit in the bar - can't remember the hispanic bartender's name, but he's great. The house Chardonnay and Merlot are so-so; the Chianti is bad.   The space has hosted so many restaurants over the past 15-20 years, and based on the crowds I've seen there, I think Riga Tony's will be here for a while. Glad to see it succeed.

DdzSZpazPjC0lSFEppLeEw.text: We used to go here all the time because the food was good. However, at the end of our last meal we went to use our free meal that we had earned from our stamp cards and we were told that we couldn't combine any cards. We were previously told we could. The manager came over and told us the same thing. We said they need to honor their own program and the lady said she was the owner and that she didn't care about our business and that we don't need to come back. Well...we haven't been back since. You would think the OWNER would want to retain business. I guess not!

KH_vM0rFUDjWUjwE2L2cLg.text: Good food, great ambience and wide variety of selections to choose from. Had a great experience

1u82GRbs1oPXKTReLEuZ0A.text: This was my first experience at a RigaTony's so I can't compare it to the "old" RigaTony's.  I actually have never even heard of the place before my friend suggested it.  I went there last night with a party of 4 at about 7pm.  I have no idea why the place was jam-packed at 7 on a random Tuesday, but good for them.  It took at least 15 minutes to get a table.  Our server was pretty good though I thought he was a little overly friendly and kinda fake.  But all our food came out correctly and my diet coke was refilled in a timely manner.  Good stuff.  Here is my rundown:  * House Chianti = no bueno (but I like it that they bring the whole table a taste of it in little shot glass things right when you sit down...a very nice touch) * Bread = very good.  big fluffy pieces with great crust. * Alfredo dip appetizer thing = eh.  Not much flavor and you can feel yourself gaining weight and your arteries clogging. * House Salad = excellent.  your table gets a nice big bowl of this stuff.  it is very very good.  lots of great ingredients and an excellent dressing. * Lasagna = excellent.  full of meaty, cheesy, saucy goodness * Meatballs = not a fan.  the sauce is ok, but the meatballs are made with a bunch of other non-meat stuff.  tasted bready...  I will not rush back but would come back to try some of their other stuff.  It all seems pretty standard for an Italian place though.

o9R1MW80lBOoghJkKlQMYw.text: We go to Rigatonys and sit in the bar (no waiting!) and mostly order their special salad and carafe of wine  -  great deal and love the salad.  We've tried other items on the menu including pasta specials and they're always good.  When the weather is right their patio is really nice too.  Bar staff are always friendly and good service.

nPyhxopAK9RfaQKvm7Bz1g.text: Authentic Italian. Our party of 6 all offered praise for great food. Great service.

1Re8UONMneLUmF-v7oosAw.text: Good neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Line can be a bit long after 6pm.  Take out family specials are pretty good.  Bread and salad come w each entree and are very tasty.  Pasta source is good but can be a little heavy on butter and/or cheese.  Overall, great value for the money.

L-3nf7zaYpZYUTnGAlajgw.text: First off, when we moved from Tempe to Chandler in 2001, we found Rigatony's and were great fans and repeat customers since. We've had Christmas Eve dinners, birthday's, and many family visits to the older Chandler and the newer Tempe locations. Much to my chagrin, the last visit 5 nights ago was very disappointing.  With relatives in from back East, we all decided on Italian and Rigatony's. Poor food and poor service. Salad was drenched with dressing. Chicken Marsala was tremendously sweet.  A different brand of Marsala wine is needed.  One of us could not finish it was sooo sweet.  Chicken over cooked and dry. Chicken with artichokes and lemons... Luckily I had a lemon from my water, as there was no lemon flavoring and just a few pieces of artichoke.  A single piece of chicken that was over cooked and dry. No sauce at all. Chicken Parm... dried up and over cooked chicken. Fettuccine Alfredo was like glue...  Had to ask for water 2X and then only 2 waters delivered for a party of 5. Had to ask for an extra plate for the olive oil dip for the bread. Had to prepare the olive oil dip ourselves...  Probably wont go back after 14 years.... Disappointing... The bread was great!!

zkKX_uzWYC4mMDpOUxn8Rg.text: Let's talk about failure, baby.  Hey, if your idea of salad is punishment via tasteless lettuce and mealy tomatoes splashed with the most generic, industrial vinaigrette, you've found just the right place to BDSM your tongue. Go for it!  I ordered Capellini Checca, and I had it substituted with Spaghetti (I like more girth re: pasta).  What I got was the limpest pile of spaghetti that couldn't be revived with a lifetime supply of Viagra.  The DOA pasta was topped with a pathetic sprinkling of more mealy tomatoes (the menu says Fresh Roma Tomatoes- these had the texture and taste of a dying horse's ass moreso than fresh produce).  The faint, acrid garlic tasted like it came out of a shaker bottle and not a bulb- and motherf*&k, respectable Checca should have more than 1/16 teaspoon of microscopically chopped basil.    This place makes Old Spaghetti Factory look like fine dining, and I would rather starve than be even close to that chain restaurant of culinary doom.  Hell, this place is the  disowned, cracked-out junkie brother of OSF. It's really *that* terrible.  I gave them the single star only because the management was incredibly lovely, and did not charge for the unforgivable disaster masquerading as edible food worth paying for.

1CHIliZSfvT6PSbjOal0Wg.text: Last Sunday a little after 11 I called a to go order in and there was confusion and a long wait to place the order. I attributed that to just opening up.  The bill when I Arrrived was $21 plus change  I gave the lady two $20 bills.   Again confusion. She Went to the register like she was going to ring me up and then left.   I thought maybe they don't have change because they just opened.  After waiting a long while another  woman appears who I now assume is the trainee and begins ringing my order on the register I have dug through my purse for correct change.  I asked do u want exact change?  The trainee in process of making change gave me back a $10 bill instead of one of the $20s.   I brought in the first woman to my conversation with the trainee  it was two $20 bills (I just came from the atm) and suggested to look at your bank as I was probably the first cash customer. She insisted it was a &20 and a $10 bill She said they would do the bank in the evening and call if $10 over.  If u r going to train someone then supervise.  My error trying to come up with exact change and your error for not supervising.  Not a good experience.  The food good; smaller portions as compared to eating in the restaurant.  Won't be back.

jNedxMgkeMirEzmLxqdQbA.text: Get the salad! They have the best salad ever. I've gotten take out several times & I'm always impressed with the quantity and taste.  The food is a fairly prices & excellent. This is one of my parent favorite spots so every Christmas I get them a gift card & they have awesome bonuses! The last two years I got a take out meal for free! You can't beat that.

OVF68uKRTnz5Ke1Nqqzrag.text: When I think Italian, the standard is Rigatony's. I LOVE their salad and their entrees are delicious. Stuffed shells, woo hoo. Love to support a locally owned business. We have never had anything less than a great experience there.

_e2ngMMHvvOiQXMzZoFIfw.text: A solid 3.5 stars.   I met my boyfriend here for dinner with his parents tonight and the place was POPPIN' when we got there so there was a 20 minute wait. No biggie. This was my first time here so once we were lead in I realized the place was huge, much like the inside of a Bucco di Beppo but much more open.   We were seated at a booth and our server Jared was with us shortly. We soon received our antipasto salad and ciabatta bread, both of which were very different than the norm, but very good. They have a large selection of entrees and I finally settled on the chicken fettuccine. In hindsight, I wish I would have gotten something with red sauce as I think I might have been more "wowed". My dish was good, but it was a pretty standard chicken alfredo. Everyone else enjoyed their dishes and even though they were really busy, service was never an issue.   This is definitely somewhere I'd try again, especially before ever going back to a Bucco di Beppo.

47Jo-1FGxrOoDA5fgpcFrA.text: Food is fantastic, Staff is attentive, and ambiance is great!  Just what a neighborhood restaurant should be.  My family from Los Angeles come and visit often and their 1st request is Rigatony's !!!  Patio is beautiful !  You won't be disappointed!!

uulyQF_hlEtFBWhgcpS0pw.text: Nothing was horrible, but nothing was outstanding, out of this world. And definitely not for the dinner prices.  $5.50 for a side of 2 meat balls that were cold in the middle? Spaghetti and marinara sauce was nothing to get excited about. Quite generic food overall for what they're charging. The best part was the free salad that came before dinner.

f-gAJdSIlw01KdEv8vOIxw.text: WOW!  A COMPLETE AND UTTER DISAPPOINTMENT!  My wife and I had been bragging on how GREAT this restaurant was to our friends and how they are going to LOVE it!  We brought a couple of our friends (one from out of state) and had some of the worst service and food that we have had.    The service was so bad that she didn't even take drink orders... we had to flag her down to get them.  The Filet and Shrimp...  For $18.50 you expect a nice steak and some shrimp... She got 2 wafer thin cardboard cutouts of steak and 4 shrimp.  The shrimp weren't bad, but the steak was horrible.  They replaced the steak with a piece of grilled chicken (cut up).  Our other friend got Spaghetti...She rated it as worse than High School cafeteria food.  At least in High School you know what you're going to get.  She said that the pasta was mush.  I got the Baked RigaTony...normally very good... it was very wet and half of the noodles were soggy and the other half were "ok".   My wife's was the same.  The server did try to argue with us about the meal, but we asked for a manager.  The manager did comp the 2 meals and give us some coupons to go back, but I'm not sure if I want to risk that again after that!

PdEwFI2r239V9VdhMg4Zdw.text: Ate here on Sunday night.  It has been a few months since we have been here.  This is our go to place for decent Italian food.  Once again this place did not disappoint.  It  was a refreshing change and the all you can eat anti pasta salad is always good.  The only bad thing was the server.  Just not interested to be there.  Had to ask different staff for water refills and soda refills.  Had to ask the bartender for a to go cup for the soda.

4M2mdZTVxOskaKuvcaINjQ.text: Excellent service and food was well prepared. Ordered the salmon ravioli which was nicely filled so that every bite was full of flavor. An absolute must try is the baked rigatoni with sausage  Soo delish!!! The manager Mike is very skilled in customer service and truly goes above and beyond to ensure patrons leave happy. Go once and you will definitely be hooked!

VIq0ux2ntXa67S1LVTOrdA.text: Their food is amazing & they would have gotten five stars but a couple of weeks ago I met a friend there for lunch,,,, we were promptly seated & started looking at the menu.... this may not be important to some people but a few minutes later a party started right by us... Rigatony's is a noisey restaurant but if we had of known we would have asked to be seated somewhere else. The people were in no way obnoxious but we couldn't hear each other at all.

0SZxELI7fJWLx6gUJKVdDw.text: My first time dining here today and we ordered from the lunch menu. My first impression was great. It looks and feels very much a local joint, no chain. Next thing is their customer service.  Everyone greets us with big smile. Last but not least, their prices are so reasonable!  They also gave us salad and breads with our meals. There were so much foods for lunch we had leftover for tomorrow.  I enjoyed my cheesecake italian cream soda from one review of the review.   I rarely gave 5 stars... yummy in my tummy!

kx4eNA8M1tvXT-jX5nna1w.text: Went with a couple coworkers. It's very .... Itallian. It feels nice and cozy inside. Which is a great thing for its an Itallian restaurant. Food was great and the service was awesome as well! Definitely coming back to this place

ad3iMOiKJ9uR3o1tPxLSUw.text: Well thank goodness I found this place. Service is exceptional. From the girl that greeted me at the front to my wonderful first dining experience. Everyone very friendly and making awesome suggestions. Frankie knew that I would love the baba boom chicken and she is super friendly with Christian. Next time I'll tell you about the food. Definitely alot for your buck and with deliciousness taste I'll will be back soon.

d6mi5xoGc5kT00czwRLK7Q.text: Yummy antipasto salad and sangria. Comfortable atmosphere and never feel rushed by the serve staff even though people are always waiting for tables.

q_LoBlMm2Qr9pNo7nW50mw.text: There's something for everyone, there are alternatives like quinoa pasta for those with gluten intolerances, and they even ask if it is for allergy purposes, just to make sure you don't consume anything else that contains gluten.  Baked Rigatony with chicken or sausage, or both will knock your socks off.  The pizza is great, the artichoke chicken.  All of it!!!!

LjhmliMxMPezF7PzpD_0Kw.text: It was our 1st trip to Rigatoni's tonight and it's my 1st Yelp review. Food was delicious, the service was outstanding and the restaurant is a gem. We would absolutely recommend Rigatoni's and we will definitely be back!! And try the Tiramisu, yummy.

gTvryTgxZ7Q70e62iZduXw.text: Always busy, always fast, always accommodating.  Rigatoni's is known for doing Italian big.  Their lunch specials are the quickest in town.

V8ho3fQB9as9hXrIUbV7tQ.text: I came here for lunch and was very pleased with it. I opted for the lunch special (baked RigaTony). The food was good and an amazing deal at $7.75. This also included salad and bread. For $10, I had a good sized dish of pasta, salad (enough for two good sized plates if I wanted it), bread, and a soda. It's tough to beat a deal like that for the amount of food I got.  I showed up right around noon and they were pretty busy with a lunch rush, so I would recommend going a bit earlier or a bit later to try to avoid that rush.  Overall...good food, great price. I will definitely be coming here again for lunch.

e_uEaa3sSzvBqlvkNbV_DQ.text: This is a silly complaint but it seemed rather petty so am writing this review. We frequently eat at rigatonis. The food is always exceptional. I ordered a party salad and got a loaf of bread. I asked the receptionist to stamp my card. She informed that she would not be stamping my card that I needed to purchase an entree in order to get a stamp. Seems sort of amazing that you spend 36 dollars and they can not put a stupid stamp on a frequent customer card. And yes I have reviewed this establishment before with very high praise.

mqsNEA80kqpc0wIUGOFFfA.text: Great value good portions. Needs a make over, a little dingy - kind of a diners, drive in's and dives place. Ordered a bottle of wine and they brought out 4 glasses half full with some red? Second time they brought the bottle like it's supposed to be done. The food was very tasty, even the seafood dishes and meal comes with complimentary salad. The canneoli were delicious too.

cLe55QWVV-nOuJRFjDSrsg.text: I was in town on business and decided to have Italian for dinner. The atmosphere was a little noisy but the mood was happy. I was served by a beautiful waitress named Erykka. Great service and really good Italian food. Could not have better. I will be back next trip.

EWAU0cJSQPuykjBcsPqo-A.text: RigaTonys never disappoints. My mission is to try everything on the menu. The taste of their homemade pasta can never be matched. And don't even get me started on the salad... Cause that's just heavenly greens in your mouth!! This visit I had the seafood fettuccine with Mahi ahi tuna, shrimp and scallops. The sauce on it was perfect. Not to heavy but packed with flavor.  I always get a side of artichoke hearts to put in my pasta. Or just eat plain cause artichokes are delicious! If you're ever in the mood for real italian. Stop by. The flavors will definitely have you coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

ezZZrpm2Haq_rjzLdEVu-g.text: What can you say that has not been said? This place is good, it is great actually! Came in the other night to get an order to go. It was ready when I got there as promised. They even carried it to my car.  Food was great, sausage, manocotti, salad, bread, all of it wonderful. I used the restroom while there and it was clean and plesant. Lots of parking and a friendly staff.

tHcBi00S-hPJYdIzvokNuw.text: I am so addicted to this place. Luckily I dont live close (i would go there for every meal) and only make trips here when I am at my boyfriends house on that side of town but everytime we go,  the food is delicious!  I would give it 5 stars but the service is my only downfall with this place. I have never really had a "great" server whenever I go and dine. The service is usually slow and the person that waits on us always seem really tired and out of it. However, their salad and homemade bread is simply amazing.   If you go, you must try their espresso pie as a dessert (thank me later).. its incredible!!!

lzcWZGf20wfHtDAuykgsuA.text: This place is like a hidden gem. Everything from the appetizers to the desserts are mouthwatering. One of my favorite places to dine.

OPJmfLbkwqviebTgcnGVDA.text: We had such a refreshing experience at RigaTony's. Not only was the food amazing our service exceeded our expectations. Our waiter went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. Service and the amazing food will have us going back!

mI-WYAm_OzaO5tvpJ1_3vw.text: I'm from Houston, Texas and in town for business and was looking for a Italian food and came across this place on the web and after reading reviews decided to try it out. We got to the restaurant and was seated and greeted by our waiter name Paul who welcomed us and after brief conversation found out he had family in Houston as well. I ordered the manicotti and my wife got the tour, they were both wonderful as well as the salad and bread they serve before the meal. Our sever was great and would definitely recommend trying this place out.

Ers5GjQQT8H4rIrCn_xjcA.text: My favorite italian place ever. Even when I lived in New York I daydreamed about their red pepper cream sauce. Oh and their dinner salad is amazing.   Keep on keeping on Rigs.

q0LpYsEMIWVtvyrWJns9vw.text: Ate here after reading the 5 star reviews.... great food great servixe_.. we live in Huntington Beach calif and had no idea what to expect. .. very full and happy

uIpJLwgTVdPmCNxafZqmzg.text: I have to be honest, the last few Italian places I've been too didn't impress me so I wasn't too excited to go to RigaTony's. Boy am I glad I went!   Service: absolutely perfect. Not too over the top but just enough to provide the quality attention I needed. Refills were prompt, questions were addressed, smiles all around.  Food: so great! I got the stuffed parmesan shells - YUM! They filled me up and left me wanting more. I tried my date's chicken alfredo pasta and almost wished I'd had that too. Seems like you can't go wrong with what you order here. Plus the house salad and bread added a great touch.   The ambiance and restaurant itself was clean, bright, and smartly decorated. Plus this place is a LOCAL business. Why not try it out? Plenty of parties in here were 6+ - may be the spot to take a large group of friends or family.

BW1VRxorNblCEF6vpCyBKw.text: A nice hidden gem. Everything was really good. I want to come back for the pizza next time.

W11gGNk9ZXfR_LdyaMXncQ.text: The salad, salad dressing and baked rigatony are my go-to orders...flavor is unbeatable...I want to eat it all of the time.  ALSO the capellini checca is pretty darn delish with some added shrimp!  It's even good cold the next day as leftovers!  Try!

DDb-gZ_NKA9gAeT-tmxF5w.text: Went to RigaTony's a few nights ago with the fiance after receiving a $50 gift card for Christmas. It was very busy around 6:45pm and the wait was going to be about 20 minutes. We saw that there were a few booths in the bar area and asked the hostess if these happened to be open seating. To our surprise, they were! It was actually very cozy in the bar area and had a very romantic feel to it.   The booths in the bar area were perfect for two and we were greeted right away. We asked our waitress a recommendation on wine and she suggested the Moscato. My fiance decided to have a glass of this and I decided to try the sangria flight which included, apple, basil and berry. The Italian Moscato that my fiance had was amazing and had just the right amount of sweet to it. The sangria flight was just okay. I would not get it again. the apple was the best by far but the basil one was kind of odd and the berry was way too sweet. We decided on our order and he got the baked lasagna and I got the baked Rigatony, which consisted of Italian sausage with marina and alfredo sauce baked on top of penne pasta. Both of our meals were delicious. We were also served a great Italian salad before the meal which was served with an Italian vinaigrette and pieces of salami on top. It was delicious and I was impressed that this came with our meals.   To top it all off we finished with a bowl of spumoni. It was delicious and the pistachio was my favorite. Service was fantastic, even in the bar area. She made sure we always had everything we needed and brought us a loyalty card at the end of meal and if you come in 6 times, you get your 7th meal free. Overall our visit here was great. We will be back.

XRsqXrECcIZXpe_vgFe7xQ.text: This place overall has great reviews so I was expecting a delicious dinner, but personally, I found the food mediocre.  I ordered the chicken parm with rigatoni pasta (and marinara) and my boyfriend got the short ribs.  He thought his portion was fairly small but said it tasted alright.  I thought my dish was a good portion for the price.  But it was just "ok".  But I will say the dinner bread was really yummy and the salad before the meal was pretty good as well.  Their house vinaigrette was tasty, much better than their house pesto ranch. My boyfriend had the apple bread pudding for desert and he said it was pretty good.  You definitely know you are at an Italian restaurant by the decor.  We felt like we were at Grandma's for dinner, which is a comforting feeling but it is definitely outdated to say the least.  We were a bit confused at the items/food for sale at the front, where the hostess is at.  Strange that you could buy some Quest bars, a pizza cutter and some soda, I guess it's your next best option if you don't want to go to the grocery store.  With all the options of restaurants around here, most likely we will not go back.

Ydbe310uBGHkrqByNqQ1pg.text: I loved this place, fantastic authentic Italian food. I wanted to try everything on the menu. Unfortunately, I only got to try the deep dish lasagna and my fiance got the baked manicotti everything tasted so savory, that melted in our mouths. I usually don't care much for the salad and bread that are brought to the table before the meal but I enjoyed these also, so much that I kept the salad and finished it as I ate my entree. We also tried the tiramisu which was like a big pudding square that melted in our mouths also. It was so delicious, I wanted to get another one but we got really full. I was so disappointed that I found such a good place when we were only in town for one day. Hopefully, I'll get to come back and try some other things again.

j1KV-d9ko1kGCV8X3R9d1g.text: My second time here, and again I am so impressed! Suggestion: Make a reservation! We only waited 10 minutes for our table. But we heard others who just showed up, being told 45+ minutes. My girlfriend and I split the "Tour of RigaTony's" and it was delicious!!!! However, there is a $3 charge for splitting a plate. Meh... Atmosphere is nice, but service is almost a lil too quick. Still, I'd take this place any day over Olive Garden!

3HHaO7CoHWlx8sCqRSIuxQ.text: I've been to rigatony's many times now and what got me to write this review today was their above and beyond customer service. The taste of food has always been great, but today my girlfriend and I experienced a very small inconvient situation and it was that the bread that rigatony serves before every meal was delayed due to the restaurant being very busy.  The restaurant manager Todd came over to our table to notify what was going on and was extremely apologetic, polite and professional. For him to come over as the manager himself when the restaurant was busy, just tells me and my girlfriend how important and serious customer service is at rigatony's. I have always loved this place telling all my friends about it telling them its a 4-4.5 star restaurant, but after today's experience it's most definitely deserves a 5. Food can always taste good, but having great customer service can always help the food taste that much better. Thanks again Todd for this great experience today!

94PZAKTFGhk2vd97IvUHOg.text: Always a pleasure. Every meal comes with a delicious salad and hot bread. Good selection of seafood dishes. Better than the olive garden, but still not the best.

bY6Xe4HcLoQ6g8qs0AOBnA.text: It was our first time there and service was incredibly fast!! The price was also very reasonable. A casual setting with high quality food and service!! Frankey, our server, was friendly and attentive. I had "the tour" which is a little of all their favorite dishes and it was great!! Could easily be two meals. Dinners come with family style salad and bread so you don't need an appetizer but if you want one, the calamari was great!

7kqBgBAObcHVl-urZAAIlg.text: My favorite restaurant in Arizona.  Whenever referring this to friends, I tell them it's the price of Olive Garden but so much better.  When getting an entree, you get free bread and salad.  The bread is pretty average for an Italian place, but the salad is what keeps me addicted to the place.  It comes with a great house dressing, and the small strips of salami make it unreal.  I try to fill up on this as much as possible (all you can eat) and have a little of my entree and bring the rest of the entree home as leftovers.  Entree-wise, the Baked Rigatony is our go-to dish if nothing else is really standing out; sometimes it comes a little low on sauce so asking for extra sauce is a good precaution.  Haven't ever been disappointed with entrees.  Make sure to make reservations if you're going sometime between 5:30-7:30, especially on weekends.  The hosts provide good service.  My only knocks on the place are hit-or-miss on good service from servers, and that the place is usually very loud.  But the food and price makes up for it.  The prices over the last few years have come up $2 or so per entree; as long as they don't skyrocket, I'll be coming to this place for a long time.

DS-NngYqyfcL-DlZRLoXbA.text: We were in the market for some good old fashioned Italian so we made the trek to Rigatony's based on it's shining Yelp reviews. The little taster of house chianti they offered right after we were seated put us off to a good start. The salad was delicious (I'm a sucker for a salad with red onions and pepperoncini, bonus points for salami!). The bread was also a tasty starter dipped in oil with some spices (oregano & rosemary, I think), so we skipped any additional appetizers. My husband ordered the linguini and clams (he asked for it to be prepared with a lemon garlic style sauce instead of the menu offerings of Parmesan cream or tomato sauce and the waitress immediately recognized his request as "traditional style" and said it was no problem), I ordered the shrimp scampi. My dish was perfect, the shrimp and angel hair pasta were cooked to perfection and delicious! My husband enjoyed his dish but was not bowled over by the actual clams in the dish (possibly they were canned, not fresh?). That is pretty much the only thing keeping me from giving a 5 star review. The cannoli was amazing and I love that they include 2 so I didn't have to battle my husband for my fair share. The price was also really good, compared to the other Italian restaurants, I think we'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cannoli!
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Linguini &amp; clams
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp scampi over angel hair

Ocud2v7JWsEIwVc32ull5A.text: I've been eating at this restaurant since I was ten years old! I remember when they were located in Mesa and it has RARELY let me down. The new location is much more updated and I love how they still manage to have the same sense of authenticity. This is my families favorite Italian restaurant in the valley- and that says a lot because we are all Italian immigrants and can sometimes be critical about certain traditional dishes.The only thing I've noticed is the dessert could use more variety. However, I love the price point- especially their lunch specials, that is the best deal.  When it comes to service, I overall don't have many complaints. My most recent visit I had a server named Erykka and she was very friendly and I could tell she was knowledgeable about the menu. My drink was never empty and I appreciate her for recommending a new dish to me because I rarely stray away from their classic "Baked Rigatony (with sausage)".  I always recommend Rigatony's to anyone visiting or living in Arizona and will continue to do so, keep up the great work!

EOGo6jU11AIo8Qyd8GGAbg.text: Not bad if you're in the mood for cheap low quality Italian food. It is obvious that very little is made fresh there. The noodles are store bought, the ravioli is clearly frozen, the salad appears to be bagged, and it's apparent that the sauces aren't even made in house. I really want to like this place, but I feel the quality has diminished drastically over the years. There doesn't appear to be anything "authentic" about the food here. Save yourself some money and just go to the store and buy jar sauce and packaged noodles. It's the same thing, minus the hour long wait for a table.

jslZKJhza_NEFFYssBM_5g.text: This is a nice place - we always reserve the group room for work functions and its a wonderful private area. The salad and bread are delicious. The Baked Rigatony is good! Great location with ample parking.

4F_yg5BtnDMA4TBxlMi8Ew.text: The most enjoyable part of RigaTony's was the atmosphere they created. Sure the starting salad with oven-fresh bread was plentiful, the entrees were classic, flavorful, and filling, the wine selection was concise and appropriate, the Italian sodas were exciting and invigorating, and the staff was friendly and accommodating. RigaTony's certainly had all of those things, but from the moment you enter their front door you feel like you entered a different world. I'm going to admit, after seeing the store from the outside I was extremely skeptical; it kinda looked like a Denny's or IHOP. But when I walked through their front doors, I was greeted by an unsuspecting air of homeliness and familiarity. It made you feel like you were walking into their dining room for a home-cooked family meal. From the smell of the kitchen to the buzzing chatter of the guests, it just felt so comfortable. 5-stars well deserved.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. An Italian feast!

EqGNmhhf3MncEo6jLDJZ6g.text: RigaTonys family owned Italian restaurant ~         "Fa get about it" ~    Talk about fast, talk about service talk about freshness ~ fa get about it...   Hey there Yelpers out there, I went to RigaTonys today with of course my office crew, this time "Gabe" called the place.  Gabe has been bragging about this place for months so off we went.  After all that hype, I was ready to lay the hammer down--- they laid the hammer on me... I'am hooked for life. Wow! these folks just serve great homemade style cooking, fresh, hot, large servings and our drink glasses never made it 1/2 before our friendly waitress was on it.   Oh!! did I mention there was about 18-20 of us in the group hmmm,  and they never missed a beat.  These folks know how to serve you and serve you quiclky, I was also, shocked at how much food was heading out the front door.  They do catering too.  Great stuff,  Everyone knows I can cook and I love to out do the local resturants but me and my buddies agreeed leave the Itailian cooking to RigaTony's when you can just go there eat and be merry.                               A++

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Greg and Nick

mNYRo5cfJ10AyaTB_pTIcQ.text: THE BEST Italian Food in Tempe. Rigatony's reminds me of New York Italian Food! I go here for every birthday, and event. I always order Chicken Marsala, all you can eat antipasto salad, and wine!! This restaurant has not let me down, and the service is always great! Especially for always going with such big groups of people! I am going there for my birthday this weekend, with 15 friends! Can't wait! Highly Recommend!!

SiNUx4fs0ILwRAvOIwmFxg.text: Rigatony's is hands down the best Italian restaurant in Tempe.  Great food, full portions, and awesome service.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

lZ2GkUkiINWhyiUlOjd_Xg.text: The first time my family mentioned amazing Italian food in the middle of random Tempe Arizona , I did not believe them. But I was wrong ! Rigatonys is not only one of the best Italian foods in Tempe but I will go as far to say it is one of the best Italian foods I have ever had. They start you off with some huge family size salad which is to die for. The portion size is enough for a couple to share, or just bring the other home for lunch the next day. I am all about this place , don't fill up on bread and salad !   Try the tour or the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken ! Both amazing !!!!!

-jcNugAWr6nbJ5LNwCJE_Q.text: This is our go-to spot. The food is affordable and very tasty. The baked rigatoni and the Boston frizzled peppers are amazing. I'm not a huge salad fan, but their antipasto is the best I've had in AZ. We love the atmosphere. The charm and all.  The only issue is the service can be hit-or-miss. We never have the same server (wonder why?) Usually they will try to rush you, but don't let them. Just space out ordering drinks, appetizers, and entries and you'll be fine.

KGX1AOBsBGZ-O7qC1GB6xw.text: Why are people waiting for this place?   Every time I've been here the wait has been at least 30 minutes long, and honestly, I'm not sure why. The food and service are ok, not great. Portions are somewhat small for the price, and like so many Italian restaurants, the food is smothered in tomato sauce (a little sweet for my taste) and garlic.  I know this is probably how some people like it, but this is not how Italian food should be prepared.   THIS IS IN NO WAY "AUTHENTIC ITALIAN."  I cannot say anything was horrible, but after visiting several times I keep asking myself, "why do I keep coming back?" If Olive Garden is too busy, sure, check this place out. Otherwise, I'll pass.

oG3h1MuMgaI8jJDL4VYL2Q.text: Lunch with a large group. Service was efficient, well organized and friendly. The food was good although I found the tomato sauce a little too sweet. The bread, however, may be the best I have ever had in any restaurant and I've eaten in hundreds!

V39bbhD6cfIvmNCfQ3G96w.text: About 45 minute wait to be seated which was ok.     Salad and bread where good. Spinach artichoke dip was very good.  My husbands chicken parm was very good, although they put to much sugar in the sauce, it was way too sweet.  Service was great!  Problem was my dinner.  I got the lemon chicken zoodles which was awful. The chicken in it was old.  Meat of all I'm l kind gets a metallic taste when it's been cooked then cooled and reheated.  Its disgusting and that is exactly what the chicken in my dinner tasted like.

Cx4Q4I-e1by7i5zUoSpClw.text: The salad is to die for. Save room for dessert.  Oh, and there's a past dish for everyone! This place is a family fav!

E-idescG1YjNhVb-AcM_Vg.text: NOT WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR AT ALL..... For the record don't judge this place from my review, I didn't even stay to eat. After waiting 30 minutes for a waiter to bring me a water and say hi and having to listen to the atmosphere that whole time, I had no choice. This is the Denny's of the Italian food world. This is Buca's poor stepchild.

9GuZun0ZzfaSs3KRLtOa0A.text: Great Italian food.  Quality ingredients prepared the right way.  Excellent value .  When I'm back in Tempe, Az I'll definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great value,  and amazing quality and taste
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Amazing
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Absolutely amazing food.

Y1KCxAXIRc3V-4Gp-tc07A.text: This is an oldie but goodie. Located in South Tempe. The servings are large and extremely reasonable. The fettuccine is amazing and the house salad is just  fantastic and served family style. Great place to go  with a large group without breaking the bank.. they also have a wonderful lunch it would be difficult to find a place with a better lunch menu and price point

PURdjg_fgtutBlcw6c7E4g.text: Now this is a restaurant I always recommend going to because the food is delicious and the service is always great, I've been going here for years and my family and I go here for birthdays, dinners of just to have lunch with friends and it's always a great time

dZbV4rsDiDw4AJ_KFuGXJw.text: Best family owned Italian in town!  Good food, friendly service and best of all are the complimentary bread and Italian salad.

ismEOamxXAwk6osdy4-vvw.text: We had lunch today at RigaTonys.  It was very good!!  We had the cheese ravioli with meat sauce, the rigatoni with Italian sausage lunch special, and the Chianti Short ribs with mashed potatoes and asparagus.  All was delicious!!  They served bread and an anti pasta salad, both which were also very good!  The service was very friendly!

wPib9fab_klRh0AdUSP1Yw.text: We went to RigaTonys for Fathers Day at the request of my husband.  We arrived at 4:15 thinking we were early and there would be so wait.  We were wrong, 45-60 min wait.  We waited for just less than an hour and were seated.  I was so impressed with the process happening at the front end, so many carry out orders, people who had made reservations, people just walking in, it could have been chaos but it wasn't.  The wait was so worthwhile because the food was fantastic!  I tried the sangria flight-3 full glasses of delicious sangria.  The antipasto salad was absolutely to die for and was such a large helping for 3 of us.  My husband had fettuccine Alfredo, my son had lasagna and I had baked manicotti-delish!  We also ordered cannoli for dessert, yum!  Overall we were extremely pleased and so full, we took a lot home.  Great job!

IK3Se0RC0zBAI0qzg0wXYA.text: They had a real good starter salad but l ordered the sampler plate and was disappointed it wasn't any better then the Olive Garden

aLr0bzvNQm6l9CTKvTUyfQ.text: By far my most favorite Italian restaurant. They start you off with a huge salad and focaccia bread and their portions are very generous for their entrees. However, the last time I was there I decided I'd try the roast beef sub and I was deeply disappointed. It was so full of gristle that I couldn't even eat it. I didn't send it back but I should have. That is one time out of 30 that I have been disappointed with a dinner there. Their lunch specials are always great

_jDKEbTGRCqnG8oMiUYtUA.text: All I can say is AMAZING the staff was friendly and the food came out fresh and fast. The pizza was fresh, and was a good size portions especially for a toddler. The salad that was served before the meal was exceptionally good, and the olives topped it off really well. The rigatoni was sooooo fresh, and all of the seasoning and the cheeses flowed very well together, so far the best I have had with the noodles cooked to perfection. Will definitely come back to have some very good Italian food!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pizza
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pizza

k9CkcS3XuaqvbAflAcV8Cg.text: Another delicious dinner served with amazing bar service by Austin, a fabulous bartender! Dinner was so good! Lasagna and a Cicero sandwich! The antipasto salad is perfect! They employ my Corona High School students. This is our go to restaurant! Try it, you'll love it! Guaranteed!!

IxGfIOmgBM81OPxEsHL8CQ.text: First, it goes without saying that the service was great and the food was delicious--both 5 stars.   I want to make a special note to RigaTony's management. I came in for their free federal employee lunch. The government shutdown is scary and difficult for most of us federal employees. This generous offer of a delicious meal on the house is a wonderfully kind gesture and greatly appreciated. Everyone was nice and didn't make us feel awkward about receiving the free lunch. The manager came over at the end of our lunch and thanked us for our service to the American people; this was a very nice gesture and brought a little light into an otherwise dark time.  I can't say thank you enough to RigaTony's and I will be a regular customer when the government opens back up.

CCTPVszAR3VpGbAPjZVdrA.text: Salad=awesome! Bread=one was burnt, the next loaf was perfect! My chicken parm=amazing!!!! I get fettuccine alfredo with mine to mix it up a bit. Husband's lasagne was good, except was cold in the middle. Heated it up at home and it was great.  Waiter was in the weeds most of the night so service was not great.   We will definitely go back!!! Good food and terrific atmosphere.

w4528h0HDaCSs7OTfYAQHQ.text: "Chefs don't actually say, 'That's a spicy meat-a-ball,' except to indicate that there's a bomb threat in the restaurant without alarming the customers. Terrorism is the spiciest meatball there is."  Mario Batali  RigaTony's:  Your Italian sweetheart since 1994.  Their antipasto salad and house ciabatta are pretty delicious.  Wash it down with some Italian sodas [$2.50 each] and it's bliss.  I'm glad these were are offered right away because it was a busy Friday and it took a while before our food came out.  I was hungry and their salad and ciabatta bread tasted great.  We ordered the Tour of RigaTony's [$18.50 - Chicken picatta, baked manicotti, grilled Italian sausage, and fettucine alfredo] and a Fettucino Alfredo [$14.25].  We also ordered some Pistachio Cannoli [$5.50 for two] to go.  A big bowl of fettuccine alfredo might not be the most exciting dish but all I really need in life are some noodles and some fattening cream sauce. The portion was huge. I ate about half in the restaurant and the other half of as my midnight snack. The Tour of RigaTony was also pretty good. The favorite bite on that plate was the manicotti. As for the pistachio cannoli, I wouldn't know what to say. I didn't even get a bite before they were both devoured! Some people are just so rude! I guess they were just that good.  All in all, RigaTony's is an excellent place for some good Italian eats.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Peach bellini martini.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. 2lbs. of clams. GET THESE! Then use the bread and soak up all that delicious wine!

fP0MVe0-zSd637Jet3lq7Q.text: I've driven past this place for years and it's always packed so I thought I should try it out. It is what I expected... The atmosphere was crowded and noisy and the food was average. The calamari appetizer was very good. I guess they're famous for their family style, antipasta salad which wasn't bad but again not great or exciting. I had the Carb Smart pasta which I thought was a nice healthy option but the taste was horrible. I guess that's what you get for ordering healthy at an Italian restaurant.

s7Z468mY-Ncp_LpaSqaZsg.text: From Illinois and was out in AZ for spring training. This place was packed and for good reason ! Our server was awesome - food came out perfectly timed from salad to apps to entree to dessert. Had the calamari, baked rigatoni and tiramisu

R4nPaJz6Vn0O-Zf_iml47A.text: Solid place for some Italian food. The salad and bread absolutely kills Olive Garden. In fact, after you try this, you will never want to have Olive Garden again! I even think this place is a little cheaper. Really good food and really great staff. The iced tea is on point too! Do yourself a favor and stop by!

CWkgQ97eB5XhREVh3D-z7Q.text: Went in for lunch on a Saturday at 130. Place wasn't too crowded on the inside, although there was a wait to get seated.  We order the fried calamari and two lunch specials.  Salad and bread came quick, which was good although the salad was overwhelming from too much sauce.   Fried calamari, which was an appetizer, came nearly 20 minutes later despite the waitress telling us countless times that it would be out in a second. When it did come, it was soggy and honestly, didn't taste fresh. 1/5  We waited another 20 minutes but our lunch specials did not arrive. Mind you we order simple pasta, nothing that needed to be baked or whatnot. Food came about 45 minutes after our arrival/order, and it looked miserable. My girl's pasta had literally 1 meat ball inside, and you could count the number of pasta on my Alfredo fettuccini.   Lunch special portion wise: 1/5 Taste wise: 1/5 - honestly go to a grocery store and buy the pre-made sauces, its way better than this. Service: 2/5 - although the waitress was polite, she never offered any reasoning as to why the food took so long and seemed nonchalant about it.  Save yourself and just hit up Oregano's instead fam

kfSSigSesZVW1_Uce9_nSw.text: Amazingly tasty!!! Long road trip & was still open at 9pm! We had a very good waitress! Not only was she professional, she did not hesitate when we asked her about items on the menu! So we ended up with very satisfying entrees! If you find yourself in Chandler , AZ. You gotta try this place. Huge salad and bread before dinner. The kids Pizza is fresh and not frozen! LOVE this place!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Loved it!
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kids pizza
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Super Good!

vM0AGAXgNvS6AaAPd_RAGg.text: Love this place! We have been here numerous times over the years (old place and this location) and it's always top notch service and delicious food. It gets very busy sometimes so there may be a wait, but it's worth it.

w136ODjyUPxhZwctjrL79g.text: Food here is delicious. The bread and salad at the beginning of the meal is extremely delicious. It's probably the best part of the meal. I ordered the chicken parmesan. It had a little too much sauce for me and not enough cheese but overall it was good. My husband ordered the Baked RigaTony and he thought it was tasty. The staff was nice and happy. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fresh Baked Ciabatta Bread
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Antipasto Salad
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Parmesan

A0jMD4PdaRRJEHZKc_F9Rw.text: My first visit, but extended family dine here a few times a month.   First thing you notice is the warm hospitality from when you walk in until you leave. Ty, I believe in the GM he is on top of his game and knows how to treat his customers  Our server was Scott, can't say enough about this young man.  He is polite, wonderful server and oh so patient, this was a party of 6 adults 2 which can test the patience of anyone and Scott was AA++.  Can't say enough about the great service.    Now the food was awesome.  We all had different entrees and we all loved them.  They serve a large salad with black olives, sliced salami, pepocinis, tomatos, red onions and cheese.  Served with warm  seasoned bread and oil for dipping.   Their marinara is packed with flavor.  I had the chicken parmigiana it was great.  All the food was great.  A few had desert of limoncello canolis and warm bread pudding.     I will be back and now understand why the win so many Best of awards.  Top food, top management and top service.  Thank you Tyn& Scott and the super sweet young buser who helped clean up my water spill.

rTMFP2MfMRlnAMX4QuSGiw.text: Omg. My brother and I loved our first visit here.   I got the basic spaghetti and mushrooms and he got the seafood pasta and we also got the apple bread pudding and holy cow it was the best thing ever.   I've been having dreams about it. Good dreams.

Rtd9zRVyPk7x4uauX1kTYA.text: Would give this place a higher score if the service hadn't been so terrible. Our server seemed too busy to even deal with my family and I when we came in for dinner. However the food was very tasty! Got the rigatoni, seafood fettuccine with creamy pepper sauce which I then switched to the vodka sauce and cake for desert! Large portions and very classic Italian tasting I would come back again if not for the lack of service.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Side of meatballs, seafood fettuccine, rigatoni and sandwhich.

6R63BRykyrYfTzIVrwADdQ.text: We stopped in for a weeknight dinner and had no trouble getting seated right away. Our server was attentive and answered menu questions readily. Husband ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce and added a meatball. I got the cheese tortellini with pesto cream sauce. The salad that comes with the entrees was large and hearty enough for a meal in itself with loads of salami and cheese. The bread was warm, fresh and delicious. My tortellini were the cheesiest richest puffs of goodness. Next time I'll try a marinara sauce because the cream is richer than needed for the pasta.   We overheard a mishap with a neighboring table's order - wrong toppings on a pizza- and it was handled promptly and professionally. Service was quick and attentive. We will be back.

FBs5iK8w2xNQUlHMOI8E4w.text: The food was really good and affordable and our waiter Ian was amazing I was half way done with my drink and he had already brought me another one! I have never had such good service, he was really quick and friendly and  made sure we had everything we needed! Would defiantly recommend to everyone and will be returning

8BCLVZZBZKyQT7H_5M-h6g.text: I took my girlfriend out for our anniversary and our waiter Ian made the whole evening amazing. He took amazing care of us, recommended his favorite meals, which after our evening I must admit are our favorites now. We will be coming back soon to see our favorite waiter Ian, without a doubt!

UQ87wdkydtPJ6EemRo4GXw.text: This use to be my favorite restaurant. Love the food. But since they moved from the Chandler location. The service has gone down majorly. We had a dinner for my niece's 21st and we waited almost 3 hours to be seated.  The Hostess was rude and management was not organized. This is soooo unfortunate! We will never come back for a family gathering, so sad! The waiter and waitress were great thank you for being so attentive after the disastrous night.

q0n3msp4CVUVf-i0FqB91w.text: We have only recently become regulars after driving by many years. This place is awesome, food is more than great. Service rocks, Bryce, Frankey, Alexa, Shannie at the bar, fast , fast , fast. Stop in and see for yourself. We split an entree and salad  and it's perfect

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

U0Uz7XCEp3LrcdXW3zuO2Q.text: Love Rigatony's and need to go more often! Around the holidays we go a lot, if you buy gift cards they give you free take out vouchers which are a deal! It is a little far and out of the way for us but every time I go I say i should go more often! The salad they have that comes with the meals is one of my favorite restaurant salads. It has salami on it and a great Italian dressing. The baked rigatoni is delicious. My daughter likes their Italian soda's and I love their cannoli. The service has always been really good and it is a quirky atmosphere.

ktIqpABjM_y4oKUm51qzJQ.text: I always make it a point to take my daughter here when visiting Tempe. The food and service are outstanding. Best to call ahead for a reservation. Recommend the rigatoni with meatballs, and the clams for an appetizer.

qiywlAyFwLdLAbRnSP1Y5A.text: Attended a family birthday party here. First, I noticed that it looked clean and environment felt good. Turning to the food and service. The salad was a bit soggy.  The bread was good a bit hard on the edges. Our main dishes was good. I ordered the lemon chicken with alfredo. The chicken was flavorful, tasty and tender. Alfredo was good. Our server wasn't so friendly, he was rude and very impatient. The server totally didn't take my son's order. The server never came around to be notified, we were able to get his attention when the other food came out. We had young children ages 7-10, the server was rude and impatient to them when asked what they want to drink and when he came back around to pick up their used plates. Lastly, my water was never re-filled. :( And during these temps, water goes fast..... We shared our unhappiness with the manager, they didn't charge for the missed order and brought a few desserts to our table to make attempt to make up for this. A special birthday dinner, wasn't so special at RigaTony's. :(

Iu2Ywe7MhbgmPDgJKBqgPw.text: Our first time here and we had such an amazing time! There was a wait, but we joined the bar for a glass of wine before they quickly sat us at our table. The service from Jenna and the manager were perfect! We started with the antipasto salad, which had the perfect amount of dressing and the flavors were fresh. We had the clams (brought in fresh daily) in the white wine sauce, which was AMAZING and it will be something we order EVERY TIME we go back. We had the Sicilian pizza for two which had a great balance between the sauce and the meat and a perfectly crisp crust. We finished off with an order of cannolis. The strawberry cheese cake filled cannoli was the perfect ending to our night. We will definitely be coming back soon!

MWhnk6Vkv-24KtEGxBk0fw.text: Coming here for dinner without reserverations is not a good idea.  We waited 1.5 hours to be seated in a very crowed front entrance with limited seating. This can and was irritating. Finally after waiting we were seated in a large dinning room. We were seated right next to a doorway where there were 5 other tables.  Every time a waitress went to another table she bumped into my chair and I was nervous when she carried a tray right over my head that she would drop it on me.  We were waited on by Abby who was fabulous!  She took the time to explain the menu to us and checked on us regularly.   The food was okay, not the best I had in the Phoenix but not the worst either.  The portions are big, but to me the sauce was not balanced.  It was sweet but you could still taste the bitterness of the tomato paste.  Maybe they need my old boyfriend's grandmother's recipe from Sicily which takes me 6.5 hours to cook and is the best tomato sauce I ever tasted.  Anyway, would I come back,  I don't think so .  There are too many restaurants in the valley who have a better atmosphere and better menus.  Do they cost more? Yes, but when I want good food it's worth to pay a little more.

ATUqxIfxjo3iZ_K36y0Wng.text: The food was delicious!!  I had the pesto pasta with chicken. The food was brought to us quickly, and came with all you can eat antipasto salad and bread....yummy.  Everyone was so nice and the service was awesome. My mom is a very picky Italian and will not eat at Italian restaurants at all. I can't wait to bring her to this authentic restaurant cause I know she will love it!!

eFsWvM4t2XdACN5GGO0e2w.text: If we could give a zero we would! We had reservations for 9 ppl tonight for a 60th birthday party a guest of ours brought their 2 younger grand daughters (7&8) & they said we changed our reservation & would have to wait an additional hour and a half we said they wouldn't take much room & could even sit on someone's lap they didn't care & turned us away & told us we had to wait due to the reservation change. The guests then offered to leave because they didn't want to ruin the birthday but they shouldn't have had to do that we said we were leaving & would never return & they didn't bat an eye and said 1 HR & a half to meet our additional needs. so we went to Olive Garden who had no problem accommodating our party! So sad!

hpnocdcm5b9gbcUK4H-uqA.text: First time here was 3/23/16 and the place was packed at 6:45pm. Our party of 6 was seated quickly and served in a timely manner. The food was perfect!  Every one of us stuffed our faces and would've eaten a 2nd order if we could fit it.  We will DEFINITELY be eating here again, hopefully on a warmer evening so we can eat on the patio.  Great place!  Yum!

TZREzArJnICat3cAoFzneQ.text: Our meal was wonderful as it always is. The antipasto salad cannot be beat. My only disappointment  was that they stopped serving the shrimp stuffed shells!! Please bring them back!!

C7v2bOJMPSwBZBLOqwrdqg.text: The food and the salad that accompanies the entrees is delicious!! I am really picky about my food and this place is legit!  The pasta was al dente and very tasty! I got the baked rigatoni and my son got the mac and cheese and both were outstanding!

C9AS_OEalddxFV_2Xk7J1w.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in the East Valley!!! I have been coming here for years. I love it. In about 10 years I have never had an instance where there was bad service they are always very nice cheerful and on time. I get the baked rigatoni with chicken almost every time it is so delicious!!!!

JZcwKxOBfD9KxeFgLBqMeg.text: The antipasto salad is so amazing good! They aren't usually busy, it was my first time and I didn't know the menu to well, my waiter wasn't very helpful but I'd definitely go back!

U0sOQFxeY-74nQzv4C2l4A.text: We had a huge to go order yesterday.  It was very busy.  But the staff was so nice took good care of us.  Not only do they have delicious food  the service is amazing.  It's always worth the wait.

WWLJ8mYVmzNY4aZBMUEYZQ.text: We ate there yesterday to celebrate my best friend's birthday because this was her favorite restaurant. The antipasto salad was awesome! I ordered Baked Rigatony which is mouth watering, the only downside was the pasta was undercooked so I asked the server to exchange it with a new one. The service was ok, they refilled our water ones so my friend was asking for my water. I think it was a busy night for our server that he forgot to refill our drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tour of rigatony
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Four cheese penne
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken marsala

c0PmzCJaT4hNtAxwPEx55g.text: Was in town to visit family and second time we went as a group of 10. Thought was odd that they wouldn't take a phone ahead or reservation but wait wasn't too long though.  Food was just ok this time and waitress was marginal

HKFejtV3H0OJ_BGX-VvmWg.text: What do you write when you like everything about a place... except the food?  And even then, you didn't dislike the food, it just wasn't to your taste.  You see, RigaTony's serves up some hearty, meaty, thick lasagna... but the sauce is toooooo sweeeeet.  My friend and I thought the same thing.  Unfortunately, we both liked the restaurant but are not fans of sweet tomato sauce, instead preferring a garlicy, spicy sauce.    That being said, if you are a fan of food on the sweeter side (which obviously many are since it was nicely packed)... I'd recommend RigaTony's.  The restaurant is way cute, service is great and you like the feeling you have when you're there.  It'd be good for a date, business meeting or just fun night out.    Btw, we found their tent at the farmer's market a few weeks ago and had to come in after that.  Offering up inexpensive, tasty breakfast pizza is a great marketing move! :)  And the 'sample' of wine that was delivered to our table when we first sat down was a good move too.    I'd go again if friends wanted to meet here but I'd order something that did not have a tomato-based sauce.  Might not see ya there!

KetN_kkVTreOZj15TGwP0w.text: Omg phenomenal fettucine alfredo!  The cannoli was just ok, otherwise this might have been a 4.5.  Solid 4 stars.  :-)

NJdMIo3bSRcyRuU5OkNDgA.text: The service was excellent, but I found the food to be very mediocre at best...Had Meat Sauce on one entree and marinara on the other, both very bland, flavorless.  The bread they serve obviously comes frozen and is served cold, just not good.  Salad is ok, and the dessert (4 Layer chocolate cake) is another Frozen jobber, dry and unexciting.  I find the bread and meat sauce at The old Spaghetti factory to be much more to my liking.  Would be willing to try other entrees at Rigatony's.  Guess my friend and I made a mistake by opting for the $8.95 early bird special, go figure!

PRv1wpAk85eidhSP7zFFvA.text: OMG YUMMY!  OK, I am a self proclaimed "food whore" I could sleep in a pan of veggie lasagne!  Not only is the food awesome but it is LOCALLY OWNED!!!  Take that, salty Olive Garden and corporate America!  I have been here many times but I have to say taking someone who has never been and seeing the look after their first bite....Priceless!  I went with my "friend with benefits" and we had the best server! Her name was Misty and she was just the right amount of attentive, sweet and funny.   Knowing they bring out a salad and bread with olive oil first, I asked if they could put the salami on the side since I am a veg. Guess what? It came out on the side! AMAZING!   For our main courses, I had the eggplant and he had the stuffed shells. We each tried a bite of each others meals and I liked the shells as much as the eggplant! I have had the manicotti there too and it was great. So now I'll be in a quandary the next time I go, what to order? If THAT was my only decision in life!  This place gets really crowded on the weekends so go after 8. The house Chianti is really good too!

dCbDUxmpX-k6_IIRaQVHrw.text: So delicious!! The food here is absolutely amazing. I had the Baked Rigatoni and I'm completely addicted! If you want good, affordable Italian food, this is the place. The staff was exceptionally friendly which only added to the brilliant experience I had here

SDcokAevw9oWfL1VXOaUmA.text: Nothing to see here, move along.  Mediocre food. Bland. Overcooked. Gummy/Pasty Pasta.  Not horrible, but with the number of really good independent Italian restaurants in the valley - why waste your time and money?  Specifics:  Manicotti - Filled with a tasteless ricotta cheese paste that could double as drywall filler, topped with warm crushed tomatoes and a couple shreds of melted mozzarella.  Fettuccine Alfredo - The pasta was sticky and gummy. The "Alfredo" sauce was a plain white sauce with flecks of something that may have been an attempt at seasoning.  Italian Sausage - Way overcooked, dry, like trying to saw wood when cutting into it. Nicely spicy though.  Chicken Piccata - Beaten and lightly fried the cutlet was nonetheless dry. Topped with a mixture of mushrooms, capers, and tomatoes. Not just topped, buried under. Disappointing and still the best dish served.

7EDuFZFPTCV1FjUjDI5Cog.text: tried this place on Wednesday and we are going back on Saturday. the food is just over the top in this restaurant..you get plenty food and it is the best place we have been too......we just love it

JBse_KDYuJYvTxZ9v4xXCg.text: The best Italian place around! Make sure to get there early because this place always fills up quick, even on week nights and at lunch. You cannot make reservations for large groups. Anyways, the food is phenomenal. My personal favorite is the Alfredo (I know, boring) Once you are seated, the server brings you garlic bread and antipasto salad. Every server we have is nice and happy to help. Even though we don't go all the time, the servers try to remember our orders, wow! The food always comes out fast even when the restaurant is jam-packed. The atmosphere is nice, and marches the Italian-homey feel. The prices are incredibly affordable for a sit-down restaurant. They even have a loyalty card. Go 5 times, and the next time your entree is free with purchase of another entree. If you can't finish , they box up the food for you Basically, I love this place and I would recommend.

X_hGX8aKbWoXcAPyS8wl0A.text: My fave local Italian restaurant for lunch and dinner!  I come here every other week, totally in love with Rigatony's. Their antipasti salad (it's served with bread sticks when buying an entree)  is soooo good, better than Olive Garden's for sure. I love how everyone there is super friendly and helpful. The owners are wonderful to talk to when I had a complaint about a waitress one time. My sister and I love coming here for lunch and dinner because they have a pasta special called the "Pasta-bilities" affordable @ $6.99 and you get to choose your pasta/sauce/toppings. Their seafood pastas are very delicious and not overpriced. I always love taking my out-of-town relatives and friends here for lunch! Overall, great local Italian family restaurant!  P.S Try their tiramisu, it's to die for!!!!!!

6N6-np32Cr-4l605OlxYww.text: Endless salad and bread combined with a salmon penne is my usual dish. It isn't quite as large as some of the others (Tour of Rigatoni's is great and a lot of food.) but never let's me down.  The servers are always nice (I've been there 5 times). Only problem is that this place is popular and there can be a healthy wait during peak hours.

jDl0dreJZMTwGu_N8JSTrw.text: RigaTony's is one of my favorite restaurants in the Phoenix area. My family has been eating here for nearly 20 years. My little sister actually once barfed up pool water and Oreos in the lobby of the old location after a long day of swimming at Grandma's house... ahhh, memories. (They were extremely nice about it.)  Anyways. I COULD order just their delicious salad and bread here and be totally satisfied, but I never do. I always have a terrible time deciding between Penne Rosa (probably my favorite), Baked Rigatony, Capellini Checca, Chicken Picatta, Stuffed Shells, and a ton of other things. I love them all. We've also ordered their large to-go pans for parties at home several times, and those have always been fantastic as well. There's a reason this restaurant is always packed, and I always look forward to taking out-of-town guests to our favorite restaurant!

8TMhbLLYhyy4HislSLK_8Q.text: Went to lunch with a friend today  and we sat on the patio at RigaTony's.   They had a fabulous lunch menu, with great prices... the two of us had salad, bread, entrees, and soft drinks, and the bill was less than $20. Wha???  I was surprised!  Normally you go to a restaurant and think you're getting a great lunch deal, and later you find out your Coke was three bucks, and multiplied by everyone at your table that really adds up.  But here the pop was just a buck along with your lunch entree. Score!  The patio was so pleasant, and the servers were super-attentive.  As a bonus, the food was top notch.  (Today's special... Lasagna!)  We were in and out in one hour.  I have no complaints!! I will be back, as there are so many other dishes I would like to try! My pal enjoyed her little personal-sized pizza as well!

E9X-Pb3UBN_AUhY_bX65dg.text: Found my new favorite Italian restaurant in the area. I had the "Tour of Rigatony's" and loved it. The cappucino ice cream pie for dessert is a must.

9jBezw_B9T8sJGbw7n5deQ.text: This is a great local owned establishment.  My record is 3 times in one week.   They have a great sandwich menu.  The daily specials are always great.  The best is the Cannolis .......the chef has found the right mixture.   My only negative is the iced tea.....it needs some help.

29f6TrBfVPGWJLKv2SJyjQ.text: Love love love this place! I always get the shrimp and chicken lemon cream pasta dish. Endless bread. It's where I discovered Predator wine, omg yum. Always great service. Favorite Italian place in the East Valley (I never go to the West Valley, so maybe the WHOLE valley!?), by far!

4RquFKObObJORNkgOBKByA.text: Both my parents are immigrants from southern Italy,  and I have cousins, uncles, aunts & Godparents in the restaurant business.  The salad is EXCELLENT.  The bread is very good, so much so that my 10 year old son who doesn't even really like bread will gobble it up.  Chicken Picatta is great, the Calamari is PERFECT (my picky 10 yr old likes it too).  And the Cannoli are HEAVENLY.  Buon appetito!

cygYlsP_-NrcweIXmYcUeQ.text: I came here once back when it was called something like 3 margaritas. Food was meh and we were one of the only groups of customers there. I guess that place going out of business wasn't too hard to imagine. Fast forward to 2014. This place is ALWAYS packed. We try to get here before 11:30 on regular days so we won't be on the waiting list. A few times we even turned around and went somewhere else because the wait was too long. Oh and Fridays? Fugedaboutit!!! Still, this is on the lunch rotation with a number of my coworkers. We always get the lunch specials. I get the lasagna (Monday special) usually no matter what day of the week it is. You get salad and bread but go easy or you won't finish your main course. Well, that's the way it is for me usually. Your mileage may vary according to how many seats you take up on a plane. I've tried a bunch of other stuff but lasagna has always been my favorite. But don't worry, tough guy, they got pasta - they got all that shit! They also have those loyalty cards which are good to take advantage of if you come here a lot because you fill it up and get a free lunch on the next visit. Can't argue with that. This is my favorite Eyetalian joint in the area. We've been to Marcello's right down the friggin' street but we all agreed this place was a better bang for the buck and had much better service. Parking is easy - it's in a mall - it's in a mall with Harbor Freight Tools and Dunkin Donuts. Check it out.

igaZx4sYaKADUHCN5Di0TA.text: Had dinner here last night on our endless quest for delicious eggplant parmesan. The atmosphere was fun and cozy, service was excellent but the eggplant disappointed.  There were two slices of eggplant on the plate and the top piece was cooked, the bottom piece, not so much. The mashed potatoes had good taste but my wife and I prefer no lumps in the mashed potatoes.  I would visit again to try other menu items because the "rigatony's" was very good.

q7XcPgjqWLw4bWfkp10oeA.text: My husband and I have been to this location several times even though it is a little bit of a drive for us. The food is always amazing and the bread is always hot from the oven, not warmed over a lamp in the kitchen. I always order the Penne Rosa with stuffed tortellini. There sauce is always flavored to the perfect amount and creamy. The service is decent but varies so much, you never see the same person twice working there(which is a little concerning). Great for a night out with friends and family, but not really good for big groups.

81zUThBaTKgny0uYjCKj6w.text: We arrived at around 5pm. Hostess told us it would be 30 minutes, handed us a pager and we went to wait. There was just the two of us. At 40 minutes I asked her how much longer it would be. She said she has four tables to clear and it will only be 2 to 3 minutes more. 20 minutes later and after watching parties that arrived after us get called we approached her again and handed her the pager. She asked us to stay but my wife said we are your advertisement and we have been lied to and we are leaving.

hbRumdQPqOUFHyBBNZFBqA.text: First visit last night and we most def will be back!  Great food and even better service.  Wonderful local establishment!

mhK2xg2k4fj7ojjnetgKEA.text: I go to Rigatonys about once a month. The food is generally really good.  I love the bread and salad that is included with the meal.    It can be loud in certain parts of the restaurant at busy times and the water does not taste that great. -These are the only negative things I can think of.    When it's all said and done I give Rigatonys a thumbs up!

OO8Rw6POZmQx4kS1ZYbgzA.text: First class food!!  Great atmosphere.  Very positive Italian atmosphere!   Will TAKE FRIENDS  there!

k_peaqxVF4NBg_yX-xm9tg.text: Everything was delicious, the Calamari for an appetizer and the bread and salad were beyond great! I tried the baked Rigatony and it was so good! My girlfriend ordered the tour plate and it was also super good! Definitely will come Back! Autentic Italian food!

VvPCtOhnYH4tRBPe8eDF0A.text: Way good. Great experience. We Live by PV Mall so this is a "hike"-but was given a G.Card for my B-day, and we went for dinner Sat. Night. Service was friendly helpful and good. Food was as other reviewers have said darn good. We had Chicken Parm and Yes that salad is very very good. Bread as well good. It's good that the Salad and Bread are included.  Server didn't freak out when we told her we wanted butter over the Olive Oil drink for the bread.  Cappuccino Dessert (we shared ) yummy. Only complaint. Wine in short glasses. They may do that in Italy - but hey we're not. The glass was a short glass like a juice glass, & so clumsy to pick up, and at 5.50 a pop, I want a Wine Glass. Just saying....Oh well -I'll just ask for one next time. Won't keep me from enjoying my dinner. Even though its a 30 min. drive we will definitely go back.

CaRSLugRY6w7v8dJbtHOvA.text: Love the food and service. We've been going there for years. But somehow when I rarely go there week-day lunch times, there's one waiter who's very aggressive to where we, as customers have to feel some kind of pressure while we are trying to enjoy the meal. It happened twice already. The last time my mom and I visited there(a few weeks ago) we got the same waiter for our table. I remembered him and his service, and I was not really happy about it. I was not wrong. Everything was okay until the end. As my mom still has her folk in her hand and eating, the waiter asked her to pass her finished salad plate to him. My mom had to put her folk down to pass it to him. I was shocked how he asked his still-eating customer to pass a dirty dish so he can clean up the table as fast as he could! I am not trying to ambush that waiter but the manager, please educate your waiter the basic customer service. He wears glasses, he is thin and tall, and light skinned. I think his area is around the bar.

cqZLCI1pfC9mdF483pxYyw.text: Oh my goodness...a 30 minute wait at  restaurant on a Friday night...that hasn't happened in a while...it must be a good sign!   I haven't had to wait at a restaurant in forever, but RigaTony's was very accommodating and would bring around samples of fresh pizza to keep you from keeling over from hunger!  Once we were seated, our waiter brought over samples of the house Chianti...what a nice touch...we had gotten free pizza and free wine and hadn't ordered a thing yet!
