The menu is not huge, but has a lot of the traditional Italian favorites.  We ordered the fried zucchini to start, because my sister is currently obsessed with it!.  Before we got our zucchini, we were brought a huge bowl of salad and warm bread.  The salad was a mix of lettuces, onion, olives, peppercini's and salami in a really nice dressing.  I am not usually a salad eater, but I really liked this one, and even had seconds!  The girls said that the bread was really good, especially when dipped in the olive oil and balsamic vinegar mixture.  The zucchini came out and it was a huge plate of zucchini strips served with a side of basil ranch.  The strips were seasoned just perfectly, and weren't greasy at all, and the basil ranch was a nice change from the norm.  By this point, we were starting to get full, and our entrees hadn't even arrived yet!  Our entrees arrived and they were all huge!  I got the cannelloni, filled with veal, spinach and cheese; they were some of the best I have ever had.  I have previously had some very, very dry cannelloni, but that was not the case with these.  They were served with a side of spaghetti, which I thought was a bit funny, but it actually worked really well together.  The others had cheese ravioli in pink sauce (she raved), spaghetti and meatballs and the RigaTony pasta with sausage.  We all really enjoyed our dishes....and we all had leftovers to take home!  And when I reheated my cannelloni, it was almost even better the next day!  This is currently my favorite Italian place, so much better than VinciTorio's around the corner....and I will be visiting them the next time a craving for Italian food strikes!

ZuaEFbK2HsHNzA97bKPYdw.text: 2nd time there in a week.  Very good customer service.  Pro's:    The salad and bread that are served with the meals is A#1.  The salad is filled with good stuff (that costs money... not cheap)...  and the bread, yum!  First time through I had the baked Rigatoni.  Well, I was a little disappointed because I was expecting more marinara sauce.   Second time (today) had Meatball sub.  WOW.  This was killer.  The bread was a knockout and then I finally got my marinara sauce.  YUM x10.  Good job Riga Tony's.  Price is right where it needs to be.  A good value (and I would say especially for lunch).  Con's:  Hard to say really.    With all the Italian options this one really for the money and cooking a good find.  I've heard about it for years but just never got there.  So glad I did this week (and to think it is right down the road from me).  Will be back!

ebBJExXvTZd_hfbR9-hCwQ.text: I came here on my birthday for lunch and I had a blast.  I know dinner there is always busy but the wait is worth it if you like Italian food.   The menu is small and caters to those who like pasta, pizza, etc.   I am vegetarian and there were a lot of options available still.    The service was perfect (thank you Celina). My favorite pasta sauce is the red pepper alfredo one. They gave me a lot of food and its worth the money you pay for.    For lunch I usually spend about $10.  I got  a salad and built my own pasta.

3szsa6_nG7OwalTAtt7Diw.text: My holiday gift to all. RigaTony's is the best.  Great food fast, friendly service, reasonable prices.  For the first time I had lunch at RigaTony's. I decided to have the lunch special. This is an awesome deal. Bread, salad and entree for $6.99. How can you do that? A fountain beverage was $1.00 more. This meal was as perfect as they come. The bread is served warm with a plate for dipping oil. The crisp house side salad  and the entree was good and the pasta was perfectly cooked. Everything tasted very fresh right down to the marinara sauce. I have to give it to you RigaTony's, you are pretty great and I will be back with my pack. And what I really like best about you is you are independently owned and operated. No chains for me.

Z2g4CeCLjg2nay24jOskRw.text: Best Italian restaurant in Tempe they have a great eggplant parmigiana

Q5IQnh1t30mFUZ67fWUShA.text: Good italian comfort food that's affordable

qc244DAx1dgIdpR8Jdw5HQ.text: I have nothing but great things to say about this place! My brother introduced me over 10 years ago, I have been going ever since.  My boyfriend & I have become regulars! Not only due to the amazing quality of food! Such consistency which is quite rare to find an Italian restaurant in Arizona.  The servers, the hostess, management & owners treat customers like family.  We have worked our way through the entire menu.  My favorite for lunch is the baked Rigatony. For dinner the Penne Rosa hands down!  No matter how full I am I will ALWAYS make room for the apple bread pudding.  It's the best in Arizona!  Rigatonys is reasonably priced an excellent portions.  every meal comes with an anti-pasta salad fresh bread with olive oil and fresh seasonings for dipping.  The vibe here is just right. They also have a loyal dining membership, which leads to buy one entree get one free. Card #2 is buy one get one & a free dessert.  The card #3 is a $20 gift card.  I don't know what I like best about this place. The food or the amazing customer service!  I can't believe it's taken me so long to write a review on one of my favorite places. You won't be disappointed!

R5FoXfVRhxLyiLOkYpOaEg.text: This is a great Italian place close to work. The portion size is little but adequate and they serve complimentary salad and bread. They also have a loyal diner program where you get a free meal after 5 meals. Would definitely visit again.

BrnorIPTCVUtOSS-ttQ5sw.text: I have been a fan of RigaTony's for a long time and this reviews was certainly nothing against the food, but about their billing and service.  I was with a friend and given that we had not met for a while, decided to go to a casual yet elegant setting and what better place than Rigatony's.  It was a very quiet night for a Monday and in the end we were really not very hungry and order two appetizers and a dessert.  The server seemed so very anxious and kept coming constantly asking us about if we wanted to order entrees.  I just felt very rushed there and so did my friend.  In a True family style Italian Restaurant and I have been to many including Italy, they thrive on the fact that you take your time to talk and enjoy the moment rather than being rushed like a fast food experience.  The thing that really shocked me is that they charged $8.50 us for the salad, which we never asked for and I always thought came complementary and also a split charge for $3.50 as well, considering we both got appetizers and just decided to share it.   Wow that is some rip off for sure.  I strongly believe that truth in advertising is so important to a business.  It does not matter if they serve the tastiest food, but unscrupulous billing was certainly very shocking.  I sadly left a very generous tip for the server, having been one myself.  Given this experience, I would rather take my business elsewhere.

T0alURw-L3rI7opVyZPvQQ.text: Now having gone many, many times I have to recommend their ravioli - it's homemade pasta (yum!) and top notch cheeses.  I LOVE their sauce that is tomato + cream, it would seriously made an amazing soup but also blends perfectly with the ravioli.  Try it!  That plus a salad is a perfect dinner.  Plus, I don't really care for their bread which is perfect since that way I don't eat any!  ;)  (the ladies will get it...)  My husband also loves the chicken parm.

ZhQYErumMXFk5S5k4-22sA.text: This is the Best Italian place !!! ... My wife and I like to eat at the bar on Suns or Dback game nights ... :-) :-)

ZlFL55AypinVrZxwiVcBvA.text: Yes it's only 8:45 in the morning but I am still having Rigatony's withdrawal. Can you guys ship in bulk the spicy Italian sausage rigatony dish and some stuffed shells?  Also, it's not on the menu but you should ask for a blended cappuccino pie with cafe patron or baileys (like a milkshake). It's a secret menu item!

SfLyIQcpiZfDa0Iqj9snJw.text: This place is awesome! Their service is great, their food is totally authentic and extremely well priced.  There might be a wait to get in but it is totally worth it!

0zZME9lVzDDe9dIcO4M2bA.text: Great fresh food at a fair price is hard to say no to. I had the ravioli and chocolate cake. The ravioli and marinara was fresh, not over seasoned, made in house and hands down the best I've ever had. Same with cake, fresh, homemade, and rich. Only issue I have is the wine list, but not really an issue sense it's not a high end place. I'll be going back here soon.

NWnqkZ58F8P4wsayNzMd7w.text: Alway good food  and service. Love that its a local restaurant. The salad and bread is a meal in itself. Lunch specials are a great price.

iHpqOyGyZ5swEjF0bo6hDw.text: Ah, RigaTony's. This was the first restaurant my fiance and I went to together. I hold this place fondly in my heart for many reasons, but it doesn't get a 4 star rating simply for nostalgia...   ~Fud/Drink~ They have all the traditional Italian-American food staples, however their menu boasts flavors that Olive Garden and other cookie-cutter Italian stores wish they had. The seafood dishes, which I have had before, actually taste fresh. The Linguini in Clam Sauce was the last dish I chose, very rich and fresh once again. The clams matched pasta well and did not overtake the dish. The balance of all the sauces seems to serve each dish well. Many a time I have had Italian that was overpowered by sauces that took away from the dish, rather than complemented it...not here. Rigatony's has a full bar menu you can order your favorite drink from, as well as numerous wine options which pair well with foods on their menu. Is this dining elegance here? No. But the foods on the menu are rock solid, taste great and are comparable in price to the portion you get.   ~Atmosphere/Service~ The waitstaff are all courteous and knowledgeable of the items on the menu. I normally ask them to help me in my decision, and its imperative they have a general idea of what the menu has available for us. I have been twice, and both times the staff were quick to help us order and get our food in. The last time I went however, they did take a good amount of time to get the bill to us. That did not sour the night out, however it was a good 15+ minutes from the time I asked to the time it got to the table. That's just a bit too long after I personally request for the bill and you only have about two other tables to wait on.....Oh well, that's been the only hiccup here, so I can write that off :) The atmosphere is quiet and relaxing. Its not overly romantic, it has more of a homey feeling inside with a nice Italian music backdrop. It is a family owned restaurant by the way, so you do not have a chain-restaurant feel to it like you do when you go into a Olive Garden..if that makes sense...  ~Extras/Rating~ Try their desserts. I have seen them and they look gorgeous. We have been too stuffed to ever try them, but I am sure one of the desserts will take the night to the next level if you do. Overall, this place is solid. They do a great job with treating the customer right and provide quality food with the right portions. Just like you'd expect from a family-owned restaurant. Please come any time of the day, however many people seem to enjoy their happy hour/Early Bird specials. Hope you enjoy it here, they treat you very well and you will go home happy! 4 stars for having quality, fresh dishes at proper rates, and providing solid service. They are among the cream of the crop of family-style Italian Restaurants.

F0VzZfQYmof_VzIlk_Tmbg.text: I love the food here! I have had two delicious meals here and like that they have salad and bread before the meal. Great place for those who enjoy Italian food!

nIQTQxYk6iui8OIl1Loa0A.text: Ordered the Chicken Piccatta Take Out Package. Came with antipasto salad, bread, Alfredo, and chicken Piccatta For $30 it was a great deal. Fed 4 adults quite well. The Alfredo was ok, I definitely like Olive garden's better.

nEmfbDXFGtJrcHNkjHMJ7A.text: Gr8 take out for parties.  Not super efficient but worth the taste!  Need a separation between take out and dine in.  Sometimes 20-30 people in 60 Sq ft lobby.

JWNlbgE5IRGEGwos7szPcw.text: My family and I have been loyal customers of Rigatony's since our move to Chandler in 2001.  We have taken our family and friends, and have recommended this restaurant many times over the years.  My brother and family are currently visiting from New York State and wanted to go for Italian, so we immediately suggested Rigatonys. Our salad and bread were delicious as usual, but we were extremely disappointed by the entrees served.  Our table ordered 2 chicken Parmesan, 2 chicken Marsala, and 1 chicken piccata entree.  The chicken on every plate was dry, hard and difficult to cut with a knife, let alone chew!  Rigatony's historically has pounded the veal/chicken into nice, thin pieces, but these pieces were thick, tough, and chewy.  The Marsala sauce was syrupy sweet, without a hint of Marsala wine flavor.   The piccata sauce had no lemon taste whatsoever, and the pasta was mushy and overcooked.  Even the marinara sauce for the Parmesan had a sweet taste to it, very unlike the rich red sauce we had come to love at Rigatony's.  We were embarrassed that we told our guests this was a destination for good Italian food.  Whatever changes have been made in the kitchen, please- change it back!

Y_b6x-o0u_J1yBtSdEYLng.text: By far the most amazing Italian food I have ever had. Everything is absolutely delicious and all tastes like it was made  from home. If you know home made Italian food (the real stuff) you will not be disappointed!

AqZRwlQyq0VaXka2V7m1Ew.text: I would give Riga Tony's zero stars but I can't. Their rigatoni was the worst dish of Italian food I've ever tasted in my life. My wife ordered the lasagna and she said she would prefer a stoufer's frozen lasagna to what she was served.   I have no idea how anyone could enjoy the food here. Dine here at your own risk.

zNxAifwxSbOGwbZQiztJUw.text: I am baffled that anyone would give this place 1 or 2 stars! they must be disgruntled ex-employees that got canned or just plain haters.  I can't have enough of Rig's! EVERYTHING here is delicious!  start with the garlic clams for appetizers. it is so damned good you will want to soak up the remaining juice with your bread.  the starter salad is great! it has many ingredients and it is fresh. I love this salad so much, I ate it as an entree in one of my visits.  there are many entrees that I love here. I usually go with the tour. it's a combination of lasagna, chicken picata, salsiccia, rigatoni, and a pasta shell stuffed with cheese (I think).  everything here is a hit. everyone has their own opinion and will like one dish more than the other. I do agree with a past yelper about the tomato sauce being a little sweet in the lasagna. other than that, I can't find anything wrong with this place.  service has always been great. I'm starting to get annoyed with people that count the seconds that it takes to get refills on water and s**t like that.  PLEASE PEOPLE! it's not like you're dining at the Ritz! it's a mom & pop place that charge reasonable for what I consider a tasty meal. I will dine here ten times over before eating at your typical AZ Chillis, Applebees, & TGIF.  one last thing. Dan, who last served me, makes a great cappuccino!

bMmwG7TUjCKSDf_2FmyyPw.text: Okay....So is the food okay? Yes it is fine, average.  I am writing this review purely on the service, which should mean something. First, we made a reservation and were seated quite quickly. So far so good. We went on a weekday and it was very busy. With an hour for lunch, started to worry. Our waitress did not show up for fifteen minutes after we were seated and we asked twice. She showed up and we placed our orders. Twenty minutes later our food showed up. It was okay. The waitress never came back to see how things were, if we needed drink refills, nothing. It was like she was on a break during a very busy lunch rush. The table next to us got their lunch after waiting an hour and fifteen minutes and were very upset. We ordered an appetizer, Calamari at $11.00. Two of us shared it and the same two decided to share a sandwich. The other two just ordered their meals. When the bill came there was a $3 extra charge for the sandwich. They charged us for splitting it, although the sandwich was not cut in two or served on two separate plates (although the lady I was splitting with had to get up and go find a plate from a busboy). I was not happy with this considering the service was terrible and the fact that we had ordered the appetizer to split which was more expensive then the dish we had ordered to split so I figured it was as good as ordering a dish. Well, we asked for the manager and that was an absolute nightmare. He came over, I explained that I was unhappy about the extra charge because the meal was not split and we ordered an appetizer. He started to tell me that it is how they keep the costs down. When I said..but we decided to get an appetizer and split a lunch he very rudely and aggressively told me that I was not listening to him and he was trying to explain to me why it was charged. As a result of his rudeness I told him I did not want to hear his explanation and just wanted the charge removed. He literally face palmed me and removed the charge. Terrible management for the service industry. I will NEVER EVER come back to Rigatony's and make sure everyone I know hears this story. Customer service still means something but apparently, they do not get this. Maybe when their lunch rush slows (which it will under the current management), they will get the hint. Don't go here, especially for lunch. The food quality does not justify the aggravation.

2SWUaOC1ajzPb1m8rYRc4g.text: My favorite Italian food place in Phoenix! The salad and bread are both amazing. I don't think you could order a bad entree. The wait times are longer then most, but well worth the wait!

7W_HBayDsiKPwz2V7aUvbg.text: Fried ravioli is literally to die for and they have the best Spumoni in Arizona! All for a super affordable price! Would recommend 8/10

3Cw4i6cA8ugo8lpvujFCmg.text: Great Italian place. I almost gave it five stars and might when I go back, and I will go back! The Calamari was good, I like mine a little more authentic. The Anti-pasta salad was very good. Spaghetti with meat sauce was outstanding! Some of the best I have ever had. Mom and pop Italian ambiance. Service was good. It's a no rush, old school vibe. I am a fan.

UhcfXao-0dbXn2hkW4Ro5w.text: This is my husband and my favorite place to eat!  My parents are here so much we continued the tradition!  The salad and bread is to die for and there is no better Italian food in the valley!  Awesome atmosphere!

dEv0cTJN6bTDSwh7ibRFIQ.text: This restaurant is always busy and vibrant.   The Staff are wise to their menu, fast  and very hospitable.  Most meals come with a "famous Anti pasti Salad" which is delicious, fresh and unlimited meaning they will bring you another once its finished. - The same goes for their lovely warm Herb bread.   I had a Hoagie and my wife had the Lasagna. We have both tried these meals on different occasions and they are always delicious and filling.  Good food, fresh ingredients, Great Service, Lovely environment. - If your looking for Italian food you cannot go wrong here.

HDXEp_n-qSbwlfmPu1_1nw.text: I had to write a review because the service at this restaurant is clearly going down hill. As a regular here, I asked if our favorite service was working, but rather than the manger explaining while she was let go I was not only shocked but felt belittled because they "didn't have time for a stupid question". Once we were seated in a section, the waitress we had not only messed up every one of our orders and forgot to bring out a plate for one of our party member in general. I understand that everyone has their days and they do mess up, but the only server at that restaurant who has not completely ruined our orders at this restaurant is Jessica M. because the restaurant has sadly let her go. It's very unfortunate that we will no longer be dining at this establishment, because they no longer have a competent wait staff and for a family restaurant are no longer make it feel like a "family atmosphere". I am disappointed, get it together.

p_KxYm_-KoZcdkd1owA1KQ.text: Moved here from New York in 2012. Came here on recommendation for lunch for 2. Food wise and taste was average Italian food at best. Nothing better to say it was ok like for the masses. Nothing unique from the pizza and entrees. If you want average and bland Italian food then you will love it. More like a cafeteria dinner style food. There are some excellent authentic Italian restaurants in Arizona. This is 100% not one of them.PAY a few dollars more to eat the best authentic Italian food in the state.As good as any in BROOKLYN OR MANHATTAN NEW YORK. Save time looking at my Italian reviews . I have been eating in excellent Italian restaurants for 56 years now . If you want to wait for fresh cooked I know the top ones to enjoy

aosSCmo7qG9f1Qe_dJ3u7g.text: We were seated and done with our meal in 45 minutes on a busy night, food was excellent and super fast and the service was great. The Pinot Grigio did taste a little fermented, and maybe a larger wine list would be better? Either way, we had a great time.

6eEv6BR4pnvFOx2-rCBkwg.text: Fantastic service, gorgeous patio dining, and impressive pastas at a reasonable price. We will be back, oh yes...

9fixXeWWExP6mRs8Li2KrQ.text: My favorite place to eat! The salad is addicting, I go sometimes to just eat the salad. The staff is always very friendly. Try the Baked Rigatony, capellini checca and the penne rosa.  Frankie is my favorite waitress :)

t3KIYx86vAUzg0Io4Qvz9A.text: My wife and I went to RigaTony's for lunch on Friday. We had the Italian Wedding soup and the Penna Rosa with Sausage. The salad was wonderful (so much to it) and the salad dressing was just scrumptious! The soup and the pasta were also sensational. Our server was also attentive; but not overly solicitous. We have been to this RigaTony's a couple of times before and we will most likely keep going back. We usually don't go to "chain," type of restaurants;however, this place is something that you can't beat for taste, service and variety!

Iqxw0cy6NMZT4ZZDw2nKlA.text: After the nice 50 minute wait, we where seated in the far back corner. Our mistake was ordering drinks appetizer and our meal at the same time. We received the salad (nice) , five minutes into the salad, the appetizer. Okay, so that's a little backwards but hey they're busy or the wait staff is confused. Then with a table crowded with food, the entree arrives , wow four minutes. The waitress stacks my plates for me with the food I'm eating on them still. By the time we finished the appetizer, our food was cold. Mostly due to hot food served on cold plates. But even after all that time pasta was still way to firm. An dente taken to far. Then the waitress attempts to take my plate before asking. We may try again for a lunch and see if things improve. I'm not expecting much. IMHO stay home and order a pizza you'll get better Italian.

R-dQTmQHg03l__RgKYimvA.text: Whenever I come from a trip I like to come here as they always have all you can eat salads. The pizza for two is one the favorite dishes we like to gave as iris good and reasonably priced.

b0DGDohDrK8keLJLBxMk1Q.text: Very disappointed!  This has always been one of my favorite "go to" restaurants for Italian food.  Today we ordered take out for my office staff and I was "underwhelmed" by the quality of the food.  I ordered the Chicken Caesar Salad, and asked for an addition of diced tomato.  Basically what I got was 3 cups of wet romaine lettuce, about a tablespoon of diced tomato, a table spoon or less of cheese, and when I cut up the small amount of chicken provided it yielded 8 bite sized pieces.    One of my admin's ordered shrimp alfredo, the fettuccini was wet, which watered everything down, and they gave her a whopping 4 small shrimp.  I understand it's the lunch menu, and portions are smaller, but this was a bit skimpy if you ask me.  Not worth the price in my opinion.

DYFC1sol8HtSt-A8NfC-7w.text: Been here twice. Food is good but nothing exceptional. So I wonder why there are always packed?  I guess I don't know Italian food or maybe Tempe lacks above average Italian places?

m3HIFMWRmYokIlDH0o5pOQ.text: Moma Mia!!!! What a joint ! You might have to wait but easily the best authentic old school Italian food in the valley . Everything is simple and fresh.

6IvqLq-KyOAsefWJIFSDXQ.text: Where to start...I love this place. I really really love their bread and salad. I have not had anything there that I didn't like. This place is my now go-to Italian place.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy campers!!

ZWvA613N-Tmm_-pryvyu7g.text: Three of us came in for lunch on Tuesday, Feb. 10 and the service we received was fantastic. My only regret is I lost my receipt and can not name our server, but we were in the room off the patio toward the Warner Rd side and our server was new to us, as we come in regularly.  We asked her to check with the kitchen to see if they would make our favorite appetizer,  the fried tortellini with lobster sauce and the kitchen agreed ...as always. Please put it back on the menu we miss it. She had no idea what it was but did as we asked.  The rest of our meal and service was incredible as always. We have travel to Tempe and use to go to the old place on Arizona  just to eat at your place from Casa Grande because of the friendly staff and great food.   Thank you to you and your staff for another great meal.

FVUSiA9urBx4HKlkSX9y4w.text: Started off at the bar with a great bartender who had me sample and choose from a couple of Merlots. V attentive. The vibe in RigaTony's is really mellow, friendly and warm. Our waitress was very knowledgeable - gave us gluten free options as well. Antipasto salad was tremendous and v fresh with a tasty dressing. The bread was warm and good and the dipping olive oil was spectacular. Ordered the Eggplant Parmigiana dinner which came with spaghetti on the side. Breaded and cooked just right with really great marinara sauce. Asked for some more sauce which I promptly got . Sat in the outdoor covered patio which was really nice on a pleasant night. The staff were happy and having a good time. Bringing a group of friends here to experience the awesome meal, atmosphere and service. 5 stars indeed.

iTD6uyKpNhqIM95KnjFO4w.text: Although we like coming here, many times the service is not the best. Hence the 3 stars.  They do have a loyalty program.   Kids eat free on Mondays, however, they forget to mention...not if the Monday is a holiday.  And by holiday, not the usual calendar holidays...example, they consider both Christmas Eve and NY eve a holiday.   Their salad is fantastic, and if you get the bread freshly made, it is great, too. In my opinion, these are the best part of this restaurant.  Dinner prices are well above lunch prices.   They do have carry-out that you can call ahead for.  They do take reservations...however, they dont actually HOLD the reservation (ala Seinfeld)...we made one today,  arrived on time, and they still made us wait...so far waiting 15 minutes! Fantastic.   This place is quite popular, so it may be a wait, even if you go well past dinnertime or lunchtime.

KsTHHP6CLA-0eseex2rmmw.text: First time ordering delivery from here. I got the lemon chicken with artichokes and capers and it was delicious. Large portion, came with fettuccini alfredo, antipasto salad, and a huge piece of garlic bread. Good cannoli for desert although I would liked them more if there was chocolate involved. This will be my new go-to Italian place! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lemon chicken with artichokes, capers, and fettuccini alfredo. Delicious and delivered hot!

zOJraSgdpXk4Llo94dWDaQ.text: Delicious food. Unbeatable sauce. Can't go wrong with RigaTonys!! Great for couples - check bar seating if the resturant is packed. Lots of large families seemed to really enjoy the atmosphere so this place really is for everyone!

KH0z7uFEFwQiCTlmwTXNfQ.text: Jenna B. was our server the last two times me and my dad ate here. Both times the service was prompt and the food was good, excellent service.

x3yUz2CCR0CDLuxtTu6d9w.text: Delicious and wonderful service by Amour (sp?) The antipasto salad was the best I've ever had, served with crusty bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Those filled me up so much that I couldn't eat much of my entree. Entree was chicken fettuccine Alfredo and I was a bit worried about my fav dish because of a previous review BUT it was a creamy, garlicky buttery sauce just as it should be. Lots of leftovers and Amour even brought me extra sauce when she boxed up my leftovers. Would definitely return!

qApIdrjUviYwT01q5dSKpg.text: This is my family's go to in the Tempe/Chandler area.  We have been going her since their original location down in Chandler for over 10 years now.    They have great lunch specials (one of their entrees for $8.95, it is set for each day of the week) & the food is very reasonable for what you get.  I don't believe there is any food item over $15 on the menu.  They also have an incredible rewards program, believe you get something free after every 5th meal.  All the entrees start with their house salad.  If you don't like their salad, you clearly don't like eating.  It is a Italian dressing with cut up salami & cheese.  It blows away most house salads I have ever had.  Their bread has a great crust on it.  For entrees, they have a great standard chicken Parmesan with an excellent cut of chicken.  Their pork chops are very juicy and tasty, but not huge.  If you are hungry I would suggest doing the double order, unless you want to fill up on salad.  They have excellent build your own pizza's (they are decent size) as well.  Finally dessert...when I do get one, I get the spumoni.  It is a gellato style spumoni.  This is the only one I have had, but the other desserts have looked really tasty.    It is not the fanciest restaurant, but it has a nice atmosphere.  I would say it is a 4-1/2, but I give them a benefit of the doubt since we have never had a bad experience there.

I5XWhR25Ny95n2tQMH8_Eg.text: Great family friendly place! We meet the family here for dinners on the regular. The staff is always very accommodating to our large group. Food is delicious and prices can't be beat considering the amount of food you receive.

_V5Fl_mj6Sp9Dqt5JPn1WA.text: This place serves some of the most authentic Italian food I have ever tasted. The cibatta bread and antipasta salad that's served at the beginning of every meal is delish. The Rigatony meal, lasagna, chicken picatta are some the best dishes here. I must have a cappuccino at the end of the meal. Today we shared 4 layer, chocolate hazelnut cake. OMG heaven on a plate. I travel 30+ miles for great food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

fbhMELu1CINEyHRKF2Bwdg.text: Tomato and eggplant brushetta was delicious. Early bird meal options were great, including salad and chibatta for $9.95. Good service. Food was very good. Only oddity was when making reservations for 3:30 was told they only accepted reservations for top of the hour. We were seated promptly at 3:30, was just odd.

1z6QMCXoj9kjqe1VXuU4QQ.text: This place reminds me of a mix between bucca & Olive Garden.  Salad and bread Come with dinner entree. HUGE salad & it's delicious. Bread is warm and tastes fresh.   We started with clams. It was delicious   I ordered 1/2 Alfredo 1/2 marinara with a side of meatballs.   I honestly was full by the time my entree came. Would have been satisfied with just the clams.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. 1/2 &amp; 1/2 Alfredo marinara w/ meatballs on the side. All very flavorful and good. Soooo much food.

3hQ0Pg-6pFm1cKxRdHAQcg.text: What could I say about this place..just like this place is AWSOME!!!!!!!! 10 stars if I could!!!..server was great

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

dJzFRJ8NUtFfBpY-vLRrjw.text: RigaTonys why do I keep forgetting about you!!  A friend that I hadn't seen in about 22 years was driving though and hit me up on FB and said Hey lets have dinner, find somewhere off the I-10 and make it Italian and RigaTony's was the perfect place to pick!   We meet up around 5pm on a Wednesday night, the place was busy, but not packed, I was loving how they decorated for Christmas, made me feel like I was going to a party :)   Our server was Michelle and she was very helpful answering whatever questions my friends had, and she was excellent at making sure we had everything we needed, love great service  After we checked out the menu I decided I wanted the lasagna & spaghetti combo. My friend ordered the chicken with lemon & artichoke and her husband ordered the spaghetti deluxe.  Then the antipasto salad & freshly baked ciabatta bread came out, OMG this salad is to die for, I love love love it!! Stop going to the Olive Garden people, this is the salad you should be having!! And the bread!! I love me some fresh baked bread, so much better than sticks!   My lasagna was delish baby! It was so flavorful too, the cheese, the noodles the sauce, omg I can't believe I ate it all, I ordered it with the intention of having some for lunch the next day, nope that didn't happen!  So good!!  The spaghetti was cooked perfectly and the sauce was the perfect amount and great in flavor! Loved the combo!   My friends, they too loved their dishes and were happy we picked RiggaTonys for dinner!! It was great seeing her and sharing a great meal too!   A fun tip I did learn about RiggaTonys is once a month on Monday night they have a Wine dinner, where you dine on 5 course dinner that the Chef prepares for just that night; I will have to check that out soon!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. chicken parmesan
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. shrimp scampi

f5lPOlvKaVH6Z3Khpcxd2A.text: The food was good and the service was friendly.  The minnestroni soup was outstanding.  Only really disappointing part of the evening was their weak wine list.  I expected more brands that I'm familiar with.

Q7V_GQfrbCTdCOKfBfUT4w.text: The food is always amazing! I was feeling bad because we are regular customers and I have never rated Rigatoni's before now. The food and cocktails are always wonderful and we feel like we had a very luxurious meal without spending a fortune.  Eat Italian food in Tempe!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Best lasagna and seafood fettuccine

IyjJ3OfR6t4ve_yiSKT6OA.text: Authentic Italian restaurant. Food is  delicious and comes with a large salad and complimentary bread. However, the tables are very close in proximity to each other making it seem as if you're a part of your neighboring eater's conversation. Restaurant is loud. Although the food is quite good and the perfect option for a group, I would not recommend for an intimate dinner date.

YVCf7fuUpuXrjjvJlhDphA.text: If you're going to eat your feelings, you're not going for Chinese... you'll just be depressed an hour later.  I came here on a whim, wanting to carb load before an early Camelback hike.  Being my first time, I was surprised at the crowd waiting for a table.  When the hostess informed me of a 20 minute wait time, I spied a lonely seat at the bar and made a break for it.  I asked the enthusiastic bartender for a hefe and orange, but the unfiltered wheat beer was not on the menu.  He convinced me to go with a Peroni, and it was sheer perfection, and balanced perfectly with my meal.  The $4.50 a bottle seemed steep... I must be conditioned for the dollar PBRs.  Starting out with the fried ravioli appetizer, which consisted of four large puffs of ricotta in a pasta shell, swimming in a delightful marinara.  This dish was smooth and cheesy, each bite eliciting the next.  I should have stopped here, but I hadnt eaten all day, choosing instead to brood in a bed with sweat stained sheets.  For round #2, I decided on the chicken parm, due to Ashlie's review.  To me, the red sauce on this dish tasted strange, unlike the savory sauce from the appetizer.  Of course, that didnt stop me from eating 72.8% of it.  The entree also came with two thick slices of toasted french loaf and a chopped anti-pasto salad.  This place rocked!  And the bar aint a bad place to saddle up to.  It's like the single-riders line at DCA's Radiator Springs Racers

GSdQJgzjYX79zhOtxkyNQw.text: I have only been here once but after this, will never again patronize the popular chain Italian restaurants again. Came at lunch time and ordered the Baked RigaTony Express lunch. A generous portion of sliced sausage, pasta, cream and tomato sauces were accompanied with a delicious house salad and fresh bread. The food was perfectly cooked and the waitstaff was excellent. We were out of there in under 45 minutes (we did linger a bit).

G56F2_lpyMjwgTY6tc1g7w.text: Restaurant had very poor service food wasn't  up to part.  From 1 to 5 stars I would give it a 1 and a half. Not even a 1 it's a waste of money if you like food with flavor. Olive Garden is better than this,when I don't even like Olive Garden.

IYdje-0ozM4YqdFPofVsFg.text: If calories didn't matter, then I would eat here everyday!  The salad given with each entree is fabulous, the fried raviolis are to-die-for, and all the dishes I've ever had were fabulous!!  If you're not already a loyal customer, come give RigaTony's a try!

lUkxYjnVcVW4r_ohVz45uQ.text: This is our absolute favorite restaurant! The bread and salad that comes with every meal is delicious. The lemon chicken with capers and artichoke and fettuccine is amazing- I get it every time!! The baked rigatony is really good too. Highly recommend!! My husband and I had our rehearsal dinner here too because it's our favorite restaurant.

K2nGQ0LBR_7OZ7a7BwehxQ.text: I've been eating at Rigatony's since it was in Mesa and Chandler (miss the good old days of two locations) and the menu has changed considerably. They no longer serve any veal; no marsala, no parmigiana, no picatta, to my extreme disappointment and that carries over into the deep dish lasagna too! It used to have ground veal and sausage. Luckily, their house salad is still the best I've ever had, always perfectly tossed with toppings and dressing. I crave it every single day.  Delicious tiramisu and other deserts.

DuGtccs7wDj4rxvS_vu1AA.text: I've been here many times and usually enjoy it but had a subpar experience last night.   I ordered the margarita pie and was expecting what you'd normally get at many other restaurants - a pizza with red sauce, fresh sliced mozz and some basil. Their menu said it also came with tomato which I thought would be fine as well.  The pizza comes out and it's literally a normal cheese pizza with tomato and basil on top with NO SAUCE.............. We ask the waitress when she comes back to check on us, "Isn't this pizza supposed to have sauce on it?" We didn't even bother asking about the fresh sliced mozzarella. She says she doesn't know but will go check. She then proceeds to bring us a menu and says, "Well the menu just says it has tomato, basil and olive oil." Okay...... Well on the menu, it says your Americana Pizza just has Pepperoni, Sausage and Mushroom. So does that one not have sauce either???? I doubt it. I'm sure it comes with sauce even though the menu doesn't explicitly list "SAUCE" as one of the toppings.  She said the cook could re-make it but it would be another 20 minute wait. No thanks. She ended up bringing us some marinara on the side but it just wasn't the same. My sweet husband said he'd eat it like that to be nice but we basically didn't touch it. Half of one slice was eaten so we paid over $20 for that tragedy of a pizza. I was surprised and disappointed that it wasn't taken off our bill when it was clearly made incorrectly and we didn't eat any of it. Meh. Definitely a letdown and an opportunity for their staff to work on customer recovery solutions.

XsRP_oCaR_0mpgyK9mrlQQ.text: Ermahgerd..... Soo Good !   I think our servers name was Anthony,  he was very attentive and took great care of us.  The Salad and Bread were just as good as I remembered and the headliners were the Chicken Picatta and the scampi with Angel hair pasta!   DELICIOUS!

2Z1JMog2IZWHb_SCfb5ChQ.text: Average food, average service. Inconsistent, like the Arizona Diamondbacks this season. Like them, it'll be a while until we return.

LApRrUm6loMurxTBc1AKyg.text: I had to try RigaTony's after I saw that my Yelp friend, Joyce W, received the ROTD here.   I have mixed feeling after my visit.  They have the potential to be a great restaurant.  We arrived at about 7 PM to a packed restaurant.  Fortunately, I had made reservations and were seated immediately.    We ordered the a smoked salmon pasta, the four cheese penne and a spaghetti with meat sauce.  To our surprise, after ordering, they brought out an antipasto salad and some bread.  The antipasto salad was delicious.  It had plenty of meat and cheese.  The bread was okay.  It was like any other bread that we have had.  If we had known about the salad and bread, we probably would've only ordered 2 pastas and shared.    Their pastas dishes were enormous.  I loved their portion sizes.  If we weren't traveling, I would've taken the leftover pasta home.  The meatball and sausage spaghetti and the four cheese penne were winners.  Their sauce was full of meat and not acidic (sour).  Just the way we like it.  The sausage in my the spaghetti was chopped up.  I prefer my sausage uncut in one piece.  The four cheese penne was so go that my daughter devoured it without sharing.  My wife was disappointed in the smoked salmon pasta.  We thought that the smoked salmon pasta had a good taste, but, we all thought that the smoked salmon pasta was in the microwave oven a few minutes too long as the pasta around the edges seemed really dry.    Overall, I liked this place.  It seemed like a great deal with the antipasto salad and bread.  Their portion sized was generous.  Stick with their popular items like their meat or Alfredo sauce, and everything should be great.  3 1/2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Meatball and sausage spaghetti
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Smoked salmon pasta
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread

DQfLT57e_bODU_RZXJ_WNQ.text: Very nice Italian food...enjoyed the place very much & was well worth the 30 min wait which was accurate for what we were told. The food was awesome! Nice atmosphere & very good service. We had the mussels appetizer, which was delicious & served in a light tomato garlic sauce. We also had the baked rigatoni & the shrimp & scallop scampi. Pasta was so well done & melt in your mouth delicious. All the flavors were right on point. We also enjoyed the tiramisu which was so light & creamy. The salad that came included with dinner was pre-mixed & perfect & we noticed you could even get them to go in a case in the lobby. The bread for the table was good & crusty & a second plate was automatically brought over once we finished the first. We didn't care much for the dipping oil which was not as good quality or as nicely seasoned as other Italian restaurants we've been to...we tried adding more to it (crushed red pepper & grated Parmesan) but it was the oil...(odd undertaste). No worries, we ended up dipping the bread in the mussels tomato sauce & it was heaven! Highly recommend RigaTony's...great place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crusty warm &amp; seasoned bread...oil not so great. Get some mussels apps &amp; use that for a dipping sauce.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baked Rigatoni

ElT-39alAbvzfnX0HHsiVw.text: Worth the wait! We happened to stumble across this place on a Saturday evening and decided to try it out. We had no reservations so it was about an hour long wait for a table of four. I highly recommend calling ahead to reserve a table. Long wait aside, the food was delicious! The linguini and clams was very good and my kids also loved their pasta dishes from the kids menu. We will be back! Oh and if you like dessert, the cappuccino pie is amazing!

XY3M_cLfm34tMRgmlDqEXg.text: Wow we really loved this place! Came here to celebrate my birthday and from start to finish it was a great experience! Food + service is 10/10.  We got the fried zucchini app, meals came w large family style salad + fresh bread for entrees got the baked rigatony w sausage, cheese ravioli w alfredo sauce add shrimp, and a side of the tomato cream sauce (so good), chicken alfredo and chicken parm.We all shared these dishes and enjoyed them all. Will probably pass on the chicken parm next time though wasnt really anything special.   For your birthday they give you a free bread pudding dessert which was really good, we also shared the tiramisu and spumoni ice cream, both were the best we have ever had! Will definitely  come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Eggplant Parmesan w/ Fettuccine instead of spaghetti. Really good!!
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. tiramisu + bread pudding (both were amazing)
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. baked rigatony w sausage (sausage is a hint of spicy), cheese ravioli w alfredo sauce + shrimp, chicken alfredo + chicken parmesan

fuM1eUFsS2s39o_yOmUiWg.text: This is the most amazing restaurant in Phoenix! If you want great Italian and none of that commercial from the chains then this is your place. My only disappointment here has been the white italian bread vs breadsticks or garlic knots openly served but everything else makes up for this shortcoming. It does get crowded and can be over an hour wait at time to get in which can be a hassle. So plan ahead if your planning to eat here. So far everything I have ordered off this menu has been great and the wait staff is always amazing. The food and staff make you want to return here. Wish they would open another location in North Phoenix but let's be real probably wouldn't be as good as the original.

0siponD3v-oNjolxEatbuA.text: Right as I left RigaTony's restaurant I made sure to move it to my "Fave restaurants list" on Yelp. I will definitely be returning. Our food and the service was perfect in every way, better than expected actually. I was in the area and we had been wanting to try some authentic Italian food. The salad first of all is off the charts! I am IN LOVE with their dressing, wow! It's served family style with bread. I had told my server I was a vegetarian so she offered to put the meat on the side. I didn't realize there is a bit on top of the salad usually so that was great, hadn't even considered it. For our entrees we ordered the Chicken parm and the Fettucini alfredo with veggies. First off, the veggies were not overcooked like a lot of places tend to do. They were fresh, crunchy and a lot of variety. Thank you for offering so many options for the vegetarians! Much appreciated. Now....for the sangrias. I am a big sangria fan and they had several on their happy hour menu. The price was $3.50/glass and I gotta say it's a nice size and is quite delicious. I opted for the strawberry lemon because it was different. In these hot Arizona summers  I found it to be very refreshing! They have a sampler of sangrias for just $9 too on the HH menu. It sounds amazing and had I been with other friends would've opted for that but I can only drink so much myself. Sadly. All in all, our server was attentive in every way and took care of us with anything we needed. The meal was fantastic. I can't wait to go back and try some of their other dishes.

IfmqVzQ59CLY1QfkQRbYzQ.text: For someone who eats out more than I would like to admit, this establishment is hands down the best Italian restaurant in arizona. Yes it can get extremely busy but please be patient your tastebuds and stomach will be ever so thankful. Yes they have an amazing happy hour too. Their portions are plentiful and the quality is spot on, they even give you a great complimentary anti pasta salad with your meal thats equally amazing. Everyone I take here gets addicted and fyi this is no where close to my house, but I do not mind the trip at all, it gives me more time to build up my appetite.

OB4IpeLhh7V5cZ8QSkFneg.text: We had a super fantastic experience at this fine establishment.  The food is spectacular and the people offer fantastic service.  This is a fine place to have a celebration.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

xe_BfledGqiv_J4znb7rlA.text: Ok, my wife and I came here last week to celebrate her birthday!  We used to come here all of the time because she used to work right around the corner.  We split a meal and it was delicious. Why we really come here and don't get me wrong, all the food here is fantastic but their desserts set them apart.  We ordered the Apple Bread Pudding and the Tiramisu! There aren't enough adjectives to cover it.   It is dessert heaven!    Their wait staff is fantastic, their hostesses are even amazing, weird I know!    You can't go wrong here!

v3EHLI-ahstBKaUlRB27YA.text: We absolutely love this restaurant. But, after a couple of years of both, dining in, and ordering for takeout, we've become frustrated. When dining in, the food and service is still excellent. But, ordering for takeout, the prices are still the same but, the portions are now about half of what you would get dining in. We almost always order the family meal, ticket to Parma. Now, the chicken parmigiana, which is supposed to be enough for 4 people, is 1 serving cut into 4 tiny pieces, not 4 individual servings.  I don't think we'll be ordering for takeout here anymore. Floridino's gives more , for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Supposed to be chicken parmigiana for 4, but it&#39;s a single serving cut into 4 tiny pieces.

v-IcmALztq5EsJgK7lC44Q.text: TOMMY, he was an AMAZING waiter, He got everything in our complicated order perfectly correct. It made our dinner so enjoyable, he was very tentative and super nice! He is awesome

ZyItbCrm4EUrP-HktnFvWA.text: RigaTony's is a long time favorite of mine going back to their old location. They've been around since the mid-90's. It's a great neighborhood Italian restaurant and they are always packed with lots of locals. One of my favorite things is the free all-you-can-eat bread and salad with your meal. Second thing is I love the community feel this place has. Most of the tables are round and salad comes out in a big bowl that you pass around. They really promote family here. Popular dishes include their steamed clams, baked RigaTony, deep dish lasagna and stuffed ravioli. If you want to try a bit of everything, get the Tour of RigaTony's (a sample of some their favorites like chicken picatta, baked manicotti & fettuccino alfredo). They also have some gluten-free options as well. Like I said, there is usually is a wait. But they have a bar area you can grab a glass of wine and mix and mingle while waiting. They also have a mini store in the front with some fun gimmicky toys and Italian grocery items like pasta or olives you can take home. The service for me has always been excellent. I've been trying new dishes and recently had the Chicken Cutlets Piccata and loved it. If you want an appetizer, I recommend their shrimp and pesto bruschetta. For decor, they have many photos of people that have visited here over the years that adorn the walls. RigaTony's plays a part in the community by donating meals to local organizations like Paz de Cristo and Tempe Community Action Center to feed the homeless.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Eggplant Parmesan
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Cutlets Piccata
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad

NM4VxxPJs2EsYvdJqUgXQg.text: All you can eat salad and home baked bread. All foods are delicious and generous in size.  Our favorites are baked RigaTony's, penne rosa,  and chicken Marsala.  We love this place !!

r8ifZ34o6tP2-u2-ts7SJA.text: Excellent food and excellent service with really good lunch prices! Ordered the lasagna and piccatta!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

XArSiiMO0sGXjRqx1sWBww.text: My family has been coming here for over 10 years. Adorable charm and great Italian food. The salad dressing is delicious!

xzlACQWaQxd9PX__62MkyA.text: Love this place. The foods have always been consistent and good. We have been going here for years. Just the last few years we didn't come back because we moved to Tempe and their location was in downtown Chandler. It's great to see them follow us to Tempe and open a location in our city (LOL).

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

c4cMyBLgcQuknvRgxfD3mw.text: I am not an Italian food kind of guy but, the food was exceptional. We were all here early Sunday for lunch and had never been here. We chose RigaTony's because we were celebrating my grandson's graduation. Our first order was appetizers and we all shared the eggplant and tomato bruschetta plus the fried zucchini. Both were exceptional. For my lunch plate I went for the Italian Chop Single with spaghetti and marinara sauce, and green beans It was delicious and the pork chop was seasoned just right and tender. For dessert I ordered the cappuccino pie, I shared with my granddaughter. It was delicious and was huge. I will give RigaTony's five stars because the service by our waiter was exceptional and everyone including myself enjoyed our food  Update: Today was the second visit to this restaurant. The food is excellent and the service is excellent. Of course because we were a large group, we had to request Tony's room. This provides some privacy from the rest of the restaurant. Great room to be in when you're celebrating birthdays. Which was our case, especially with the good company we had. Just as a tip, their serving portions are more than enough, so if you are a light eater order something to your taste and light. Our compliments go out to our waiter, Scott.  He is nice representation of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tony&#39;s room.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fettuccine with salmon and capers.

ynHKu2bpwHO8qyqd4WA1FQ.text: My husband and I are from NY and besides my mothers Dominican cooking Italian food is right there next to my heart. This place fills the void, I love the homey ambiance, we love trying local businesses they have to put more heart into what they serve to stay afloat.I've had pretty much every pasta dish and have yet to be disappointed. The only thing I would add is if your here during dinner time be patient with the wait its worth it.

8Hpi_qcvYE8iGQ4PDcVxnw.text: I always enjoy Rigatony's.  It's not the highest end Italian Food, but it is always good.  The baked rigatoni is definitely worth giving a shot!

jiT2LY_fCUi0rJzfE0ximw.text: This place is amazing!  I had a coupon for a To-Go order with them and when I called to order it, they were as nice as could be and made me feel real good about getting it.  They were completely accommodating and said they will have it ready for whatever time I'd like.  I told them 5:30 pm and when I got there, it was already waiting for me and kept warm.  They gave it to me with the warmest, nicest welcome, as sweet as could be.  They even threw in a free slice of cake.  It was the coolest, nicest experience ever.  The food, too, was excellent.  Everything was so delicious.  It is my new favorite Italian spot!

UlLUnjzPI4N3XMm42434VQ.text: Rigatony's is great family restaurant. Portions are big so usually split a meal. While there is a fee to split well worth it with their unlimited anti pasta salad and bread. Service is great and with parties of 7 or more request Tony's room for a fun big private room.

-C8lmrQs5mAaOJJnAbJltA.text: This is a "go to" spot for us now.  They turn out a value packed meal that everybody loves. Have not been here when leftovers didn't get into a doggie bag for the ride home. Hefty portions that mean that you leave your diet at home, old time Italian, with great bread and the best salad in town.   THE BEST SALAD!  I only wish that I could resist the desserts!

expKlfeV3a7sdQeD2TgR0w.text: This place has such great deals. My fiance and I ordered" Tony's favorite" which is a spagetti n meatballs, pizza, salad and cibatta bread. It was fantastic. So hearty and just a great place in general. The meatballs were tremendous!  Salad beautiful . Pizza beautiful . Great spot for itallian.

D4pkPARbDIlBL1rBSRjh3A.text: This place is awesome. Very quaint feel inside, though it's actually pretty big and has plenty of seating. I've been here probably three times, and on every occasion the servers and hosts are super friendly and fast. One of the managers will always stop by your table to say hello! For this round my fiance and I shared the shrimp pesto bruchetta, spaghetti supreme, and 2 cannolis. I forget what the bill was but because we chose an appetizer and dessert with just one entree, the price wasn't bad and it actually filled us up. Actually for an Italian restaurant, Rigatony's is very reasonable. Everything was delicious, especially the fresh bread and salad that comes with. Everything is so fresh, you can definitely taste the difference. Make sure to ask for a stamp card on your next visit. You'll get a free entree after so many meals.

XOUQ_RkgMxmtJ_UO7_qQBA.text: Hands down the best pasta dish I've ever had.. South beach chicken and shrimp primavera. The salad and bread were wonderful as well! Will definitely be back.

T0eAyKDaZIQuGMhiKkD1sQ.text: I give up on this place. I want to support local businesses, but I've eaten here several times and the food here is consistently low-quality. Only their antipasto salad is decent, and it's a very simple salad.  I've had food poisoning here TWICE now.   The salmon is farmed and pre-cooked in a factory and then reheated in-store. It is flavorless. All the pasta dishes are mediocre in terms of flavor and sauce. Their alfredo sauce is not made in-store, it comes from a jar. This place is like a Chili's masquerading as an authentic family restaurant.   There are better Italian places in the Valley, with Nick's being a top contender for the best family-owned place I have been.

w7ZHtXQ2igkIAAiEheENtw.text: good food, but if you order To Go, especially for kids, know that you don't any salad or bread for them and hardly any for regular meals. LAME. Their unlimited salad and chicken picata is yummy, but DINE IN for the unlimited salad and bread.

Zri_nw2l16BX659v5_JMsg.text: OMG Amazing!!! Don't you want to kick yourself when you've lived somewhere for a while and JUST find amazing eats that apparently everyone else knows about?  Everything was Awesome! We had the zukes, bread, salad (sorry Olive Garden you've been topped), lasagna, baked rigatoni, and pork tenderloin.  Portions are gi-normous..thank you for my dinner the following night!

TwGlvDXFh71SxLb7l1UMEg.text: JACKPOT!  This is what I love about the Chandler / Tempe area.  I have yet to have bad Italian.  Thursday night at 6pm, THIS PLACE IS PACKED.  I think we were the last table to be seated before they went on a wait.  The service was excellent.    The food was OUTSTANDING!  I was starving when I came in, I left stuffed!    Shrimp and Shells and Veal Picatta and Calamari.  All of it was FANTASTIC.  This will be the place I bring people when they come to visit.

NQCnLb57gSnNf79lvN0T5g.text: Good Italian food for the price, good service, great happy hour... Weve never tried anything bad here and return frequently.  I always have a sangria or two and both are pretty tasty and during happy hour there are only $3 (along with house wine , wells and domestic beers).

qCEMl2PZdrzL0DSEoqO1aQ.text: My mom just got back from a month in Ireland so we came in tonight to catch up. I had the ravioli and spaghetti and meat sauce combo. The ravs were great but I didn't care for the meat sauce. It was very bell pepper forward and just not my thing. Oh, and we had the zucchini appetizer and it was a huge portion but I didn't care for the dill ranch that came with it. The dill just took over. Mom had the special which was a shrimp, penne, roasted red pepper, artichoke hearts and feta dish. She loved it. This would be a 3 star review because the food was decent enough but our server Pippa was so great! We really enjoyed her service and she listened to mom rant on about Ireland even though she was a bit busy. My mom left her a coin from Scotland and she was so thankful and sweet. Next time, we'd definitely ask for her. For dessert, mom had the spumoni and I had the apple bread pudding. Both were very good.

JGjk3dQ7PPdoP2yEimI7BQ.text: Let's stop charging extra for salad, when a whole table has ordered full entrees, and ONE person orders an appetizer and you charge for a salad. And by full table I mean 5 meals were ordered!!! Grrr.

yEHkTYHO6yrUpbs7T0N6Rw.text: Rigatonys has always been super delicious. Almost everything Ive tried has been good. The last time I went on the other hand I got food poisoning from their salad. I should've know with how it smelled and tasted. It was just funky. After that incident it made me not want Rigatonys for a while. So if I go I just wont get the salad!

NcAoaDwTz3ZYo9zOJFwsrw.text: Fantastic Italian food.  You really cannot go wrong with anything you order, classic dishes like chicken parm, lasagne and baked rigatony are all savory and delicious.  I recommend to try it at lunch, any day of the week, order the daily special, and plan to be full as the complimentary salad is bottomless and quite hardy.  If you want to be on the lighter side, some items can switch out pasta for green beans, I recommended asking for them with the marinara sauce, comes out even better that the pasta version for a small extra charge.  Lastly, if you're there for a special occasion, the desserts will not disappoint.  Over the last few years I think we've tried every one of them, and everything is fresh and decadent.

gw9o5vBixdmEqfjgwekdRg.text: Never have I been dissapointed by a meal at Rigatony's. It's a family favorite and, let me just tell you, the salad and bread is to die for. By far my favorite place for not just the salad and bread (yes, better than Olive Garden) but the meals were so good too. Went for lunch this afternoon and the chicken picatta with fettucini alfredo I had was delicious. Topped off dinner with a spumoni and left with very full stomachs and boxes of food to take home.  Great family lunch.

4LOncZ3nGuNC_H3KUStJmg.text: I have been here for dinner twice. The service is prompt and the staff is very friendly. The food is delicious and fairly priced. We had a few cocktails on one occasion and those were very good also. Overall, it was a great dining experience both times and we will definitely be back!

Oxpd0f8fRCJP55zMLxMKiA.text: Delicious! We were looking for some Italian food for takeout. I'm skeptical of Italian food places, as I'm not a fan of overdone pasta and cheap bottle sauce. Their salads were wonderful. We had the chicken piccata and spaghetti with meat sauce. So yummy. Will order from here again.

3LsgC9ygvBXlVSL9Uh5_8g.text: The food an service is always great place for lunch or take out i have been going to rigatony's for many year i never had a bad meal .

UBycyajv2LOcVGwA-ivSZw.text: This is my all time favorite restaurant in the Valley. We have tried many establishments in the East Valley but ALWAYS COME BACK to RigaTony's. From the Knox location to even Brown Road at one time...we will follow you wherever you go or grow! The food is outstanding and the staff is family. The Baked RigaTony is a favorite along with the house salad and ciabatta bread. Give it a try...you won't be disappointed.

AAaWTdSIh_0xMsZ37EZuuA.text: This place was packed even for an early Thursday dinner.  You can tell that this restaurant is a beloved local establishment.  The ambiance is authentic and relaxed...perfect place to enjoy a tasty sangria!  Hubby and I split a three item meal with unlimited bread and salad.  If you split a meal, they charge you $3, but it was well worth it because of the amazing salad and bread.  Forget those chain restaurants that claim they know how to cook Italian food.  Try Rigatony's instead!

23pYVUBXN92qoHrfYqMI2g.text: Rigatony's continue to amaze me. The sausage hot peppers sandwich tasted amazing. My new favorite at this place. As always service is top notch.

usbvXezkWwXsK2_ddtDO0g.text: We went to try because of the reviews, the place is nice, but the food is not as good as I was expecting,  the Alfredo sauce is tasteless (I make a much much better one) and not only that, it got both of us, my boyfriend and I sick...

vp62jHmRfanDR7-YX9A4fw.text: Love this place, found it by a mistake, but love it. My wife and kids don't like it, but its great. Nice location and great service. I love the food, and would go back time and time again. I eat here for business a lot so my wife and kids don't have to go. They prefer the national chain over this, and there is no way, I will eat here over that place anytime! Great service, great food, and great atmosphere!

8toZIkFZpPFgroEYDg_AFw.text: Been going here for years. They always delivery a great meal. The salad is the best! Many times I fill up completely on the salad, then take my entree home to eat the next day.  Some of my favorites are; Appetizers - Fried zuchini or fried ravioli Dinner - Grilled chicken linguini, baked rigatony, lasagna, manicotti are all great

uhhXXTLYBlYW3NsGe799eQ.text: I've been here three separate times and our experience with the wait staff (not the bartenders) has been awful.. the two that we experienced acted like they're doing us a favor by serving us.. no eye contact, no conversation, no manners.  When I said thank you I got back "no problem". Ugh.  The third was a bartender who was pretty nice and attentive. We will not be going back although the food is pretty good.

j4gm_hO8HGTXRAesZi-70g.text: Italian food is my favorite, so I decided to try a new place for lunch today. I wasn't particularly wowed by my experience but I don't see why I wouldn't revisit Rigatony's.   Our waiter, Andrew was nice enough and we didn't have to wait too long to be seated and served.  I ordered the spaghetti with marinara and cheese ravioli & my girlfriend took advantage of the $7.95 lunch special where she was able to get fettuccine alfredo with shrimp and broccoli. Our meals came with a delicious Antipasto salad topped with house made Italian dressing that the chefs were kind enough to make meatless for me. Yum yum yum! We finished those off well before our meals came,with delight! Ciabatta bread was also included. Very plain in my opinion. I always prefer garlic. For our drinks we ordered water w lemon. It was so refreshing. It tasted filtered which was appreciated and unexpected.   The only real con was in my entree. The marinara was so sweet! I love marinara but not too sweet. Still edible but it wasn't my favorite. I doctored it up w cheese, salt and pepper which helped a bit. I guess for that, to each his own. You may love it :)  Overall though, not a bad experience. Not AMAZING. But good.   Thanks for reading! Hope this helps.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Antipasto deliciousness.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Girlfriend&#39;s fettuccine alfredo with shrimp &amp; broccoli. Shrimp was a tad bit tough, but she enjoyed it overall.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sweet marinara on my spaghetti &amp; cheese ravioli? No thanks.

DOuwR2H8GzZcbr19jm_wNg.text: Best Italian restaurant in the east valley! Vito's in Mesa is a close 2nd. The fresh salad and delicious bread pushes Rigs over. The staff is great. Never have had the pizza here due to not being able to get past the pasta. When you drive up and you hear a 45 minute wait on the weekend, know that is for a reason. Have a cold beverage and chill. It'll be worth it.

Q4MbAhsB85_ggTJmJpV9fA.text: Review is for Thursday 10/5/17...took a few days to get around to writing it.   It is difficult to write a review for a place everybody knows is great.  But I will do my best. We go enough that we have filled at least three frequent diner cards.  There were four of us celebrating my mother's 89th birthday.  Her main objective was the fried zucchini.  They came out hot, just the right amount of breading and the cuts were just the right size.  I cant find any better in the valley.  If there are please let me know.   Rally, I would like to try them.  Service We had Marissa.  She was great.  Patient with the table.  Made the salad exactly how we requested (extra tomatoes for my dad...no onion).  Drinks never empty.  Worked with some indecision on what to eat.  I would have screamed...Just pick something.    Service is usually OK.  Never bad.  But never this good.  Well we have had Marissa before so it was great then also.    We try to eat there during the off times...always...so I cannot comment on what the service is like when people eat at normal times.  We plan to go for late lunch or early dinner. (They have great lunch and early bird specials.) Check their website.   Food They make the cheese raviolis.  No they really do.  And you can tell.  Also any other pasta always comes out cooked to perfection.  And they will not tell you how they tenderize the chicken.  It is a secret.    They do not use garlic as a weapon.  Some Italian places think you just have to use a lot of garlic to make it Italian.   We talked my mom into the chicken picatta, with fettuccine alfredo.  Big hit with mom and wife.  I had the chicken parm...how do they tenderize it?  It is consistently perfect.  Never had it overcooked.    My dad had angel hair pasta and two giant meatballs. Almost as good as mine.  Almost...  Dessert Oh and the bread pudding is worth more than what they charge.  All four of ate one order.  It was soft, but not mushy.  The flavors were perfect and the sauce was great.   Timing Be warned, they do take reservations, but if you eat at normal adult/dating times you will wait.  Particularly now that our friends from the north are returning.

NLyeYS5wl08ckoh2xaxFVw.text: This is now probably my favorite Italian place for a good price since Riazzi's closed. They're lunch special is amazing. Unlimited salad and bread with any order as well. My favorite dish is the baked rigatony, but all of their entrees are good.

BNNG5HVni2SSKyven32lDg.text: Our go-to Italian restaurant in AZ. Have never been disappointed with any of their dishes, including dessert. They offer great specials and fun events all the time (i.e. monthly wine pairing dinner opportunities or the Facebook bracket race to see which RigaTony dish is the absolute fan favorite!). Portions are large with extremely reasonable prices to match. What more can a girl ask for?!  I also wanted to point out how lovely their service has always been. Yes, the wait can feel long at times, but as soon as you're seated, the service is on point.  There was one incident where I ordered a family meal go-to to get us through the next few days. We didn't check the boxes before we left and didn't realize that one of our main dishes was completely missing until 2 days later. I didn't really expect to get anything back, but I messaged their Facebook page to let them know what happened, just in case they noticed they had an extra box of something 2 days eariler, and to my surprise the manager apologized for the mishap and offered us a redo of the whole family meal package, completely free of charge! He just got me out of cooking for a whole week now! The RigaTony's staff went out of their way to keep their customers happy. It's such a hard thing to find in today's world, so we're forever grateful.

Fmd8DjOGbzVgVcMURsZeTg.text: We had an amazing meal after an Angel Diamondback spring training game. We split an order of bruschetta and salad with spaghetti. Absolutely delicious. Jesse was a great server. The atmosphere was exactly what we wanted in an authentic Italian restaurant. I highly recommend RigaTony's for dinner.

gV7xRGCs-n7czTO3CDQ8Rg.text: Salads are superb! Probably some of the best I've ever had. Tried the Salomon linguini and it was delicious. Only reason I didn't five star cause our server Colin was pretty much lazy at coming to check to see if we needed anything.

TKplARnO3KB1sezv0vglRw.text: Hands down...my favorite Italian Restaurant.  Excellent service. The food is amazing and to say it's reasonably priced would be an understatement.  The antipasto salad is served family style with homemade dressing (the best I've ever had) and seasoned Italian Bread and I believe it comes with every entree.  Delicious fried zucchini overflows the plate it's served on.  Every entree I've tried is top notch.  Today I had the zucchini appetizer,  angel hair pasta in lemon butter sauce topped with spinach, a glass of sangria,  mushroom and shrimp from the lunch menu.  Entree served with all you can eat antipasto and bread.  Spumoni for dessert.  I brought home a 2 topping pizza for my husband which also came with antipasto salad and 3 slices of bread.  My total bill came to $45.78 for all of this delicious food and leftovers!

BKjpySCcclvQwbgXib4Dug.text: Delicious! I had the baked rigatoni lunch special. My friend had chxn parm lunch special. Came with large Italian salad and bread. Next time it would be nice if we could know what salad we were getting though, still delicious. Super filling! Waitress was so sweet, bringing us water and bread without us asking. Service was great and portions were large.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

1c0ThYxxXGm-mjFUnDGCtw.text: Worst meal I've ever had!  If you like super sweet marinara sauce this is your place!  Salad greens were soggy, chicken piccata was tasteless and cold, the manicotti was ok and bread was awesome.  I won't be coming back.

GW1B9XmzHIJgpEoUgVY_3A.text: Best Italian place in town! We have been going here for well over 20 years and it has never disappointed. The salad is absolutely delicious and they have phenomenal  pasta dishes. The prices can't be beat.

rfdz6zqQqiYhIVhKg9u8oQ.text: You can never go wrong with this place. I miss having the shrimp scampi on the menu. In past years I found out I am allergic to shrimp (although I show no signs) and the shrimp scampi is the only shrimp dish I can't say no to. The shrimp is cooked to perfecting and tastes like lobster that's how good it is!

IahbKlo1Yqs3KdYE6Sy-gg.text: Never had a bad meal here, and tonight was no different. Service was top notch. Braeden was our server.  Hubbys pet peeve is an empty glass, and it was never empty, kudos!  Dishes were removed quickly too.  The only negative was the chicken picatta was not in any sauce. I'm used to a light lemon caper sauce, so the chicken isn't so dry. There were plenty of capers, just no lemon sauce.  They have a great rewards program also, be sure to sign up for it.

66xTypX5f4O5wv9bcMlYyA.text: Great bartenders and fantastic food!!!!!!!!! First time there we will definitely be back. Highly recommend!!!!!!! At the end of our meal Mike came out to check on how our meal was. Love it!!!! Signed, Ray and Denise

pHGDDHIlUDLxmtqI8MR5cQ.text: Our party made a reservation for 4 per the restaurants suggestion.  When we got there our party had been increased by one, so we had to wait an additional 20 minutes which did not seem out of line.  I don't remember the last time I had to make a reservation for dinner in the greater Phoenix area however, but after standing in line outside of a Lone Star or any other restaurant in town on a Friday night maybe it's something we need to go back to so props to them for the old school throwback memory.  Back to the food:  I had the Alfredo with sausage, and my wife had the Alfredo with chicken.  My daughter and guests had the spaghetti Deluxe and one guest had the lasagna.  I can't say if the lasagna dish was great or not as I have not heard back from her on it so far, but my wife and I weren't thrilled with our Alfredo dishes.  The portion size was crazy huge, but the flavor was just average.  My daughter said the sausage was a bit too spicy for her in her spaghetti, but also that between the meat sauce, meatballs and sausage there was hardly any noodles.  She made the comment on the ride home she had the meat sweats from trying to eat it all.  My family and I discussed it and we all agreed that the pricing and atmosphere are good, and the fresh bread and starter salads was great, but as for the main dishes they just didn't "do it" for us.  We'd go back again with friends if we are invited, but otherwise it just doesn't land on our places to bookmark for future reference.

qw7JmwrFt1CC9puy5hF1Eg.text: Just celebrated my fiance's birthday here and boy, was it worth it. I was hesitant at first because we waited quite a while for someone to come take our drink order, but for their defense, there was a huge party there at the same time. Once the waiter took our order, the meal kept getting better and better.  First, they brought out bread with oil at the same time they brought fresh salad. The salad was mixed right in front of us. Super fresh and delicious with an amazingly flavorful dressing.   Then, the main meal. We decided to share the baked RigaTony with meatballs. They brought out two separate plates, both baked and plated separately. It was like having our own meals; I would have never known we split it. AND Every bite was worth every creamy, cheesy calorie.   At the end, they brought out an apple bread pudding with whipped cream for the birthday boy. Yum. It was creamy and just enough sweet. Every bite was melt-in-your-mouth.   I would definitely go again. Thank you for a great meal!
