Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Apple bread pudding
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baked RigaTony (half size /split)

gFal_5gtzNVuYOQudCvE7A.text: Second time a charm: July, 2019 This time I tried for dinner.  We had a lovely server (Laura) who took amazing care of us.  Food/ Salad: I don't care for the Salami but it is a good fresh salad with great dressing this time.  Food/Kids Spaghetti & Meatball: Monday kids eat free so that was a good surprise.  3/5 stars not a hit for the kiddo.  Food/Kids Pizza: They said they were able to accommodate a change but u take your chances.  Ordered very light cheese came pretty much loaded.  Lactose intolerant kiddos be ware!  Food/Fettuccine Alfredo: pretty good pasta cooked well and sauce was even.  Not too much garlic and not too little!  Was able to get the fresh grated salad parm so that was nice!  Food/Table bread: lovely!

Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kids pepperoni (light cheese) pizza
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo with shredded parm.

309P0BEoqXtM1xMgL_qDFQ.text: I've been meaning to stop here for quite some time now. Tonight, I finally got a chance.  It was crowded, and I was told there would be a 35 minute wait. However, I eat alone so I opted to sit at the bar. My bartender/server was Whitney. She's charming and helpful and smiles all the time - - all the qualities of a good server. At her recommendation, I order the baked rigatoni.  My meal comes with a salad that is slightly reminiscent of Olive Garden, however I want to say that it was a MORE version. Higher quality. It had thin strips of salami in it that were just perfect with it. The bread was served warm with olive oil and herbs. Very good bread.  Pretty much everyone loves macaroni and cheese, right? The baked rigatoni is like macaroni and cheese - - the best macaroni and cheese I've ever had. It's not dried out like a lot of macaroni and cheese dishes. The cheese is soft and creamy and delish. It also had a touch of tomato sauce on top that was very garlicky and yummy.  I told Whitney that I haven't drank alcohol in many years and that if I ever started, I believe I would go to RigaTony's. The drinks look ice cold and very appetizing.   Whitney demonstrates the epitome of good service. Well done!

uVvVbPxiSbVC-EHGRMzqIA.text: Always amazing food and amazing staff! Been here about four or five times. It's our new favorite Italian place!

fa1r0Am3-4kQ9TGA2R9f2g.text: Best antipasto salad and cannolis ! Marissa, thank you for your outstanding customer service. Food and service- amazing. We are definitely going back due to great food and amazing service.   * * * * * * * * *

t8Ean1ED4aBmphbhjfu5Qg.text: Great Italian spot. Really solid food. Had the cheese ravioli. And a side of meatballs. And even share some lasagna with friends. Huge portions. The service was great. The atmosphere was fun. And all-around good time and we will be coming back for more.

12iYT5SZuhadg9a4t3jBWQ.text: Fast/excellent service and amazing food!   The bread O M G so good! It's cooked perfectly where the outer edges are the perfect amount of crispy and the inside is so soft.  The meals come with a giant bowl of Antipasto salad for the table! So cool! And you can ask for more! How cool!   I ordered the Crusted Chicken Piccata and my brother ordered the Chicken Alfredo with white cream sauce and marinara sauce. The food was outstanding!   The wait time for the food was very short. Very impressed! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Alfredo
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Crusted Chicken Piccata

1Z6HpvftUaAFfHB8dMfhJg.text: I liked it! First time here. Brought some friends  who never had itallian food. We started with two different bruchetta appetizers. One had shrimp and the other had eggplant and tomato. They were both very tasty. Next we had bread for dipping in olive oil with an exceptional antipasto  salad. Probably could have called it quits....but then came the entrees.   I had a scollop and shrimp pasta dish with feta cheese. Two people shared the Tour of Riga Tony's Special. Another person had the scampi with pasta.  Recovered post food coma. All good...service, food, portion size, and price. FIve stars hands down!!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scampi
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scollops and Shrimp
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

vbM40UOIO86ygpkfVOSJ3w.text: Went here on a Friday night for dinner....about 7pm.  It was busy, told that we'd have a 20-25 minute wait, but it was really only 11 minutes.  Service was what I would expect on a busy Friday night at a great restaurant.  The salad was tasty and fresh, the bread....wow, phenomenal, the bruschetta was perfect and the chicken parm was excellent.  Took home canolis for dessert.   Our server was Tricia and she was super-friendly and quick.  I will definitely be back.

GaSGFQIJpI59v6hM6GJ9jg.text: We hadn't been to RigaTony's in about 10 years. In fact, I thought it had gone out of business. We arrived at 5 PM on a Sunday and it was nearly full but we were seated promptly.   The restaurant was very homey, with nostalgic items mounted on the walls throughout. Our server, Tatum, greeted us, offered menus and drinks. She was friendly, efficient and knew the menu well.   My wife ordered the Seafood Checca (with GF pasta) and wine while I got Shrimp and Scallop Scampi and an Iced Tea. It came to $53 plus tip.   Our entrees came with house antipasto salad and bread. Both were well constructed with typical Italian notes. The entrees were outstanding. I failed to take a pic cuz I was so hungry but my Scampi had the seafood in a boat and the sauced pasta on the plate. That made it easy to get some angel hair pasta on the fork, capped with a piece of shrimp or scallop. Both items were masterfully prepared, cooked perfectly and very tender.   RigaTony's did not lose their touch over the years and perhaps improved, like a fine wine.

6DkMaRTgRYvhtn_VpOfgNA.text: This place is amazing. Great salad that comes with meat in it. I would suggest the clams starter I usually get the 2lb version. So buttery and delicious

UGEaDtzCt-NOLGFhoftokg.text: When the sun hits your eye like a big pizza pie, that's amore. When a giant salad and pasta hits the spot in your belly, that's RigaTony's.   From what I understand, and a quick internet search tells me, RigaTony's Authentic Italian has been in the Valley for over 20 years. And they must be doing something right to keep the crowds coming back.   The best way I can describe the restaurant is if Buca di Beppo and Olive Garden had a love child that actually knew how to cook. You'll want to come back and get them again and again. I've been a few times now and know I'm already planning my next return visit.   I wasn't expecting such a delicious Antipasto Salad but I ate it up. Their Italian dressing is killer and goes well with the Genoa salami, Italian cheese, olives, pepperoncinis, onions and tomatoes in the salad. The complimentary freshly baked Ciabatta Bread and olive oil put the breadsticks to shame from that chain place. The Express Lunch Special portion is perfect size to allowing you to finish any weekend errands afterward without the overwhelming desire to for a nap.  There is always room for dessert! You'll want to indulge in their signature Four Layer Chocolate Hazelnut Cake, House Specialty Tiramisu, homemade Cannoli, warm Apple Bread Pudding or classic Spumoni. With so many delicious choices, it is difficult to pick just one so I recommend sharing so you can trying multiple.    See you soon, RigaTony's Authentic Italian!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Apple Bread Pudding
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Angel Hair Spaghetti
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Angel Hair Cacio e Pepe

mWOVhp5rzNjEEJvEGbp58A.text: Food is good and most of the service is great. My problem is they allow children in the bar area.  I get it's a family restaurant, but come on, they have the rest of the place to sit at. Leave the bar for adults who don't have kids with them and/or don't want to be with kids.

T9FqIo3Bi2a9h-iWHptbHQ.text: I feel terrible I can't remember our servers name but he was an absolute gem! We had never been to RigaTony's before but have heard from multiple people to try it so we finally did. On a Wednesday evening it was ABSOLUTELY packed but we wanted to try it and with that long of a wait -- it's gota be good right?!   So glad we stuck it out because I loved everything about our experience. The complimentary bread was so fresh and delicious, my chicken Park was spot on, and the service was amazing. I'm super pumped since we got two entrees for our brand spanken new punch card too! Can't wait to come back!!

fA-1yPnfaMwuEbCgTf89bg.text: A friend of mine took me here and I have to tell you I didn't even know this place existed. The service was excellent and the food was really really good. I had, believe it or not, the spaghetti and meatballs, which was probably some of the best I've ever had and my friend had the rigatoni. I had to try some of hers and it was some of the best pasta I've ever tasted.   5 stars for this great Italian spot and it's definitely a recommendation to all.

z8DEIWWGWi9zPlfI4ZpSdA.text: Is the rough part of Italy called the spaghetto?  I really like it here at RigaTony's. The food is good from the clams in white wine sauce to the manicotti. The Baked RigaTony and Spaghetti Deluxe are alao sone of my favorites. Even the complimentary antipasto salad and ciabatta bread are delicious. I have yet to have had a bad bite here and I hope it stays that way.   The portions are generous and there is always a line out the door and for good reason. Come here for some solid Italian food and be prepared to hit that food coma. I hope you like RigaTony's as much as I do.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shrimp Capellini.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Clams in white wine. The wife&#39;s fave.

eIpuwzvR6AMIFa5VxgOJug.text: We chose to come to RigaTony's because we received a gift card from the holidays that we hadn't used yet. So far my experience here is terrible. The host can't do math so for starters I'd recommend making advance reservations. I checked in at 6pm, was told 30-40 minute wait, so we waited, checked in a minute until it had passed 40 minutes, AND was told another 20 minute wait.... THEN I said, "so my 30-40 minute wait is really an hour wait.." and then he proceeds to tell me the above time frame in a manner that implied I couldn't do math... what an idiot.  Hopefully the food is better than the wait and host service...  On a lighter note: - restroom has a changing table BUT be careful because the restrooms are small and someone walking in could hit you with the door or run right into you if you stand close enough...  - kids eat free Monday BUT enroute to the restroom you'll see larger groups of older people, and a very older crowd.  - there's decent seating in the waiting area, but overflows quickly... - if your still waiting an hour like my family is, you can help yourself to the large bowl of complementary mints...  They should be more considerate of families with kids...  Update post dinner: Our server was extremely nice and got everything right. The food was great and came out on time. You could tell they were busy but she stayed on top of everything and got our order right. For that I'll give an extra star...

Qy05Vx_CKrI7kBFR1wOJAg.text: I'm a spaghetti specialist and hands down. Best spaghetti I've ever had. Sicilian style. Service also exceptional.

CcRIPuve3koOZVP1bJ0UvA.text: Probably the best meal we had on our trip to PHX. All four of us loved our meals. Pasta Rigatony, chicken Marsala, eggplant parm and four cheese fettuccini. All were excellent! As many others have commented, the salad and bread that comes with every meal was fantastic. The best part of our meal was the service. Tony provided some of the best service I have had in years. Both my wife and I worked in the service industry for many years and walked away thoroughly impressed! Big servings, reasonable prices, excellent service and food! Next trip to PHX we will absolutely be back!

5m4bBUjMim8jF1FPN_ANCA.text: Best antipasto salad I've ever had! Pasta is good, wish it had a tad more flavor... But we eat takeout from here at least once a month! Make reservations there is a wait almost every night... But worth it!

KY8JwNDgS1PLVabUkz9C0w.text: Tonight my wife and I were looking for something local and different, stopped in and we couldn't be happier.  This local joint had a lot to live up to compared to a similar place we went to back east, and they definitely delivered all that and then some.  If you want excellent service ask for little Franky (she rocks); I've noted the mixed reviews here and I won't take anything from others who didn't have a good experience, but whatever they are doing lately seems to work if they will be sure to hire more people like Franky!  As far as the food goes, I've been all over and they do know Italian, certainly it has its own American flavor, but compared to a restaurant with the initials OG it's like being in Florence.

iV1g7WoK2E23r4CC8RpdoQ.text: Amazing food, especially their famous salad! And great service also! My boyfriend and I go there a lot.. The prices are pretty reasonable as well

U-5IsSG7UGhxkNdGmM-FpQ.text: I paid $190 to have food catered to our work and they didn't include any plates and utensils when I asked them if they did and they said yes. I showed up to my works luncheon looking like an idiot for having all of this food and nothing to eat it with. This is ridiculous

tiWUPUTG4LuWHz0uPQunEg.text: Went to RigaTony's on Friday for lunch - this was my first visit to this to this establishment in a long time. This is the relatively new Chandler location, and I really like the way they have the restaurant and patio arranged.  We were seated immediately, but afterward it took ten minutes before a server stopped at our table to take our orders. It was exceptionally busy, the server did apologize for the delay, and other than that glitch the service was fine from then on, so it wouldn't be anything that would keep me from returning.  This time I ordered the four cheese ravioli, which was really good - I would recommend this to anyone. The antipasto salad, which I have always enjoyed at RigaTony's, was great - as was the freshly baked bread that they provided to snack on.  In the past I have been a little reluctant to choose RigaTony's because I wasn't really a big fan of their menu, but after this visit I noticed that they offer more of a variety of food choices that are certain to keep me coming back.

7vBl8oCqFKofpraLi2ZkyA.text: After a few trips to Riga Tony's for lunch I am a fan... They have a great weekly lunch special each day for $6.95 each dish comes with a really good Antipasta salad with a really good dressing.  The ciabatta bread is always really fresh and hot great for dipping.. I highly recommend the baked rigatony with Italian sausage Wednesday and baked stuffed shells Thursday. I will be back for sure it's great good with great prices.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

HDoTE8d2pMUWM_T3oIFlQw.text: It's that it was terrible it's that it's sooooo incredibly generic and it was one of the loudest restaurants I've ever been to. Too generic for me to go back. Also waaaay to overpriced for the quality. Olive Garden is better and cheaper.

XZZAyaiTggoh9pk4bzXXEQ.text: After hearing rave reviews about RigaTony's from a family friend, my husband and I decided it was time to try.  Our food was great, but our service was absolutely horrible.  We came late on a Tuesday night, and the restaurant was pretty empty.  We were given little to no attention, and when we asked to speak to a manager at the end of our meal we waited 10 mins and no one showed, at which point we left.  If the manager had even given us the slightest bit of attention, we may have found it in our hearts to try again.

grLtgvlC97gVhadgRBz5PA.text: This is our favorite Italian restaurant.  The bread and salad are delicious and the main dishes have always been tasty.  One of my favorites is the lasagne with meat sauce.  My husband always gets the baked Rigatony's and the kids love Fettuccine Alfredo.  Don't forget to save room for the cappuccino pie!  This is our go to place for special occasions and the service has always been great.  When my son was 4 (he's now 17) we would go a lot and Margaret was our server.  She always remembered that he liked black olives and would bring a small saucer just for him.  It's always best to make reservations as it is always busy-even during the week.

9tuuy2LepWWEji1O7E17fA.text: AMAZING! I have been coming here for years and can't find a better restaurant in the valley. From the service to the tasty food everything is exceptional! Jenny keeps us coming back with the feeling that we are eating at home with friends. Some of my favorite dishes are the Baked Rigatony and the Sea Shells. You won't be disappointed!

sUWZ_-OQWLrIWh6siZqE-A.text: Only eaten here once. Loved the bread and the apple bread pudding was fantastic. Got chicken parmesan. Chicken was cooked nicely. Sauce is slightly too sweet for me but definitely edible (I am very picky about pasta sauce). The green beans, erh, kinda sucked and I probably wouldn't order them again. I am intrigued by the option of the quinoa pasta and imagine I will try that in the future. The salad was decent and I liked the dressing (very picky about dressings). Service was mixed however the positive aspect of it was so good that I left feeling great. I will definitely return and can imagine amending this to a 4 star place after eating here a few more times. I am totally happy about it being local. So awesome.

mqKO47tJBNaqB2LmU-qUHA.text: We picked this restaurant based on the reviews I read on line. It was the one negative review that cinched it that this was the right restaurant for us. He listed dish after dish he had tried and of course knocked them all. I figured if he had eaten here so many times, the food had to be good in spite of his complaints.   We arrived early on a Wednesday night and the parking lot was full. Based on our experience of eating on the road this is the best sign of a great restaurant. Gene ate the signature "Rigatony" and pronounced it delicious. As usual I was undecided and the waiter urged me to describe what I was looking for. I mentioned, angel hair and artichokes and chicken and he brought back something that was not on the menu and anticipated everything I was in the mood for. The bread was good and the salad was hearty with Salomi sliced thin and looked like sliced onions. Service was great and the restaurant nice but unpretentious. Next time in this area we will eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. RigaTony signature rigatony

RAPcPUWsdECJZsHaSQZUrg.text: Loved this place! The atmosphere was amazing, warm and fun.  The bar reminded me of the old days with lots of wood, a variety of alcohol and lots of character. The Rigatony is over the top good.

qswtCAUHkPcr2VmWGEFaoA.text: I must say, this was the worst, most overpriced Italian food I've ever had. First, the salad was, well, salad! Enough said. Nothing special by any means. Our bread had a short, black hair on it so it was left uneaten. The calamari was just plain old frozen calamari that was deep fried. What happened to fresh food? The pizza that was $20 was far from a $20 pizza. It was brought on a regular dinner plate and the center was dropped because the plate wasn't flat, therefore all the grease ran to the center and made it way to soupy. Suggestion, serve pizza on something flat. The flavor was not any better. And being that it was served on a regular dinner plate, it wasn't $20 big. My Capellini Pescatore was sub par. I was graced with a total of five empty clam and mussel shells. Maybe I'm wrong but if someone pays $16 for a seafood dish, it should be a priority to make sure they get the most expensive part, which is the seafood. The pasta was literally in a bath of butter sauce that was supposed to have white wine in it. All I could taste was butter. Drenched in butter. No wine flavor at all.   Our server was a nice young gentleman and he did a good job for the most part. My have drank glass of Sprite was topped off with water though so it kinda went south for him after that. Anyway, from reading the other reviews, I guess people from Arizona just don't know what good Italian food should taste like. The food was not at all worth the $50 bill. We won't be going back.

Gu4q_JAOkwIL0vxIVcXUxw.text: Theeeee best Italian restaurant around! Their house salad is to die for and the yummy homemade dressing.

zAVbxI1hWrbJgO6QV9S3Kw.text: Tried Rigatony's for the first time tonight. All in all, very good. Service was a little slow but the place was in packed so that was to be expected. The waitress wasn't the sharpest tool in the shed but she was an affable simpleton and tried really hard so kudos to her.   Antipasto salad and ciabata bread were included with the entrees and were both very good. I had a glass of chianti - not very good and my wife had white basil sangria, which was delicious.  I had the deluxe spaghetti which included meat sauce, meatball, and Italian sausage - it was ok. My wife had the ravioli, which tasted home made and delicious. We got 2 cannolis to take home.  All in all, very good. We shall return!  Update: ate the cannolis when we got home - they were GRRRREAT!

GVmp5k6jB1VDb11L6W6xkg.text: Had a great experience tonight.  First, the meals come with all you can eat (good) salad and bread.  The salad has a bunch of stuff: cheese, salami, olives, pepperoncini, etc... Great salad and the bread was pretty good.  I had the eggplant parmeasean with quinoa noodles instead of regular noodles, cooked sicilian style (with garlic, anchovies, peppers, and some other stuff).  It was a huge portion - 2 or three thick slices of eggplant with cheese.  The quinoa noodles were delicious and, i think, at least in theory, are healthier than typical noodles.  you can also get whole wheat or green bean noodles - all at no extra charge.  Sauce tasted homemade, was thick with chunks of tomato and delicious.  Great entree, great portion, and great price (12.25)  My fiance had the salmon penne something.  Was not that great...salmon had very unique and rich smokey flavor, which I am sure some people love.  But not us.  Thats ok - the waitress exchanged our meal for another eggplant parmeasean (to go, since we were full)...and best of all she only charged us for one meal!  We will definitelly be back, just not to get the salmon penne.    You can also split an entree and pay 3$ for the all you can eat salad and bread - which is probably what we will do next time.

8qa4oHDqe-z66DwSKy4blA.text: Went here for a date last week and I really liked it!  The hostess greeted us right away and took us to our table.  I don't know if she could tell we were on a date or what but she gave us a great corner booth that was a little secluded which was nice.  The waitress came out right away and had a thick Italian accent (always a really good sign when you're at an Italian restaurant!).  She made recommendations and knew how the food was cooked when asked.  I decided to go with the Chicken Parmesan (I know it's not that creative but I love it!) and my date got the Chicken Marsala.  Both were great.  Our plates were cleared when we left.  Before the meal you get salad and crispy garlic bread both of which were also yummy.  Also my water glass never got empty which, to me, is the True test of how good a restaurant's service is.  I'll definitely be returning!

kKBSZay9NGM9Z1UEtbbg8Q.text: Poorly organized! We waited 40 minutes for a table at 430pm when there were tables open. We watched several couples seated before us when they arrived after. 2 people came in to get their to go orders and the girls at the desk had no idea what they were talking about. Unfortunately we won't b back, too frustrating which is a shame bcuz the food is good.

nG7XolWYhFuUIeJlGAsl4Q.text: Absolutely perfect food!   My husband and I went here for the first time this week, based on a recommendation.  I ordered the seafood fettuccine and he ordered the chicken parmesan.    My dish was absolutely perfect.  The sauce just melted in my mouth.  The portions were very generous, with me barely eating half of my dish.    My husband's dish was pretty good.  He was able to finish it, and he often has left overs.  So his was either super good or his portions were less than mine.    The only draw back is the tables are really close together.  I felt like I kept staring at another person from another table who was really close to me.  It is kind of awkward to finally have a date night and to be seated closer to another person at another table than my husband!    Overall, the food was perfect but the ambiance not so much.  We will definitely go back again and hopefully get a better seat.  With just over a 20% tip our meal was exactly $75 which is perfect for our budget.

069ibRjpIvCqGSXgdPkefQ.text: Rigatony's is our 'go to' place for low cost high quality Italian food. Their dinners include salad (as much as you want!)  and yummy bread along with the entrees. All the pasta dishes are great...my favorite being the Chicken Parmesan. Good pizza too! And they have great lunch specials and a frequent customer card that gives you free and low cost items.  This is a busy, happy place to go...great for families. And they have a nice patio area.

tmMaCZdb1QKVzmXit3om3A.text: Until tonight I hadn't been to RigaTony's since they moved from their Arizona Ave location, and I'm very sorry that I took so long to visit. Honestly the few times I ate at the other location I wasn't blown away, so I really didn't care to give them many more chances.   Tonight was completely different than my previous experiences from years ago. This is now officially my favorite Italian restaurant in Arizona. The food is great, and the $7.50 Early Bird Special is an amazing deal. I also appreciated the frequent diner card that was offered to me, and it's awesome that they don't exclude the Early Bird entrees from it. (I really wouldn't blame them if they did exclude the special because you are already getting a discounted meal with it.) BUT what made my visit stand out more than anything was the fabulous level of service I received. Every single employee smiled at me and made me feel welcome and asked me how I was doing. You don't see that very often, and it was very refreshing.

YVFvEJIOcM31i2DyppMErQ.text: The Steamed Clams are awesome....honestly never ordered anything other than those delicious Clams and the big salad! Mouth watering waiting for them to come to the table, oh and the bread so yummy dipped in the clam broth :-)

3IuZw5Kr9cVfLQlMGM7Ghg.text: This place used to be 5 star worthy, but the last two times have been a major disappointment. We visited last Monday. Thankfully the kids ate free, because none of them wanted to eat their food. The sauce on their pizza and ravioli was very sweet and salty. My husband and I didn't have much to complain about our food, it was pretty good. Not as delicious and memorable as before though. The service during our last visit was horrible. Our waiter took our order and we didn't see him again until he brought our check. No drink refills and we had to eat with our dirty salad plates crowding the table. I will likely give them another chance because of our history, we have been loyal customers for over 10 years. It won't be for some time though.

xiPxhyWYhvBKmaNzjwdmeQ.text: Good enough, but probably not a place to return to.  It's like olive garden, but a local version.  The pros: free salad and bread. Prices are reasonable. Cons: mediocre food. Not very tasty. Pasta was rubbery. Tastes like the samples you'd get at costco: good because they're free. I'd choose Floridinos over this place,  despite the more varied menu here.  Good portion sizes but of "so so" food. Next!

QO96QPRbRK3zzVLSZjdlyw.text: Okay so im from back east and i find it very funny that people here go to oregano's and thing that the food is good when its all frozen.  So me and my gf went to Riga tonys and wow great food great service.  Our waiter was Mark and all i can say is that is the most friendly and most professional waiter i have ever met.  The guy loves his job and even convinced me to go to one of his yoga classes haha

0vD6XkGINTymRikMOcz9lw.text: Good food, good service at a cozy atmosphere. It's very family friendly but at the same time it can be a nice, casual date night restaurant.   All entrees come with salad and nice, crusty bread. They toss the salad at your table when they bring it out to you. The salad is good. It's tossed in a vinaigrette dressing thats quite tasty. You can have seconds if you desire to do so. I'm usually good with one round of salad but will usually opt for more bread to use to soak up the sauce of my entree.   I've only had the pastas here and I haven't had one I didn't enjoy. The meatballs are really good, here. The lasagna is tasty and meaty, though sometimes on the sweet side. On my last visit I had one of the specials on the board, which was a seafood medley pasta. It was a generous amount of seafood sauteed in a vodka pesto sauce. OMG that sauce was amazing! I would've been happy with just a loaf of bread and a bowl of that sauce to dip in as my meal. It reminded me of some kind of seafood chowder bread bowl of some sort. Delicious. Sucks that it was a special on the board and not on their regular menu because I'd order that over and over again.  Service is attentive. Drinks are always filled. They work as a team here as oppose to only one person attending to each table. Prices are very reasonable. It's one of the better italian restaurants in the area.

uRZTkKcNtjMklrFuInctEA.text: I will say my favorite part of eating at RigaTony's is the antipasta salad and bread.  I normally fill up on the salad that I have to take my entree home. On my last visit I had the cheese raviollis with the pesto sauce. I will defiantly be getting that again. SO YUMMY! I have also tried their bake rigatony with Italian sausage and was a fan of that also. I have never had a bad meal here. I would have given them 5 stars, but the last few times service has been slow and they seemed understaffed.  Also, their Sangria is very refreshing.

IEl8oBhVwFl5LI8_30awmw.text: I've never met a meal I didn't like here.  Good portions, with flavorful entrees.  At lunchtime they offer an express lunch which includes a different entree every day, salad, and bread for $6.95, usually made for you within 10 minutes (depending on how busy they are).

VsQL1EW3YgW7GW6Ip2ehQQ.text: Decided to try last night based on the reviews,  and it did not disappoint!  The ruby red sangria was fantastic!  But they have three different types,  so I'll be back to try them all!    Hubby had the seafood fettuccine,  it has a pesto Alfredo sauce.  He isn't fond of pesto so he wasn't a huge fan.  He did say the seafood was delicious.    I had the veal parm and it was amazing!  The spaghetti caputo that accompanied the veal was seriously delicious and I could eat heaping bowls of it!    The service was great.  Our waitress was warm and friendly without hovering.    Great Italian!  We'll be back!

bHgxCfY2elWZCbpsLJsdoA.text: So it was my birthday tonight and my boyfriend picked this placed based on online reviews (he doesn't yelp). It was such a great surprise I would come back here for sure. We had a great server, Marisa. I had the Capellini Pescatori and my boyfriend had the lasagna. Both were unreal delish. The salad was so good. The calamari was good we added the frizzles and worth the extra dollar. All in all we had a lovely dinner/birthday celebration and I'm so glad we found this gem!

d5a-AzWyzSNiuq8WvjReeQ.text: Rigatony's I have probably reviewed you before but must do it again. I love your food, I love your service, I love your shot of chianti at the start of the meal, I love your salads and pastas. Mostly, I love how close you are to home and your food that feels like home. I can honestly say that you're my favorite Italian restaurant for these simple reasons. Keep doing what you do and I'll keep coming back.

TAmDaUvfc0jq2IAN91XRUw.text: My friends and I have been here for lunch and dinner many times and always enjoy the exceptional food! However, our server Sophie made this experience especially great. She was so sweet and personable, even though we came in somewhat late. She recommended a great wine and dessert, and we had a great time chatting with her. Thank you Sophie for making our dinner that much more enjoyable! Props to you and RigaTony's.

ojhHtLDztabTi6wHqjf2RA.text: I am a die hard Rigatony's fan.  I come here for my birthday each year and usually my brother does for his as well.  We were sad when the location on Brown road closed, but have to say that this location is actually much better.  Good to make a reservation so that you don't have to wait.  Love the Chicken Picatta, Veal Canneloni, Sangria, Bread Pudding and most of all the antipasto salad which is the best!!  I've always had great service too!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Parmesan

5gFy2ckuAIp-tQympq9V3Q.text: I really wish I had been coming here all these years. I'm mad I only recently started coming back a year ago. This place is truly great. Such a huge restaurant and yet always so packed. That tells you something.  I love the ambience and the homely feel you get when you are here. They have a beautiful patio if you like sitting outside too.  Everyone here I come into contact with if very nice and friendly. Gary is our main dude though. Their bread and oil/herbs are to die for. So soft and warm. It just melts in your mouth. They might just have the best bread for an Italian food restaurant. Once you are done tearing up your bread your food comes and you are already full from eating so much bread. Their portions are YUGEEEE! I am always taking some to go. I love their. Penne Rosa w/ Sausage is my go to. No mushrooms though. It doesn't need them anyways. It is still crazy flavorful w/o them. I love coming here weekly. My jeans aren't as happy though. If you haven't come here yet you must. You will love it.

BqJIgTgtx2elxg4UGWglIg.text: We went on Super Bowl Sunday so the place was not packed. The three of us sat at the bar so we could watch the game. The atmosphere is typical for a commercial Italian restaurant with pictures of Italy and the old days on the walls. The food is very good (we all had spaghetti), salad (never-ending) and bread come with entrees. Prices are very affordable. The server was friendly and very attentive, he took care of us the entire evening. They also have a punch card to reward frequent diners so we will be back to earn our free lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Super Bowl Sunday at the bar...Ravens are winning!

camGvAovmkMUd_oa3YykSA.text: Having previously worked in the restaurant business, I am appalled by the terrible customer service I received tonight. I called ahead an order and was quoted a 30 minute wait time. No big deal. I got there in 30 minutes on the dot. I paid for my meal and was handed my salad, and then I sat down and waited.  And waited.  And waited.  After having sat there for 15 minutes I put my salad back in the refrigerator on my own accord.  After I had sat there another five minutes, bringing my total time in restaurant at this point to 20 minutes and my time since call in  to 50 minutes, I then asked to speak to the manager.  The manager then went back into the kitchen and checked for a bunch of orders because they were "running behind" due to a "kitchen shortage". That's restaurant speak for we forgot about you.  Magically a whole rush of call in orders appeared for me and my new found friends who are also waiting in misery.  The manager was nice enough to give me a business card for $10 off the future order. That would be all find and dandy, until I got to my car. At this point, I decided to check the order that he just handed me. Wouldn't you know it one of the pasta was literally room temperature. I don't think that it takes 50 minutes to serve me room temperature pasta. I went back inside and told the guy that was completely unacceptable because I did not just spend $40 to have to go home and use my microwave. He asked me if I took it all the way home.  No!  I took it to the parking lot.  No resolution offered just asked me what you want me to do I can have them remake it. At this point it's now been an hour.  An hour!  On what planet do you think that someone would be happy having you just remake their food and waiting and another 30 to 50 minutes?  I told him know that I wanted my money back. He did give me my money back and snatched up my bag of cold food. I told him I wanted it back because I know that they can't reserve it. I told him I need to go home to feed my kids and have no choice but to use the microwave for dinner anyway, so it might as well be on that.   Its not my fault you screwed up. Thanks for ruining my night. Needless to say I will not be choosing your establishment in the future unless next time I get hungry I feel like being given a bunch of grief and runaround.

Gu6tFmFqo8Ys0y8sr1MjVA.text: This is by far the best Italian food I have had in the valley.  They have a nice family style atmosphere and great service.  The prices are reasonable and good sized.  The food is amazing full of flavor and fresh.  I highly recommend them!

RSZvGX45KveXBeoHyb-eeA.text: Even though the Baked Rigatony is nowhere near the quality of anything baked with cheese in New York, this is still a great lunch deal with good food. The rigatony needed a bit more ricotta and mozzarella to be a contender ad there was too much of a watery bottom full of thin sauce underneath the pasta. Maybe it wasn't cooked enough? Still, you get the bread and salad and dish for $8 bucks out the door. Also if you eat 5 meals there, you get one free. Stick to lunch here as the specials cannot be beat.

gX1uYgIWut5ohVBzbNzwdA.text: I've been a fan of Rigatony's for a while. My niece actually insist that we eat at Rigatony's whenever she's on town and it doesn't take any arm twisting!  My personal favorite is the...hang on a second. My favorite meal at Rigatony's goes something like this:  Glass (or two) of the house Chanti (honestly haven't tried the house white, but they also have a good selection of other wines too); I start with an order of steamed clams (in a wine butter garlic sauce) move on to the house Antipasto Salad with their savory warm ciabatta bread, I order the Capellini Pecatore (clams, mussels and shrimp...ok you may want to go with the Veal with lemon and artichoke if you need the red meat) and finish it all off with an espresso and four layer chocolate hazelnut cake!  Fantastic.  Looking for something a little lighter? You can make an excellant light meal out of the appetizers and antipasto.  Love this place!

05NFto7i1N9rWFO7ZxTL4A.text: We love RigaTony's! It's always clean and the staff is always very friendly. The inevitable 30 minute wait on a Friday or Saturday night is worth it. Their fried zucchini is wonderful and we always get the RigaTony pasta, its delicious! Also their Apple Bread Pudding is OUT OF THIS WORLD and if they ever remove if from the menu again my boyfriend vows to picket them. lol That is actually one of the reason's I'm giving them a 5 star. The fact that they listened to their customers who were begging for the Apple Bread Pudding to be put back on the menu shows they actually do care. As long as they keep the apple bread pudding (that my boyfriend would lose a limb for) we'll keep coming back!

yA8zksFG1PdHKwZIDyCo-w.text: Great Italian food at a price that cannot be beat! Early Bird pasta is a real deal if you can sit down for dinner before 5pm. I can honestly say in the 10 years my husband & I have been coming here, we've never had a bad meal and service is always great. We usually order pasta but tried the fish special tonight and my husband said "this was the best meal we've had this year". Grilled Barramundi with orzo - delicately seasoned sea bass with sun dried tomato and spinach orzo, there wasn't a morsel left on either plate :-) Highly recommend. Hardly ever have room for dessert, but the tiramisu is delicious.

X0JEqAjybQDv6IeuoCmm3Q.text: We have been going to Rigatony's for years, since their old location on Knox Avenue. We started going to the new location on Warner Road and every single time we have had a great experience. Food wise and service wise, never disappointed. Our favorite is the salad and bread combo before the meal and the cannolis are so delicious! I am always trying a new dish everytime I go and so far there hasn't been one that I wouldn't order again. Huge thumbs up!

-LsCJvDnvu8Ir5i4YemUNA.text: New to the area, I decided to see what this place was about. Great service, wine, and food. A little pricey compared to other Italian eateries around the area (Picazzos,Oregenos,Babbos)   Portions are big, but wish they had half orders to accommodate people with no so much of an appetite.  I wine tasted 3 different red wines before I decided on one. Very accommodating!   Food was very good! I highly recommend the Lasagne it's big enough for two people so I would suggest splitting it.  Overall I give it 4 stars for a great family owned  restaurant. Next time I will come with a bigger appetite! :)

5FdCWn7SOQVFJlNXEAlUCA.text: My granddaughter 's favorite place - she once ate there twice on the same day!  Today we went for lunch & as always the service was perfect.  Where can you go with a group of 5 big eaters & have delicious food for under $50? Love this place, wish I lived closer!

0zWTvbFRnqvcNZbf1uxSpQ.text: Have been here for lunch and dinner a few times and can say that I am never disappointed.  The lunch specials here are hard to beat at $8-$10! If you're not careful you will fill up on bread and salad and end up taking your meal home....then you have dinner!  The sandwiches are delicious my fav is the raging bull with extra pepperoncinis. Other dishes that have been thoroughly enjoyed are baked rigatony pasta (with broccoli and sausage), veal picatta and chicken marsala. All so good it's hard to name a favorite.

Cg3qszWvzW-cvBrNkwlAWw.text: I cannot believe the terrible service and the manager had a blase attitude. When the food comes they didn't even get the order right. Unfortunately, my family enjoys this place, but not certain if I will be back.  But when you watch 3 tables after you come in and get their food and one leaves, just admit you screwed up and don't ask for patience. We were patient.

_HIGSvIgFuYXLk7bnqzNLg.text: Reminds me alot of Cucina Tagliani (a small chain of Italian restaurants in the west valley).  Went here for a friend's birthday.  The bottom-line:  If you go home hungry, its your fault.  They'll do their best to fill you up on bread and salad, but save room cause dinners are huge.  I got the deep dish lasagna with marinara.  Tasty stuff.  There was enough of us that we shared the entire dessert menu.  None of the desserts really stuck out to me.  They were good, though not out of this world.  Servers were friendly and gave us a laundry list of specials to choose from that night.  Very family friendly place as there were kids everywhere the night we went.  Overall, a good decent neighborhood Italian spot with reasonable prices.  Won't knock your socks off, but gets the job done and there's a better than 50/50 chance you'll need a box for your leftovers at the end of your meal.

RT2lY5Mtw9kCbhY4a2NfXQ.text: I was so happy with this place when I went with friends for lunch last week.  The service was outstanding.  The price for the lunch specials is amazing.  The baked rigatony with broccolli was so delicious.  Was excited by the pick a pasta early bird dinner specials also.  And kids eat free on Monday.  Combine those two deals and it would be cheaper than eating at home.  Can't wait to go back!!

J6X8K2oB4PTnQ6m-WDsKuA.text: Rigatoni's has not been in business for 21 years for no reason. Love their house salad and dressing, much better than any upscale Italian restaurant in the valley. To Danya who said that they did not have salad options or gluten free items on the menu - they actually have both and have had for a number of years. You may substitute broccoli or quinoa for regular pasta - this is clearly stated on the menu. Both of these are quite tasty in the various dishes. Love the weekly fish and cannoli specials - their blackberry cannoli was to die for. Service is always good. They are busy so if you don't want to wait make reservations.

QCdYaUrQ3kwfjvat29J03w.text: Love this place!! Probably my favorite Italian place that I have ever been to. Great food, great servers, and great environment.

Dir-iW4MS8T1hmuFiTuPkg.text: Service was nice and helpful. Food was outstanding. I usually can't stand Italian food as much of the places seem to take frozen foods, throw it in a pan and serve it. This place was a fantastic treat to Italian food. The greatest place I have been in a very long time.

adROXoqh9ze8-L-HUootlg.text: Absolutely the BEST Italian Food!  Our family has been going to RigaTony's since they opened the original location in '94. We've celebrated many Birthday's, Mother's Days and other special occasions here. Our whole family loves the food, the atmosphere, and because the portions are huge - leftovers the next day!  The antipasto salad is always fresh with just the right amount of dressing and the crusty ciabata bread a perfect compliment. Everything is homemade and authentic - my favorite is the cheese ravioli with meat sauce. My teenage kids love the pizza and the shrimp scampi.   The service is usually very good, but they can be busy - even on week nights. I would definitely recommend making reservations if possible. I give RigaTony's extra credit for serving dinner till 10 PM - I often work late and most restaurants in the area quit serving at 8:30-9:00. Nice to know there's a comfortable, relaxing place to unwind after a long day.  Pricing is very reasonable for the quality and portions. Highly Recommend!

5RIkBNoeHedzylBtEfVBew.text: Stopped in on Sunday with Family.  After a wait we were seated and service was very good.  The Salad was really good and was plenty.  Had the Lunch entrees and the were a good size.  Will definitely come back and try other dishes I saw on the table next to ours.   Wanted to try the tiramisu but they were out.  Cannoli was delicious tho.

KYqdxBdBNU7INYwEM4XlaQ.text: Best intimate place with amazing servers and food

DcGK2O3aBwWSzdJmEF1Eaw.text: For 20 years, the best Italian in Chandler.  Always a good experience and good service.  The best salad in town too.  Order anything, it will be memorable.   Usually a wait as everyone in town knows about this place and it's become a religion.

OwFt6I9H3dGXKTz1eZRC9Q.text: One of my fave restaurants! The unlimited salad is a winner. It's delicious! They also have a gluten-free selection that my brother loves!   For Christmas, they also have some gift card deals.

1ybVwtD9s16k5Zkbf-uiVQ.text: If my tongue could do a happy dance, it would totally do it for the food at Rigatony's! Everything from the salad, to the bread, to the appetizers, to the main dishes, it all was fantastic! I had the zucchini for an appetizer, these were delicious, nice and crispy and the batter actually had seasoning so it was quite tasty. For my main dish I split the chicken parmesan and the chicken fettuccini alfredo with my friend. Both dishes were great! Each one cooked to perfection, with very tasty seasoned sauces and nice juicy chicken! The portions at this restaurant are huge, definitely enough to take home for later! I cant wait to go back and try a few other dishes! I had to flip a coin to decide what I wanted to eat this night because I wanted to try so many different things. The only reason this didn't get a 5 star was because the wait time. Waiting to eat here is a little ridiculous. We had a reservation for 7:15 and didn't end up getting seated until 7:45 because we had a party of 9. To me that is not a huge party, but a decent size. To have to wait an extra 30 minutes for a table to eat is no fun. Especially when you have a very active and very hungry 3 year old with you. I am hoping the next time we go without reservations, the wait time isn't as long. Other than that, the staff was very friendly, our waitress was very nice and quick, great decor and kind of a "homey" vibe, great place to try!!! Good for a date, night out with friends or a family time meal!!

uFghIJFLWrVMaCa21AB5Pw.text: Being in an Italian family from New Jersey, I can be pretty picky when it comes to Italian food, but I really enjoy Rigatony's. My husband and I, along with some of our family members, have visited Rigatony's on a few occasions, and we've been pleased overall. My favorite dish is the rigatoni with meatballs, although I really haven't had a bad dish yet! The antipasto salad and bread that you receive before your meal are delicious as well. My only complaint is that I'm not a huge fan of their cannolis. And, because the restaurant is pretty busy, they are trying to turn tables fairly quickly, which means the food actually often comes out faster than I would like.

n4cp_-59ADDvKsf_uk8NUA.text: If you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover, you shouldn't judge a restaurant by it's name.  We've passed this place a hundred times thinking it couldn't be very good with such a sophomoric name...but we were SO wrong.  We finally lunched there last week and were VERY impressed!  We had a meatball hero and a sausage hero, both of which were very tasty and just the right size for lunch...especially since they came with personal-size antipasto salads and wonderfully warm bread.  We will definitely go back for dinner and put Rigatony's in our regular rotation for really good Italian food.

IpvjKz6hswm7uwWDqi3Ejg.text: This place is fantastic! The food is a-mazing and service has never let me down! I've been frequenting this spot for more than 10 years and could never say anything bad. We come for special occasions, when family flys in or just a Friday night!

cZkci1U7idSalPdGHzSKwA.text: Let me start off by saying that I am a native New Yorker, grew up in Little Italy and favorite food group was and is Italian. So my husband was told about Rigatonys On 2/28/ 2016 we drove 45 min. because he was told that this was an excellent Restaurant. well upon our arrival we observed that the atmosphere had a pleasant smell, people appeared to be friendly. as we were being seated we noticed a dirty plate on our table, the person seating us removed the plate and apologized then I ordered a water with lemon and my husband odered a sprite with lemon. When the Server Kimberly returned to the table she asked my husband if he wanted a refill of sprite, he responded yes and in return she brought him back a water, we had to get a different server to get us the sprite. We then ordered the Calamari as an appetizer, which was good,to thick, Then I ordered my Entree which was shrimp and chicken pasta topped with spinach. The preparation of the meal was not inviting at all and not flavored to please tasted as if everything ran together. I then ordered another dish which had the same flavor different items on the plate. We then ordered our deserets, my husband ordered the apple bread pudding of which they only seved the corner of, and I ordered the cannoli's in which were very smaller than  the ones to order when eating in. When I brought this to Kimberlys attention, she stated that they don't discriminate on the size of cannoli's, when I asked another waitress about the size, he stated that they make them all different sizes and agreed that ones this waitress (Kimberly)served us where alot smaller than the ones I previously seen her bring out to another table. I then became irritated and stated that this was a lesson well learned. although we didn't pay for my portion onf the meal( I threw it awasy as soon as we left the restaurant). My husband still let a 15 dollar tip for poor service, cheap tasting poor food. very disappointed, and sicking to classify this food with Italian food. NEVER will I return to this restuarent nor any other restaurant associated with this name. Bad business once again the waitress has a very bad attitude .  one star for the smell. presentation was not good at all!

PsQS-mNgJAA-EKnJAS17uQ.text: It's okay.  I wouldn't get the alfredo, it used to taste better--I had it last night and it tasted like jarred sauce.  The salad and bread are good, though.

4s08Sz_X_8tp_sBjnGnW9Q.text: Let me start by saying I am not a big fan of Italian food, but I generally enjoy the bread, salad and wine. However, this place has kindled a love for Italian deep within. I have been here twice and enjoyed both the Chicken Marsala and the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken. I am not a fan of chain restaurants with all the hustle and bustle and bland food but this small, feel like dinner with family, restaurant is definitely a keeper and I will return over and over again.

O1neq_Tyxn-Av-tpALRuKQ.text: We came in this evening with our family from out of town. We had stuffed manicotti, lasagne and veal. The food was amazing. Mathew was our server and he was on top of everything. The service was perfect. Cant wait until our next visit.

-ozST6XuIqpHBAf5y9YnQg.text: On my second trip here we actually made it to a table, be sure to go in a bit later as the 4-5pm special brings in bus loads of slow eating seniors who clear out by 6:45.   It was a bit tight getting to our table the layout is not the best.  After reviewing the menu we decided to start with the fried zucchini. It came before our bread and salad.  It was decent the breading had good flavor, and I liked the thinner pieces.  Our Salad and bread came. and just a note to the veggies out there, remember to ask for your salad salami free, as it usually includes salami. The Salad was decent bit heavy with the creamy Italian dressing and cheese but good.  For my main dish I went with the salmon pene. The salmon it self seemed to be of a lower quality, it was pre cut to little chunks and a bit over cooked,  the sauce was under the pasta making it messy to toss on the elliptical plate.  The person I was with got the stuffed shells, the ricotta was a bit too creamy for our tastes.   It was a decent filling meal, at a decent price but the quality is not the highest.

nLX33Xj6aHbGO51JluCzFA.text: We went here for the first time on a Sunday after Valentine's Day and waited an hour to be seated. There were many people coming and going. Many chose to go somewhere else because of the wait. Once we got in we were served quickly by Frankie who was highly recommended by an exiting patron. She was very friendly, courteous, and helped answer any questions we may have had. She did not tell us the daily special however, which I would have ordered had I'd known about. We started off with a salad, which was delicious and had a twist. They top their salads with sliced salami. I got calamari for myself and ordered chicken marsala, while my fiance ordered chicken parmesan. I was disappointed with the calamari after the salad. It was pretty typical deep fried and unimpressive. The chicken marsala was very underwhelming as well. It very average, as far as chicken marsalas, go. My fiance enjoyed her chicken parmesan, but admittedly has nothing to compare it to. I wouldn't say my experience was bad, but after the wait the great salad and then fizzling out after that, I would say this place is average at best. I would like to try it again with hopes that this review is wrong, but only the future knows.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Marsala
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Calamari

frKV2CPrwoZbwQSj0AsDxg.text: Prompt,  polite service.  Great portions.  The salad and bread alone were stellar. Nice ambiance.  Very old world style.  Reasonable prices.  Originally we came here because we were trying to find something close to Ikea. Great chicken parmigan!

w57JM4nMk_sacp94Br3Kyw.text: Place was very nice, I had the tour of Rigatonys and the let me modify it with traditional gravy and chicken Parmesan. Tell you what!! That Sicilian sauce was just fantastic, don't get discouraged by the anchovies on the description, they just use them for flavor and there's no fish in the sauce but anyways it was just something different with the spice salty sweet taste that was just mouthwatering, everything I order will be sicilianized extra hot from now on... We will be back , my wife didn't like her penne but she's pregnant so she changed it for fettuccini Alfredo which was good but to late for her....my kids loved it as well..

KqWDQQC6X5glk5q4E5guqA.text: There is always a line out the door, so couldn't wait to finally try this place. Our server was top notch, he was quick with the beverages and packed up the leftovers at the table. The simple antipasto salad and bread are delicious, I loved the soft bread and dipping oil and let's just say I had my share of carbs this meal. The obviously homemade lasagna had a rich meat sauce but was a little dry and I should have asked for some extra marinara sauce.  Will return.

mPRh7TYalAcRA2rdQ4KilA.text: We have lived in Gilbert, AZ for 4 years and tonight was our first time dinning here... We have been missing out.  It was packed when we arrived tonight with a wait time of 45-60 minutes.  We were able to grab a table in the bar luckily within 5 minutes.  Even being packed the service was spot on.  The antipasta salad and ciabatta bread to start was delicious.  My husband and son started off with 1 lbs of steamed clams and the flavor was perfect.  My husband and I both had the spaghetti deluxe and it was steaming hot, really authentic and fresh - it defiantly exceeded our expectations and was as good if not better then our favorite pasta spots.  Our teenage son had the fettuccini and I think he could have licked the bowl.  We were pleasantly full so did not look at the dessert menu but will defiantly be back.  Great service by Melissa!

NT0JE0d_dngyN4fH2gJTag.text: Amazing family owned Italian restaurant.  I always take out of town guests here and they love it.  The new building in great but it still gets busy on the weekends.  I recommend making a reservation if you don't want to wait. The Chicken Piccata is probably my favorite dish.  Crispy chicken with a yummy sauce and it comes with a side of pasta.  I usually ask for angel hair with tomato cream sauce. My only complaint is when I ordered chicken on one of my pasta dishes once it was very over cooked.  They apologized and removed the chicken charge from my bill.  They offered to make me a whole new dish if I wanted.  Very accommodating.

h4gP3qeeC_m54E54TsCm8w.text: I said in my previous review that I would come back and get a sandwich, but alter it a little bit. So, I did. I visited at dinner hours this time though, and I did not see any sandwiches on the dinner menu. Bummer? No, our server was able to get me a sandwich at dinner time, and she also got them to make it custom for me too! I got a half meatball / half sausage sandwich. Badabing! That sandwich was amazing! You must try one. The bread they use...I wish every sandwich everywhere used that bread. Mmm!  Also sampled some more items from my dining companions' choices: Eggplant Parmesan = delicious!  Sausage Rigatoni = also very tasty!  This was my second visit to Riga Tony's and I still like it...maybe even more. I still cannot give it 5 stars though because the salad they serve before the meal is sub-par, and the wine we ordered was also pretty bad. Not sure if they actually have a sommelier, but the swill we had to force down was extremely insulting to my taste buds. I'd be happy to send this place some recommendations for tasty, affordable wines if they like; but I don't plan on ordering wine there again.

0NlPV3QGJ7-Iu88813JriA.text: NO LONGER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE! Won't be going back and you shouldn't either!!!   If I can give 0 stars I would! My family and I always go to Rigatonys for the past 6 years since before they moved BUT today marks the last time! Don't bother going! All I have to say is they are very rude. They don't care about their patron like they use to. Service has lowered as well. I'm extremely disappointed.    Save your money, don't spend it here.

JVU2uBQMEfvGBUn4Cz6cDw.text: Maybe I'm becoming a softy with my recent ratings.  I don't know...but the Phoenix Valley is a foodie paradise, that much cannot be argued.  So I find myself having a hard time figuring out why I shouldn't give this place 5 stars.  The few complaints others had, I did not experience.  I went in here on a Monday night.  Service: The moment I walked in, 2 attentive ladies (one the official greeter), they were willing to seat me right away at a table, I opted for the bar.  They were friendly and nice.    Kevin I believe was the name of the bartender.  He not only tended bar but took orders for the bar and the whole area out there.  I point this out because even despite that, he was on top of everything, I did not wait any amount of time for anything, and he was friendly and informative.  Asking questions about the menu, he was versed in it and helped me decide even on the sauce to top the lasagna I ordered.  I opted for the sweeter marinara instead of the beef sauce...and oh my was that a good recommendation.  So...that brings us to the food:  I got the lasagna with the sweet marinara sauce.  It all complemented each other perfectly and tasted excellent.  I just finished off the other half I brought home...and like any good lasagna...tasted just as good on reheat as when fresh.  The fresh bread they serve with the meal too...very good.  The drinks...he was on top of it and they too were good.    So again....maybe I'm getting soft....but I can't find any reason whatsoever to dock this place anything.  I enjoyed every interaction I had with their staff...heck...I'd almost go as far as to say I felt welcome there as if I'd walked into someone's home.  The barkeep was on top of the service.  ...and the food was great.  So...5 stars it is.

7SevJeE57dF0NBY_Vbip3w.text: I love this place.  They have great food and the service is always good too.  I absolutely and obsessed with their salad, and even have to order it for take-out when having people over to my house.  Their eggplant bruschetta is to die for as well.  Italian food is really not one of my favorites, but for many of my family members, it is, so we always go out of our way and to to Rigatony's.

QPWk_mAwVVLuTzocnyYdRA.text: Delicious food, generous portions, and great service! You can also pay a sharing fee and get unlimited fresh bread and salad.

imbChUNO_gMPnEajUxfFyg.text: We dined at Rigatony's last Saturday night. We were seated in a booth against the wall, and were frozen out by the air conditioner. We asked to move, but we were told there are no other tables, despite seeing several dirty ones. OK. Looking over the menu, the selections seemed promising. After several minutes, our server acknowledged us and said he'd be right back for our drink orders. Several minutes later he returned, and another several more to get our drinks. This continued thru the evening. Long waits between salad, bread and entres. For dimner, I requested my chicken parm with light sauce. When it was brought out, I couldn't see the food there was so much sauce poured on it. The server said he would get another order of the side pasta, if I wanted, nothing about the drowned chicken. 15 minutes later someone passed by the table (I say passed because she didn't even slow down) and dropped down a dish of plain pasta, no sauce this time. The chicken parm appeared to have been deep fried and cold in the center. Not really edible. We next saw our server with the check.To conclude, our server all but ignored us, and didn't listen when taking our orders. The food was near to inedible. Not worth the time or money. This place needs a lot of improvement.

Sis6CGZqUtspErfLj9W9EQ.text: Fabulous! We ordered take-out last night for dinner, which was our first time ever trying Rigatony's. We had the lasagna, cheese ravioli's and the lemon-artichoke-caper chicken with the fettucine alfredo. The meals were so flavorful, everyone ate every last bite! The entrees even came with a delicious side salad and warm fresh bread. It was so awesome not to see grease seeping from the containers (as with other places we've tried). Service was fast and friendly, and our order was already packaged ready to go upon arrival, just like they promised. We have definitely found our new spot every-time we are craving authentic Italian food. Hands down the best place I've tried on the Tempe/Chandler border.

4Ouq_TJteX0XXDJLqdcBgA.text: Decided to try out RigaTony's for the first time and ordered take out. Probably one of the best Italian food I've had!! Their fried raviolis are amazing and definitely recommend.

zJ_gSdUbR4YdJoAFzMgQSQ.text: This place is overrated. The salad was really good I will say, but the bread was dry and cold. I ordered the pesto cream pasta and my noodles were over cooked and mushy. The creamy red sauce was pretty good, but kinda too sweet for my taste. We decided to try out some desserts as well. The chocolate hazelnut cake was dry and did not have a good flavor, almost tasted like it was frozen. The pistachio cannoli wasn't great either, the cream was a bit gritty and the only part that was pistachio was a few nuts on the outside. Not impressed.

JSTAvHuYJ1zkxNDOZIc4TA.text: Ordered pickup for lunch. Pescatore cappelli, wow it was soooo good so much flavor lots of garlic. Just how I like it. Very good value too. Pasta 2 side salads, side of bread and a pizza for $24!  The service was good, fast and friendly

pzFdARexspz6U5zCS83TUQ.text: I love this place.  I've been here several times and if I lived closer, I would eat here all the time.  I usually order the clam pie which is the best I've ever had.  Last night I opted for the Seafood Checco and I'm glad I did.  It was awesome.  The scallops and shrimp were cooked perfectly which is not as easy as it seems, especially for scallops.  My husband had the meat lasagna and he ate the whole thing (it was huge).  He can be picky but he was very happy with it.  We had a couple of vegetarians with us and our server, Tatum, graciously prepared the salad without meat for them.  And of course that salad.  I would come back just for that.  I really wish I lived closer!

FR6eXufGL0esBmqzBCWgiQ.text: I have driven by this place on countless occasions .... one thing I always noticed ... the parking area was full ... today ... my lady and I tried the fare ... We were completely impressed! If you like True Italian food ... generous portions and affordable prices in a genuinely original atmosphere ... this place is for you!

K_52dq4c7Rvvsxbnm_anHQ.text: I met here with some friends for dinner, the place was very busy but the service was still outstanding. We really enjoyed all the homemade items on your menu. For instance the ravioli was amazing. Can't wait to re-visit. Thank you for all you do.

7mys9vpm9fYMd4uauuH-XA.text: We have been going here for years and over the last 6 months the food has changed for the worse. Food comes out dry for pasta and chicken dishes, like it was cooked yesterday or has sat around waiting to be picked up. Bread is always good. Salads are good and generous, but the dressing has changed. It is more watery. Sandwiches lack flavor  (Raging Bull) and dipping juice off flavor. Service is generally very good, depending on whom you get. Only go here monthly, instead of weekly.

iEcKa8VccIHIjJmCYHtrpg.text: Food here was great and came out quick. The unlimited salads and bread was a nice and unexpected touch. The portion sizes were massive and you get your money's worth. I also tried the Italian soda and they were good, I just which they were larger for the price. Overall I would definitely come back here again and would recommend this place to others.

3nk1osyZbqBC7IMoVx1vMg.text: Eh. Only my second visit and it was pretty good. This time I got take out. Upon arriving.... the staff was all smiles and gave a warm and inviting impression.  I ate only half my meal the first night because I wasn't like..... gobbling it down as it was only pretty good. I will say that the very very little scoop of real mashed potatoes with my Marsala was very good. Very little scoop.  The next day I finished my meal of chicken Marsala, and fettuccine Alfredo. I would guess the chicken weighed no more than 6oz that came in two pieces. I added more Marsala wine the second day because I couldn't even taste it originally. The Alfredo, I had to add more cheese and seasoning as it was devoid of flavor. I tasted the cannoli dessert and found it gritty.... granulated sugar? And not powdered in ricotta? Idk. I threw out the other one and 8/10 of the one  I tasted.  Now... I got 1 chicken Marsala, 1 fettuccine Alfredo and 1 order cannoli and it was $40.27? Or close to that. Does that seem right? Idk. I love their lasagna but I can get that good at several places. There is nothing that stands out here except the excellent greeting I got when I walked in which is why I gave 3 instead of just 2 stars. But hey.... they are always packed. So.... judge for yourself. This is a good place to try. Get the Lasagna.

C_YZWjtmFCFnGrxaRKtgHA.text: Rigatony's usually has great food! Tonight we met up with a group of people and my son and I ordered the fettuccine alfredo for our entrees. There was sooo much sauce that we barely even ate any of it! I haven't eaten here in a while, but I don't ever remember there being so much sauce on the pasta. There was a significant amount on top, so I thought it wasn't too bad until I stirred the noodles together and saw the amount of sauce that was already mixed in! Gross and such a disappointment! "Can I have a side of noodles with my sauce" was my thought...The antipasto salad was amazing and the service was great. I never send food back at a restaurant so I'll just suck this one up and order the baked rigatoni next time!

4plb4VRa2vBFQEvuRfmYZw.text: This place always hits the spot!  Best salad around, not to mention the baked rigatoni with sausage or meatball. Lunch specials are amazing. Love coming here!

stcds2RhJKvQ47092DEHTA.text: Went down in quality a lot, I don't recommend this place like I used to. If you go for a special then it isn't too expensive, but find a place that makes homemade pasta if you want a real Italian dinner!

u5Q4yYAXK1dXqslM4Gz_Uw.text: I giving this restaurant 3 stars ; food is always amazing , especially their complimentary bread and dinner salad , best calamari appetizer I have ever had: thick and meaty with just a right amount of breading. Service on the other hand is hit or miss , especially if you sit at the tables at the bar good luck finding anyone to serve you, last Saturday we sat their for over 20 min till we got greeted and it's not like multiple people passed us and saw us looking around.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

eqczNAxbCEZvcxGaDdumdQ.text: I've never had such great hospitality since I came here. Our server was kind and very enthusiastic. The food was great my "Deep Dish Lasagna" was amazing. My friends "Baked Rigatoni" looked very tempting especially the presentation of the mixed Alfredo & Marinara. The antipasto salad was just right and tossed by our lovely server table side.!!

rgzTwb7wXj-FabnsLyKAHQ.text: An Average Italian restaurant with nothing special to surprise a food enthusiast. Likes of olive garden, red lobster, etc but not a chain which is an advantage.

opswe_RVDD0Ca9nFWwLdYw.text: My favorite restaurant.  Ordered a large party pickup and catering two weeks ago and it was never a disappoint!  Of course, my company liked the food!

PrxzcoPVs4uRRLVUpyVnog.text: I had a pretty bad experience here. Used to come here growing up so sad to have a bad experience after coming back vegan. We came for a family meal for my brother's birthday. One server was really nice and when I asked if the bread had egg or milk he brought me out separate bread and a separate salad without cheese. This was great and I really appreciated how thoughtful the server was. The rest of my experience did not go like this. When I order my main meal I had a different server who got really irritated that I had restrictions and was vegan. He kept offering me gluten free and when I asked about the pizza dough he didn't get back to me. He never got back to me on if my order had dairy or egg and stopped coming by our table. When he brought out my order and I asked again if it had dairy or eggs in it. He asked and it turned out there was dairy in it. He offered to see if I wanted something else but at this point the server was being pretty passive aggressive and clearly didn't want to interact with me so I didn't feel comfortable ordering something else. I stuck with my bread and salad and picked up food on my way home. The rest of the group enjoyed their meal, this just isn't a good place to come if you're vegan. I've never had a problem with other Italian restaurants and usually find something to eat. Was not happy with the service, will not be coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

aGV5_kbPfo8ZwZRLSDPwLg.text: Food is ahhmazing. I was in the mood for Italian for my bday dinner and this place did not disappoint. The food was authentically Italian. I had the lasagna and it was hearty and delish. For dessert I had the apple bread pudding and it was so good. I have literally zero complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Early bird specials

LXgFueVd13-1i2t4lYOYDA.text: This place is awful. Full of unhappy or incompetent employees. I was here on Sunday at 4pm and was put on the list and told it would be 20 minutes. After 30 minutes I looked at the list and everyone plus the 4 other groups on the list after me had been seated ahead of my party of two!  Moral of the story, don't go here for a date of if you want to be seated. I went over to Olive Garden instead nearby and got right in, had friendly service, and ate their all you can eat soup and salad, delicious. I will never go to rigatonys again. Even Oreganos is better.   I think the only qualification to work here is be an ASU liberal arts majors.

EBAP4JbjrEPsZ8d_C67pcw.text: Not much to say. Bad food, below average service mixed with overpriced menu, equals, not going back any time soon!

uFVYSJtUwJT8OnypbNVtdQ.text: Been here twice and its been good. The first time 5 stars, but I had to knock it down one after the last visit. Waitress...not so good. She wasn't paying attention while we  were ordering and rang me in the wrong food. Very disappointing as I was really looking forward to my dish. She never stopped back to check on us so I didn't get a chance to fix it with her...:( She was very serious looking. Never smiling. I was almost too scared to tell her she made a mistake! Everything else was perfect. My family loves the bread, the salad and the food. Better than Olive Garden or any other Italian place we have been too.

feEAyGZrqL65y1CvwMqsCg.text: My family and I have been going to Rigatony's for 7+ years now. The food is SPECTACULAR and the service is AWESOME. I can honestly say that we have NEVER had a bad experience . I take all of my out of town guests here and have had them cater a graduation. The Dobson JV football team enjoyed their pre-game meal catered from Rigatony's so much that parents were hunting me down to see where the restraunt was located so they could take their own families !! TIP: use the diner cards, they are worth it EXTRA TIP: Ask for Frankie. While all of the servers are good, she is AWESOME.

AvO-fRLdRhUX5gCeclLdbg.text: My husband and I were having a few rough days and we paused to grab dinner at RigaTony's. When the hostess asked how we were, I figured I better give her fair warning and I let her know we were crabby. She was immediately concerned and expressed her hope that dining at RigaTony's would remedy that situation. We told her to assign us to some wait staff she didn't like and she laughed and gave us to the gal who was standing at the hostess desk with her (FJ). We apologized that we got dumped on her and despite our insistence that we were crabby, she stated she thought we were going to be a fun table. We had only eaten at RigaTony's one other time, so I don't know if it's normal for them to bring samples of wine, but when our waitress brought us samples, the story I told myself is that she was doing it to try to help our mood. When we declined, without specifically mentioning we were recovering alcoholics, she merely dropped it and did not try to push it on us. She was pleasant and attentive throughout our meal and did not avoid us as a self-centered individual might with a couple that flat-out declared themselves cranky. In fact, she even brought us a dessert on the house. We could not believe it. Now, despite the fact that my husband was too stuffed to fully enjoy the dessert and that I don't eat desserts, we still really appreciated the thought and the whole experience improved our moods substantially. Now, I think the food was also delicious, but this trip, I was much more focused on the stellar service we were given on a night that we desperately needed it and certainly didn't deserve it.

AZbN3Ye50fOttSy4awbXfQ.text: Two nights ago, I went to dinner at Rigatony's, an elegant Italian restaurant in Tempe. When I first arrived, I could not tell whether I liked the look of the building or not. It didn't look very "cultural", but as I went inside and started looking around I noticed it; I noticed all the beautiful Italian paintings and the plethora of family oriented pictures on the walls. It was all so inviting and uplifting. My party and I were then seated at a private dining room, secluded from the rest of the restaurant. We were waited on by a couple of servers throughout the night.  They were all very nice and attentive.   The service was on point and that really made the night more enjoyable. The first thing that was brought out was bread. Now, you are probably reading this thinking how simple; little do you all know that this bread was hands down the best bread I have ever had!
