The seasoning on top of the bread was so delicious and the bread itself had a great density to it. To be honest, I ate like 4 pieces of bread. The salad was the next item to come. Now, I didn't actually eat any salad, but my friends did and they all said, "It was yummy!"  Hopefully, you can take their word for it.   Lastly, our five different dishes came out.  All of the plates were steaming hot; filling the room with the aroma of Italy, instantaneously.  I myself ordered the seafood fettuccini.   I didn't really know if I would like it that much when I placed my order, but boy was I wrong. This pasta was so sensational, that every bite I took, I smiled with glee. The temperature was great, the noodles were well cooked, and the fish was prepared phenomenally. I would recommend this dish to any of my friends, family, or acquaintances. Upon entering the restaurant, I was not immediately convinced that Rigatony's would be the cultural experience I was looking for, but it ended up being a culturally diverse restaurant, that everyone enjoyed.  I will be going there again soon, and so should you.

SAwBdJ2em9_4V0y8BGp64g.text: The hubbie's sister and her husband were in town and wanted to try RigaTony's since they have a friend who is a Snowbird and likes the place.  We had not eaten there in a while.    We've been eating at Olive Garden a lot, mostly because I get $25 gift cards thru work. Having gone to RigaTony's, it will definitely be the go to place when we are dining solely on our dime and want a nice dinner and salad. It is well worth the slightly higher cost per menu item.  I got the chicken with lemon and artichoke...yum.  I love their house salad.  One of my bunco buddies always gets that salad when it's her turn to host.  Hubbie liked the bread (and the salad).  The hubbie got the lasagna and enjoyed it...until later in the evening when he had some major acid reflux.  Getting older sucks.   Stubborn cuss won't try my crystalized ginger remedy...I haven't had a Tums in a looooonnnnng time.  We topped the evening off w/ a trip to Angel Sweet.  Yum.

57g0k3a2YpmS0A3TX977DQ.text: Had their 3pm - 5pm $7.50 lunch special which was very very good. The antipasto salad was absolutely delicious and worth the price of the meal all by itself.  I had the rigatoni with meat sauce and a meatball which was very good. Large portion and plenty of sauce, which I like. The cibata bread was ok.  Would prefer garlic bread, but I am not complaining. For the price, it was hands down a great deal. Oh, and the service was prompt and our server was very friendly. I will make this a regular stop whenever I am in Phoenix.

ZDY4UtOgeELqMJf5zTMhwg.text: Has it really been a year?  Well, back again for our carbo loading pre half marathon dinner!    Our reservation was at 5:15pm and we were seated right away.  This time, I knew there was salami in the salad so I asked for a small one without.  It didn't seem to be a problem and I got a pretty big bowl.  Another table over there were a couple of vegetarians too, and they asked as well.  I guess I'm selfish in that I'd like the salad with no salami.    I went with the spaghetti marinara, boring I know, and thought the sauce was too sweet.  I like a more spicy sauce.  Everyone else seemed happy with their meals though.  Service was slow.  And our poor waitress seemed overworked.  She was literally hustling around, and it didn't help that she forgot a few things.    They're moving to a new location, and I'll probably be there at least once to check it out.  For carb loading next year, we'll head somewhere else.

dXhIdtHmPjrdcR6Pk_e8BA.text: We love the food here.  Service is also always good.  The place is always busy, so you would be wise to call ahead if you don't like waiting.  Our favorite, family friendly, Italian restaurant.  The salad and bread are really good.  The entrees have generous portions and are really delicious.  There is a kids menu as well.  The whole restaurant is moving to McClintock and Warner in March and they said that the new building will have more parking, outdoor seating, and more space.  They promised not to change the food.  The new location will be a little farther for us, but that won't keep us from going.

NhB1ysx96gm_1zwltzwq-A.text: Great Italian. I have only eaten once at the restaurant, but have used a dozen times for special events. They have a great catering menu. Order some large portions and you have a quick way to cover a party. The chicken parm is a favorite along with all their salads. Warner and McClintock area, check it out.

NDrOxLJN489_SXvwtJ5CCw.text: My fav Italian place in the Valley.  They make the most amazing red sauce....the white sauce is amazing too.  I LOVE the salad that is with the meal.  Lots of food for the money.  The staff is great, the place is clean.   A MUST try in the Valley!!!!

FzxeEN8dst5sF2FR2gIJbg.text: Worst meal I've had in a long time and the service wasn't much better. Food was super bland but greasy and our waitress had horrible timing and acted like she had better this to do then wait on us.

ORUrQF3HOpPnyoYQMwuzmg.text: I love RigaTony's shrimp scampi.  It is my absolute favorite dish.  However, I always listen to the specials of the day, because they have usually been excellent when they've caught my fancy.  I rarely have an unpleasant experience at RigaTony's.  I'm always delighted by the salad and bread, have sampled a variety of their appetizers, and I find their spumoni delicious!

ggm7pikgsd5fBeloMA2lTg.text: italian food at its best. and the complementary antipasta salad and bread earns this place 7 stars in my mind.

JGk0ntp_l3oZqzN7_pzDrg.text: A long time ago, Rigatony's was a Golden Corral. Thankfully Golden Corral went out of business and Rigatony's moved in.  I'm hitting broken record level here, but the oft-repeated "Olive Garden but better" is pretty accurate. Good Italian-American fare with a large, varied menu. Special requests don't scare them, the service is great, and the food is tasty and hot whether you're dining in or taking out. A lot of places just dump your food into containers; Rigatony's packages everything carefully so it stays its best and an appropriate temperature. (And they fill your salads so full the takeout boxes hardly close.)  The salad is damn near the best salad ever, and if you don't save room for dessert you're really missing out.   BEWARE THE PARKING. Rigatony's is packed just about every night for dinner and packed to the gills on weekends. If you're driving a large vehicle (or just aren't comfortable in cramped lots), consider parking on the street. It's a decent neighborhood, and there's enough activity I don't think I've ever heard of anyone getting broken into.

vxI-s71jbJFb2BA3ISiY3g.text: First - this is not a chain restaurant. Check out their website and you will learn that this is a locally owned business that has been in the valley for years. They used to be located in Chandler but moved to Tempe not too long ago. I have to say I'm pretty shocked by the negative reviews because this place is so good and the line out the door and typical 45 minute wait on weekend nights pretty much sum it up. And I don't think it's because we are "fools" who like "garbage?" Ouch.  Antipasto salad is offered before your meal - and it is yummy! They also offer you a shot of wine which is a practice I'm glad they have continued over the years. The baked Rigatony is like crack - it will melt in your mouth and is a must have. The tomato cream sauce is also to die for. Be sure to get there early or call ahead if you try this place on a weekend night, the place does get busy! My husband and I just ate their Monday night and we did not have a wait, but every table was full.

mVKgLJZ7t3a-iWNdAGd3hA.text: New location! same great service and tasty food. I got the cannelloni again and no regrets. I wish they had more pasta options, like cappelletti or other salsas like boscaiola!. Still, the antipasto is a winner!!

dckxLW6M_APpF9DgSnfvjQ.text: RigaTony's has become a staple restaurant in our family.  Italian is synonymous with RigaTony's here.    When we have guests from out of town (and I grew up in an Italian communitty so all of my relatives are darn picky about their Tally food) EVERYONE requests that we go to that "great Italian place" with the great food.  We have local family that will drive down to the East Valley from Anthem, just to join us for dinner at Riga Tony's.    I cannot think of one thing that I or my family has eaten here that was not superb.  We have had Chicken Marsala (which I won't eat anywhere else), spaghetti and meat sauce/meatballs, Alfredo, Stuffed Shells, Lasagne, and their famous Baked Rigatony.    As a note, to anyone going for the first time...order the fried ravioli, if your cholesterol can handle it.  It is AMAZING!!!    Additionally, service at RigaTony's has always been top tier, in my book.  Even our most picky guests delight in the level of service we get there.    This food is clearly not commercial and the restaurant has a somewhat simple spin on family Italian. Their pasta is always perfection and the sauces are consistently terrific.

w6FhiUEmYYdLxshMDvPFOQ.text: I have been eating here for 10 years. I don't live in the Phoenix area. But whenever I am in town, I try to make it a point to eat here. In the past week I have made it here twice. ALWAYS, consistently good (if not great). I always order the fried ravioli appetizer,  either as my meal or as tonight, as an app, since the special sounded to good to pass up. The special was linquine with shrimp, scallops, mushrooms and spinach with a vodka cream sauce. It was outstanding. I judge an Italian restaurant by the bread. Rigatony's sets the standard. I have never had better. (That is why I say Olive Garden sucks; nasty white bread sticks as well as average salad!) Speaking of salad, they know what a real Italian salad is here; lettuce (romaine and red leaf), red onion, genoa salami, mozz cheese, black olives, tomatoes and yummy Italian dressing to top it off. I have had many different menu items over the years and they are all tasty, especially the lasagna. Happy manga!

Jt2GyRYoaJbBZySCAV50Pg.text: My mom took me here for lunch, the patio was very nice and cozy for our lovely spring weather. We went on a Saturday, and we had the $6.95 lunch specials in which you can choose from any of the specials that run M-F. You get a nice size meal with salad and their yummy Ciabatta bread. The server was very friendly.   I took my husband there a week later for dinner on a weeknight. Again I choose the patio which was even more cozy at night. My only grunt to the evening meal was it was a but pricy, but the quality and the service made it worth the while. The portions were big and we each had leftovers for lunch. Will defitnitely be back, the food is really good and so far the service has always been great too!

BQkAUXo1N6eHlUCAZ2YEdQ.text: ok so as per my previous review, I wasn't satisfied with the tiramisu to go, I was contacted by the manager.  said they were mailing me some coupons to compensate....ok great, I never received them, been waiting 2 months.  needless to say won't be giving this location any more of our business

zjDEqwALMv__7XFYZcjNiQ.text: Rigatony's is my absolute FAVORITE Italian restaurant in the Valley.   Granted, I have only had their delish salad, bread, lasagne and baked rigatoni with sausage, but the place rocks it every single time we go down there.   The salad is fantastic, and the baked bread is always hot and fresh.   But the star of the show is their Baked Rigatoni with sausage. And I mean the star of the show! Layers of rigatoni, creamy bechamel sauce cradled with marinara and thinly sliced italian sausage topped with melted mozzerella cheese, all served piping hot. It's THE BEST I've ever eaten!   The only drawback is the lack of a second location in Scottsdale, but we'll continue to make the drive because it's that good.   The staff are always very nice, and the food is promptly served.  If you haven't tried Rigatony's, and you love Italian food, get in your car and go!! It's worth the drive from anywhere!

anQ2J9VQ4JuKfL-nsdJOFw.text: Went to dinner with our son and daughter-in-law the other night and had an incredible dinner. We had fried Raviolis and calamari  for an app. The best calamari we have ever had! The Raviolis were the bomb! Salad was huge served family style and great bread. I had the short rib and my husband had the baked zitawith both sausage and meat balls. Both were outstanding! Service was excellent. We will diffentiely be back and will pass the word to our friends.

gTHPexkHtRWdIK1xlJ092Q.text: I am very picky eater and this Italian food is excellent! I always get the ceasar salad and it is delicious. The antipasto salad is enjoyed by all my other family members. I always get the baked rigatony with meatball - sooooo good. Always full by end of meal and never have room for dessert.

KqU5V41pK1yRFszwpc69Mw.text: Now my favorite Italian resteraunt is the best Italian resteraunt I've found for low carbers. As a low carber, I dread Italian and asian because it's such a challenge to find stuff that I can eat. Rigatonys, brilliantly, will sub out pasta for fresh green beans on most dishes. So good and so delicious. Highly reccomended if you do low carb or keto. Enjoy friends. I highly reccomend the grilled chicken linguini sub for haricot verts.

m64bOdzwFM_Et-D78oU-ig.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley.  I have only ordered food for take-out and everything that I have ordered has been great.  The customer service has always been stellar as well.  Here are my favorite dishes from them:  lasagna angel hair pasta with garlic sauce and shrimp angel hair pasta with marinara sauce and grilled chicken pork shops with green beans and pasta sausage and pepperoni pizza (they use very good crumbled sausage)  I highly recommend this restaurant!

nI50-14Kg8JvD_mBFuv_Qg.text: Love this place! Great food and not expensive! You can eat family style or just go solo the portions are huge. Make a reservation if you can they're always busy!

hk1KQOhzIqOWXH45fyXCng.text: A great restaurant to take the family, we've been going here since the 90s (it's changed locations, but hasn't changed the menu or quality).  Maybe not the best ambiance to impress on a date, but it's a nice laid back place for the family and service is always good.  Baked Rigatony is their signature dish and I've always liked it with chicken. Good sized portion and so much cheesy pasta goodness.

3Aj4ig7XUFuxQhWH5yXsgg.text: Got the early bird pasta special, linguini with meat sauce (and Alfredo sauce mixed in) and Italian sausage. It also came with fresh baked bread and their awesome house salad (seriously, I'd come here just for the salad). Proportions were big, and the prices are just right. The pasta sauces are flavorful and rich. Great local Italian spot!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cannoli&#39;s were really good! Two per order is even better! No fighting over dessert ;)

rpFv02n-dfmmd89-RKwcTA.text: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. Salad is great. Having s choice of quinoa pasta is great and their cappuccino pie is to die for!!! Make reservations in the winter or expect to wait!!!

m8NQ_KC66X0CfTn2323Ytg.text: I would say that the service was piss poor, but that implies we actually received any service of some kind. We went there last night well before closing, and the hostess sat us in the very back booth of the restaurant, which is fine. However, there were no other diners around us, and no traffic whatsoever besides those using the nearby restroom. We sat there for 10 minutes with absolutely no waiters or waitresses in sight the entire time. We ended up leaving, of course. To top it all off, the hostess was so completely oblivious, she actually wished us a cheerful good night on our way out, despite the fact that she had literally just shown us to our table minutes beforehand.  This is not an isolated incident. Previous visits during lunch with coworkers have also resulted in a similar lack of service and organization. No matter how good the food is, it is not worth it. And the food is very good, I'll give them that -- that is, if and when you can get them to actually bring you some. Farewell, Rigatony's (until you get your act together).

wPCkt_VQ7AHBGWfu4GMK1Q.text: Phoenix is a Italian food desert, I say this moving from Philadelphia a couple years back; this place is a nice exception. Great basic plus Italian fair cooked with attention to detail.  Try the family meals, they give you the best bang for the buck!

Dxp6VXi-gsFmjt9RsT9a1A.text: Went here this past Saturday night.  I had a big group of people so I made a reservation for 7.  Of course being a stickler for being on time we were running late.  And of course not just me but my whole group.  So I call and tell them we will be around 15 mins late.  They said of no problem we will be waiting for you!  Which I think it really great.  So everyone gets there and asks if I ever been there of course I haven't I just picked it based on Yelp reviews.  Didn't disappoint,  It was a busy Saturday and night and our food came quick and the bread and salad was a great way to start!!  I got the lasagna and oh man it was sooooooo good!  great way to start my birthday night!! Thanks to our waitress she was very nice and quick!

N5GZzqavlLHvhkien0DbgQ.text: We go there regularly and it's always a crowd pleaser. Friendly service, family friendly and tasty food.  Tip: go early or make reservations.   My husband loves the chicken parmesan & chicken marsala. The kids love the spaghetti & meatballs.   Happy Hour special 3-5pm:  Pick-A-Pasta:You pick the Pasta, Sauce and Topping! Includes RigaTony's World Famous Antipasto Salad & Ciabatta Bread! $8.50  Chef has daily "whim" specials for Ravioli & Cannoli!   We always have leftovers!

4K7FiRpx7a82Vs_bAZaPcA.text: I have been to this restaurant three time so far this year and each time is better than the last. It has great ambiance and plenty of roomy seating. I love the decor and i can't help but think this is what a real Italian restaurant should look like. The menu items I've tried have all been amazing but you can't go wrong with chicken parm. They have delish salads and breads. Great bar area! I also like the little patio seating area as well, tho I learned you cannot reserve anything out there til after 8 pm for large parties. Which is okay we just go as a small group each time instead. The staff have always been quick and friendly, they were attentive each time which I appreciate. It was clean and cozy and I highly recommend. The price was fair for dinner comparable to other nice restaurants and I like the casual local feel.

hcdWHMAND4hC0ySfdiTh0w.text: Excellent dinner! Our server was probably the best server we have ever had, attentive, friendly and very knowledgeable. Food was generous portions and great flavor, we will be back!

SR1enA8zWr50UCVcwjFnsw.text: I'm periodically  in town for work. This year I happen to be in town on father's day. My family in California  was not able to join me so I was hesitant to go out to eat but I did so anyways. I'm Italian and usually requent Italian  style restaurants, the hotel I stayed at suggested Rigatonis  in tempe. I had been here before and it was good. I went to the bar and thought I'd have a quiet and quick meal to avoid looking out of place. I was amazed on how welcoming and at home I felt by the bartenders. Chris and Trisha were a pleasure to talk to and sold me on the special. Chris asked about my work and made light conversation. I thought this was just an act he does for every guest, but then some regulars, I'm assuming, came in and sat next to me. He talked to them like he's known them for years. He introduced me to them and we started talking. I was there for 2 hours, but it seemed like 30 min. All this and they were very busy. You don't get service like this anymore. Great job. I don't usually write reviews on restaurants, if I like it I go back, if I don't like it, I won't go back. I will be back.  FOOD: 7/10 SERVICE:10/10.

UNZ4XK990ggJ9VcL_Cjmxw.text: It had been a while since I had Italian food so the wife and I randomly picked RigaTony's and we are damn glad we did! The interior is tastefully decorated and charming and it has a cozy atmosphere without crowding the tables together.   The food starts with a sample of wine and an excellent salad and bread fresh from the oven, I had the Fettucini Alfredo with a meatball and it was just fantastic! The wife had the Fettucini Alfredo with Chicken Lemon and Artichoke which was delectable!  Our service was prompt (we came at 4:30pm on a Wednesday) and our server was friendly, sociable, and helpful!   Good Job RigaTony's!!!

F_dyikII0hsrRsRAl6KUkw.text: I couldn't stress to the server how allergic I am to dairy and can NOT have cross contamination...yes I know its Italian food but we have eaten here before and not had an issue. When I addressed it with the manager he wanted to argue the matter. I walked in with a flat stomach and within 20 minutes of eating I looked 6 months pregnant. He wanted to give me a $10 off coupon to make my next visit "another good experience" really your $10 is going to make this pain go away for the next three days and what was so "enjoyable" about this experience????Horrible customer service and not a single care they messed up!!

PNpEraquArhJzIMw9jKhCA.text: My husband works close to this restaurant and had heard good things about Rigatony's from his coworkers. I came down to meet him for lunch, and he suggested this place.  I had read the reviews before coming, and have to admit I was a bit leery to try it out after seeing the 1 star review from 4/21/15 but decided to check this place out anyhow.  They were incredibly busy when we got there at 12:00 noon, and there was a 5 min wait, but we were seated in a roomy booth. The fact that they were this busy seemed like a positive sign.   I have to say that I liked the food. The server was very friendly, and apologetic that she was a titch late in getting our drinks to us since they were busy. Our meals came with this delicious house salad that included finely sliced up salami, pepperccinis, lettuce, onion, mozzarella cheese and olives with their specially made salad dressing. In addition to the salad, we were given this bread with a delicious herbed crust. The server placed some olive oil and some oregano on a plate, and told us to dip our bread in it. Nom, nom, nom. I'd come back for that bread alone.  I ordered the cappelini pescatore, which for $13.95, had a generous amount of seafood for the price. It was a huge serving and after filling up on bread, I had to take 1/2 of it home. My husband ordered the Italian sausage hoagie, which was gloriously covered in melted mozzarella, and also split his meal. For the price, it was definitely steal. It was HUGE. You could definitely share this with someone. Per the menu, they charge $3.00 if you decide to split an entree.   For dessert, we had the cannolis. The shells were nice and crispy while the filling was rich and comforting. We took one home, and froze it. We were told by the server not to put it in the fridge because it would get too soggy if we didn't eat it tonight.   If I'm in the area, I'll definitely be back. It's not worth driving for, as I've had better Italian, but if I'm in the area I'd definitely come back. This is a family run business, and I definitely prefer Mom and Pop shops over chains.

jrDuNJd5t_29C2qgUd6d1A.text: Had spaghetti/meatballs and tiramisu. The sauce was adequate and the dessert was okay. The service was lacking. Thought it would be much better from all the great reviews. Maybe I went in with too high of an expectation. I may go back and try again.

K6VxqfpWpAuN1QtOjcbR3w.text: Best Italian food I have found in the E. Valley.I love thier salad, baked RigaTony and Shrimp Scampi.

MxJJCeVyT4xFqbUEdgBC2g.text: I usually only ever order take out. The restaurant can get very packed. Their food and service is lovely. Their baked rigatony and spaghetti with meatballs are my favorite. Their marinara sauce is on the sweeter side, which is the way I like it. Their bread is good too. I've had better antipasto. Only three stars because I eat homemade italian food all the time. I'm sure if italian food wasn't overkill for me I would give it 5 stars.

fIVKGypuE-rRtMGeTm-blg.text: Went here on date night with the wife.  Atmosphere and ambiance were great and the salad and bread (as noted in other reviews) were fantastic.    I had the Cannelloni and my wife had the special (Pasta, butter sauce, shrimp and peppers,) both were delicious but hers was better.  Atmosphere and service really made the evening and we'll definitely be bringing the family here in the future.

m426zW2o00uPVQzRzQxSLw.text: We were misguidedly sent here for Valentine's Day, not realizing it was a shopping center-Olive Garden type of place. We love Italian so decided to give it a try. The atmosphere was pretty awesome, great interiors. We did have a reservation but we still had to wait about 15 minutes on a Sunday night at 6. I can't speak for all their staff, but our waitress took about 10 minutes to get us waters, at which point we order wine, which took her about 20 minutes to get to us. Ordered entree and appetizers, which the appetizers came out approximately 5 minutes before the entrees. I am a pescatarian and when I asked for a house salad with no meat, she was very rude. The food was just ok, my only complaint is that I ordered the seafood bake, which was not baked, it was just a MASSIVE pile of pasta with 4 tiny scallops, 3 shrimp, and a few flakes of some unknown whitefish. Misleading name, almost no seafood and it wasn't cheap. (Calamari app was excellent.) WORST PART OF THE EXPERIENCE: They have giant portions so I took most of my meal home. The waitressed boxed everything in the kitchen for me, and when I ate some the next day, there were shards of broken beer bottle in my food. :( I'm sure the boxes were sitting behind the bar and someone had an accident and she just didn't notice them but...it was pretty awful.

BDRjqFfnYu-i9xvFPCxfdg.text: Best Italian food in Arizona is an understatement!. I grew up in New York around Little Italy and have to say the food at Rigatony's is authentic....delicious beyond words! I tried linquine with marinara and shrimp - the sauce was perfect. My husband had the creamy clam sauce with spaghetti and said it was the best dish he 'ever' had!! The bread and antipasto salad is to die for. You can buy a loaf of bread to bake at home! another plus! The ambiance is wonderful, the service is amazing! If you want to be treated like family and enjoy a delicious 'real italian' meal then this is the place for you.  I never said these words before but its 'better than my Moms and Grandma's food)!  I hope the sky doesent open up and swallow me now!!!

yfZ8ncSfxF2iK1d_kO1Yzw.text: salad and bread delicious. entrees just ok.

yfN8F23Xig5ptKxArMbsPQ.text: Me and my friend were looking for a place to eat that was fairly cheap before I drove her to the airport.  Her Grandmother suggested RigaTony's.  She said it was a decent price for what you got.  She was more than right.  The exterior looked quaint as we drove into the parking lot.  The moment we walked in, the smell of italian food comsumed our senses.  They offered lunch specials from $6.95 and only $1.00 more for a drink.  The specials came with amazing bread and matching house antipesto salad.  Yummy!  I ordered their chicken parmigiana, which can only be described as "explode in your mouth flavor."  This was hands down the best chicken parm dish I had ever had.  My friend had the stuffed shells, which was surprisingly delish (not my fave thing to eat via italian), however the seasonings and sauce made it anything but dull.  The service we recieved was ok.  Our waiter wasn't super attentive.  He may have come to our table once after taking our order. I had to flag him down for refils on our drinks, and even that took a little bit of time.  I recommend  this restaurant.  It's well worth my drive from Goodyear to Chandler.

6m0vHbUnfK2dc27A6qSDiA.text: I was a long time customer at the old location, the parking here is great.  It did take a while to get seats and it is tight.  The salad and bread great as always and boyt did i enjoy the Rigatony with sausage as they call it

0_Y7w7diOUPYGoOS-RmVXQ.text: I really wanted to like this place.  We have been looking for reasonable Italian food not too far from our house.  Unfortunately, in the end we decided we did not like it enough to go back.  We had the take out chicken picata special.  The bread was strange, not bad but not italian and certainly not ciabatta.  I liked the salad alot.  It it an antipasto salad so it has lots of things in it like pepperoncini.  You have to like that type of salad to enjoy this. Canned black olives did not help it. The fetuccini alfredo was terrible.  It tasted strongly like nutmeg.  When I taste something like that it tells me they did not use good enough ingredients to let it stand on its own.  I have had real Alfredo at Alfredos of Rome in Miami Beach.  Whicle I don't expect that quality of food here, the real stuff it very delicate and rich - butter cream and real parmagian cheese, nothing else.  The chicken picata was good as long as you did not expect chicken picata.  It had no lemon in it.  It was a nice dish, breaded chicken with mushrooms, capers, tomatoes etc, but it definely was not chicken picata.  Desert was chocolate haselnut cake.  It probably is very good if you like chocolate and coffee together.  neither of us like this.  So out of every thing we got, the chicken was OK, but not what it was supposed to be and the salad was good for that type of salad.

GsZdaKbpdBpYZXZvkg799A.text: Came on a Sunday afternoon, 45 minute wait.  Very good food and service.   Little pricey for my liking,  but very comparable to other restaurants with pasta dishes.   Will definitely be back.

E_TWDPwbFGI8W7yU9HfzKg.text: First review of 2014.  Real Southern Italian cuisine is to be found here in spades.  While it seems to have something of the retro vibe that Oregano's has, this place is not a chain, and the ambiance here is more of an Italian home during the 40s and 50s instead of a restaurant with random antiques hung on the walls, ceiling, etc.  Not only does it look like an Italian-American home during that time, it tastes and smells like it too.  The recipe for the sauce no doubt has roots in the old country, and I'm certain someone's Nonna came over from Palermo a century ago with that recipe in her head.  The meat sauce has a sweet, spicy taste.  Fantastic, but as my family is Zeneize and Toscano, it's a distinctly different flavor from what I am used to.  My wife and I were very happy with our meal, but I have to be in the mood for food from the lower half of the Boot to want to come here again.  When that moment strikes, I'll be ready to return for some lasagne or a pizza.  Thanks RigaTony's for a delicious lunch!

9_P9DKqEDYDyoRwopbZtJw.text: Great value for the money. The food always tastes great and the portions are large. Be sure to ask about the desert of the day.

smYyv_M9eebCHNBJJTBwGg.text: To say I'm disappointed...well that would be an understatement. For many weeks my Company made a reservation for our annual Manager's appreciation dinner. Party of 12 - Tony's room (We've been patronizing this restaurant for 15 years...)...At the last minute (8 hours before our scheduled time), we had another person decide to join....being proactive we contacted Rigatony's as to not surprise them. We were told that they do not take reservations in the dining room for more than 10 people. (Since we no longer could fit in Tony's room, we would have to move to the dinning room.)  This reservation was for 8:30 pm....Consequently, our reservation was cancelled and I was stuck at the last minute to try to find a suitable restaurant for my party. I'm sorry...this was not right as they were absolutely inflexible to work with us on this. We will NEVER be back...ever!

WJ248xy91G-r8mMhxCmnuA.text: Bottom Line: Good to Great Italian food, but LOUSY service. Had a 5:30pm reservation and was made to stand waiting until 6pm just to be seated. Then every step of the way seemed to take forever. Seemed understaffed and/or poorly managed wait staff. I understand it's not fast food, but do not go here if you need to be served in 20 minutes. And don't even THINK about going here without a reservation (a reservation to wait on line, that is!)

WK6n9-QkH5fjGvqvM2A_pQ.text: Decided to come here because I wanted a salad, and the salad reviews here were good. They did not lie! The salad is spectacular! I inhaled the first bowl, and ate most of my second bowl. Everything in that salad *goes* and it rocks. I'd come here for the salad alone. My meal would have been easily five stars...  Decided to supplement my meal with the steamed clams (appetizer). It was quite flavorful, albeit the broth was a bit too salty for my liking. Even the bread wasn't enough to cut the salt. (One star off for that.)   My server was Jessica and she was helpful and very sweet. I like this place! I'd totally spend my own money to eat here. (I'm here on business in PHX.)

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. The bottomless salad that comes with each meal that has made me the happiest person on the planet. :)
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steamed clams in an overly salty white wine sauce.

odTJWN8zSNTFGdGnN-pEvg.text: On vacation from Indy, we dropped into RigaTony's for lunch.  What good fortune for us.  First of all the weather was perfect for dining on their patio.  Second, we had a top notch waitress named Jess S.  Her smile alone was infectious but her knowledge of the menu made choosing much easier.   We started with antipasto.  It was knock-your-socks-off-oh- my-God-bring-me-more good.  It was served with fresh baked bread which we both rated as a four.  We passed on a second round of antipasto to enjoy cheese ravioli (my wife's choice) while I ordered the Capellini Pescatore:  clams, mussels, shrimp, and calamari steeped in a white wine butter sauce with a hint of tomato over angel hair pasta.  My wife rated her meal as a 5 star production.  I gave mine a 4 star rating but it was only because I felt it needed a bit of a garlic kick to it.  But maybe that's just me.  Would I go back? Absolutely, but it's a long drive from Indy for lunch. :-(   I wonder if they deliver...to Indiana?

5fI1BFtGXfX-6ojugiMKhA.text: The Tour of Rigatony was extremely well priced for the portions and quality of the meal! Best manicotti I've had in AZ hands down. For the service our server was a pretty busy guy, but despite entertaining the rest of his bigger tables he always kept our drinks topped off and asked if we were doing okay. Its hard to save room for dessert, but of you have any room, the cannoli is unreal.

3-nbAq3PqkxWtrjoR4zkCQ.text: My family and I are Italian and extremely picky about any Italian food that isn't home cooked. We finally decided to take a risk and gave Rigatonys a shot. We are all so thrilled we did! The food is incredible, the restaurant clean and family friendly, and the staff was wonderful. This will be our new family celebrating spot. If you like Italian, do yourself a favor and come try them out!

-Zr3wGsDt4Ay7RBR_cY4VA.text: Had the capellini checca and was surprised it comes dry with no sauce! Our server didn't seem completely familiar with the menu. We both liked companion's cheese ravioli with meat sauce, though it was a bit over boiled. Ciabatta bread is soft inside with a crisp crust for dipping into the evoo, but server was miffed we asked for butter too. Good food, but read menu carefully and ask lots of questions.

Sj_QNrgKWhGJHUjTHJKE6g.text: Fantastic place food ambience service and price..huge portions small prices a definite family go too.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

T35lElghs2onZCcjn22qFQ.text: Such amazing food! Love the grilled chicken linguini! And the salads are so delicious and so big! And the bread! Just go. It's amazing.

aNrgqe2P3CEyfK5nktG10A.text: This is a great place for pasta in Tempe.  I'm from New York State, so I know what good Italian tastes like!  Their squad is good, and they are generous with bread and salad to share.  My friend likes to take the extra home when we go there.  My mom sometimes makes a meal out of just the salad and bread!  The favorite part for me is the whole wheat pasta, which is been hard to find lately.  There's also a quinoa pasta.  The Italian soda is a special treat!  The best deal is to go for the Early Bird Special, which is pasta, salad, and either meat or a vegetable at a very low price.  I think it ends at 4:00pm during the week.  The service is friendly and I recommend this place to anyone in the area who likes tasty Italian.

PV4wmJTB7mbpD9afWNLZ0g.text: The salad was really good and the sangria is very tasty.  You can tell they use the freshest ingredients. I highly recommend the spaghetti with marinara.

NxnUD545EodUFsMSHliURA.text: My folks raved about this place from prior visits, but, 2 of 3 of us would not return.  I thought the salad was a bit slimy and the lemon basil sauce on my dish could have been thickened. Plus, my whole wheat spaghetti was terribly overcooked.  And the Sangria was oddly strawberry flavored, yet, this was the regular sangria.  Service was inattentive.  Water was never refilled and server only addressed the 2 males at the table of 5. Missed ordering dessert as she walked away.

TZ85lISzKaAHnnNFQjdgUw.text: I visit here often. I'm talking like 2 or 3 times a week. Ask waitress Tricia, she has seen me. (Great waitress by the way! Very personable and super sweet. Paul is great too.) I've been here especially since I have been pregnant. I CRAVE the salad and love anything with cheese.   Today, I got takeout for lunch. I ordered the minestrone soup. I am sad to say that it was not at all what I was expecting. Never again. Isn't minestrone soup supposed to have beans or pasta in it? By definition: a thick soup containing vegetables and pasta. This was watery, thin and without pasta. :(  I called the manager, he was nice enough to check the soup for me. He said it looked fine to him, must have just been mine. He took down my address and said he would send something to makeup for it, which I appreciate.   Will update review if I am pleased with the response. Thanks for caring that I was disappointed!

_ORDFtvoXtzYypVpZ_Ugug.text: We recently moved to Tempe and were searching around for good local food. This was our first visit and we were very pleased. The waiter we had was pleasant, he was at our table just enough so that it wasn't bothersome and we were able to get our orders and our check in a timely fashion.   As for the food it was delightful. Their salad was amazing, the bread was well, just bread in my opinion. We ordered fried ravioli, fettuccine alfredo and the deluxe spaghetti. The fried ravioli was by far the best dish we ordered for the night, it was to die for. The fettuccine alfredo was great, its exactly what I would expect of the dish and as for the spaghetti it was also great. Portions were perfect in my opinion.   The atmosphere was a little on the loud side, where we sat the tables were rather close together so I could hear the conversations of those sitting next to us really well. Made it kind of hard to focus on my dinner companion. It feels homey but a little outdated.   Overall we will definitely be back and I will be taking my parents when they come to town to visit. Great family place!

UfWkrKFzGIyDwZ49vJlxSA.text: In the beginning of the month of October my wife and I ordered a very Large Party To Go, to feed a house full of people the next day after our daughter's wedding. I have to say that Rigatony's did a phenomenal job putting together all the wonderful dishes and salads to eat. From the moment we walked in to pick up the food, they took very good care of us and a parade of servers brought all the food to our car. The food was amazing and it was gone very quickly. I had about 40 people and they loved every dish. RigaTony's is the best. Outstanding!! Thanks to everyone at Rigatony's,The Klein's...

wZAI1XWFCz54QqtcabT5GQ.text: Amazing. We had the fried zucchini and the antipasto salad was to die for. So fresh! And let's not talk about the hot soft bread. That was before our entrees.

j2qMnmK-STtB5wcnONuhyw.text: I make it a point to stop here any time I'm in town, just for the amazing salad. Seriously. I could eat and entire bowl myself. Service is always solid and the other food items like the manicotti don't disappoint. Best Italian food in the east valley for sure.

AU7h3rRqhOXZ3PoKg0SXew.text: Hmm.. well, this left me a little confused. Maybe not good enough for four stars but slightly better than three. It is a typical old school New York style Italian restaurant, as it is apparent from the name. The decor is dated but I think that is intentional, which is cool. We were a large party of 12 and our waitress was pretty good with the service. They brought out the bread and salad and they were quite great. They were incredibly fresh and who doesn't like whole black olives in their salad? Seriously.   We started placing our orders and after about 20 minutes of deliberation, I decided to get the Baked Rigatoni with chicken. I thought the sauce was pretty great with abundant garlic.. just the way I like it. The chicken however, left much to be desired. I found myself trying to eat all of the chicken as quickly as possible to get it out of the way so that I don't accidentally take a bite of the pasta with chicken in it. I don't know how it would've tasted with sausage or shrimp, but I would just stick to the pasta with absolutely no meat in it, if I were to return. One of my friends ordered meatballs and she absolutely hated it. She thought the sauce was too sweet and ended up barely eating any of what she ordered. The rest of the party, however,  seemed to enjoy their food.   I thought it was alright overall.. not terribly disappointing, neither was it a memorable meal. Undecided at this point if I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baked Rigatoni with chicken

Softuc8t8pcIHUJ3fLdM9A.text: I love this place the first time I came here was about 5 years ago or 4 years ago when I first got to Arizona with some co-workers it was amazing love coming here close to authentic Italian food they do it right here can't sleep on it came back a couple of months later same consistency in food.  Move to South West Phoenix came a couple of times in the last couple of years still remember the same my wife and I visit this place back on last Friday and the menu changed just a little bit some of the hidden items that we used to get you can still ask for they're just not listed on the menu service was great and Grand there was a wait so expect that don't get disappointed it's worth the way the food is always on point as much as I remember the first time I came here. Make sure you give rigatony's a try authentic close enough to Italian food that you're going to get in Arizona.

Jv9_7MXhX7Q8n15DQ6zC8w.text: My family is a regular. So much so we're on our  on at least our 30th card they give you to fill up and get an entree free for the next visit. So it's with a heavy heart that I have to say we will never be back. We know Friday and Saturday are their busiest nights so we got there at 4:30pm. Only 10 minute wait. Great! It was downhill rapidly from there. Service was horrendous. Waited for 15 minutes to order our drinks, okay, no biggie. I ordered coffee. It was stone cold when it came out. I mean it wasn't even slightly warm. I put my finger in it just to make sure. Not any warmth to it. Waited another 10-15 minutes for the waiter to come take our food order and that's when I let him know about the coffee. Another 15 minutes for salad and bread. Also the new cup of coffee, huh? Warm but definitely not hot coffee. Didn't feel like dealing with it so took 2 sips and then drank water. The salad in the past was something of heaven. This was NOT! A clump of grated cheese strands and antipasto meats stuck together. Yuk. To top it off, since it took so long to bring out our food, meaning we had to ask for our food after 30 minutes, cold ravioli and cold pizza. Wth? When we let the waiter know, he went to get the manager. By this time we were so pissed off. The manager said he would make it again. Um, no, we're not going to wait another 30 minutes. He then said again, let me make it right. Sorry but there was no way to make it right at this point. Poor guy, after he said that, we didn't even give him a chance to speak. He just left us. He returned after a few minutes to say he was taking it off the bill. Try the whole meal buddy! You guys got nothing right!!! While trying to salvage the ravioli dinner by eating it cold, is when we found 2 of them were brown on the bottom. They we old!! Stale and old. Omg. If this is how they are going to serve food now, I'm not going back!!!!

AaNL6OLbJ7oeywiK7tVNbw.text: Always good!  Never had a bad meal here.  Totally recommend RigaTony's. Salad that come with meal and hot bread are GREAT. I really like the"Italian Feast."

19WlqKAPbv0fNoS-x7H3ZQ.text: Riga Tonys showed up on my Yelp app so I tried it out. I had Shrimp alfredo which was ok but I love Fried Ravioli and recommend it as it is full of cheese and is delicious with sauce. They also have unique Italian sodas and snacks for sale. Togo was ready and hot when I got home.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. stuffed raviolis and rigatoni Alfredo

lO0FPaRYMcGvhDrt3WMSlg.text: Excellent service and food. Our waitress was awesome! Very accommodating and friendly. The baked RigaTony with sausage is my favorite item. The baked lasagna is a close second. Pepperoni and sausage hoagie is awesome, too. Comp bread and salad are amazing! 10 times better than Olive Garden. For dessert, you have to try the bread pudding and chocolate hazelnut cake.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

CjWZDU84jY8b2BA6Oua5NA.text: We love Rigatony's. Their antipasto salad and bread are a great way to start the meal. At lunch, the build your own pasta is great. Servers are good, atmosphere nice, and prices are reasonable. Great place for Italian American food. Take out is another plus.

HirVwW7LvqEYSH3NVi4t-A.text: One of the better comfortable Italian restaurants in the Valley. It's an upgrade over Olive Garden and everything is tasty and very affordable. A good go-to restaurant. Their Italian sodas are great too.

m9PeyXJlMwjIeD3puL4UnA.text: Often I find that I have to compromise taste for service or vice versa. Meaning if the food is amazing, I settle for less than amazing service or if the service is amazing, i settle for less than amazing food.  There's no settling here! This place has AMAZING service and phenomenal food. The portions are huge and the flavor is even bigger!  Every meal is served with bread and salad. I can do without the bread but the salad was a meal in itself. It has lettuce, tomatoes, onions, peppers, salami, olives, and this homemade creamy balsamic vinaigrette. I tried the jambalaya pats for my entree and I was blown away. It is bow tie pasta with peppers, shrimp, chicken, sausage, and shrimp. It is seasoned to perfection with just enough kick.  I get to enjoy all this yummy goodness with amazing staff. My waitress checks on me just enough. I don't feel deserted and I don't feel overwhelmed. Speaking of dessert. I'll be back later to tell you about it because I'm about to devour it hahah!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jambalaya pasta
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tiramisu.
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. House salad. Comes with every meal.

mbZkiMD6eGQHQq4lnsYwyA.text: Some of the best Italian food I've had. Highly recommend catering them for a work party.

S2Z32UNGyyxKb-wo6n8rLA.text: Found this place on Yelp. A friend was in town and is very particular about certain dishes.  They had their menu online and were highly recommended by many locals.  Authentic Italian, pesto was clearly home made. Meals come with bread and house salad. Waitress was very thorough and did not displease whatsoever. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheese Ravioli with pesto sauce

De9J2ctC6rkWC6VShXLbCA.text: If they had an app for the dang loyalty program this would be 5 star. Food is amazing.

9rY69m2vouTiejb2ur8tug.text: Awesome food. Great service. Big portions. Always love coming here. The cannolis are a great way to end the meal

DMBiMZeylLQmLWzVi9giuQ.text: Hands down the best Italian Food Restaurant in Arizona. Absolutely just phenomenal food and the service is ALWAYS great! Try the Baked Rigatoni with meatball, oh My God is it delicious.  Go to this restaurant...just GO!!!

vK3RjsuqoOt69ahXHBBV_Q.text: This is a great place for lunch!! They do a family style salad and bread to start. They have a great lunch menu - i ate every last bite of my lasagna! Everyone at the table really enjoyed their lunch. Service was great too!

lEddQTLCriul20eFV6qZGA.text: Decided to try out RigaTonys take out. Not disappointed at all. I ordered the baked RigaTony's and my wife order the lasagne and both were really good. The meal included a salad and their version of breadsticks that were even better. 10/10 for service and food.

SUUrcVQ6byKU0SVhdqk95Q.text: Wonderful lasagna. The Baked Rigatoni's is amazing. Love the fried ravioli. Great atmosphere and great service. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

GS3ZeZ3lwh1Z35eZFke5jw.text: Let me start by saying We Love Rigatonys!  We've celebrated most anniversaries, birthdays, family events(in the private room) and tonight was somewhat of a disappointment  It was a significant Birthday for me (not disclosing!) and it fell very short.  Our reservation was at 730pm and we were seated within 10, awesome!  We sat out on the patio which was lovely but were never given menus.  Our server finally came and asked if we were ready to order but we still needed menus, so she took our drink orders, but we waited about 15 min for that, there were only 3 tables occupied outside.  We finally ordered, bread, salad everything was great.  At the end of the meal I told our server I have 3 cards stamp cards and can she combine, she said let me see.  When she came back she said we could use them next time,  it that didn't make sense since we had combined over 3 cards of stamps into one and a half cards of stamps! It only takes 1 card to take advantage of a free entree! I got the impression she felt like it would hurt her tip, which it would not have since I'm in the service industry.  I was charged the most I've ever been charged for shrimp scampi, due to a sub of wheat pasta, which I've never experienced. I could have ordered their "Carb smart" dinner with chicken, shrimp, wheat pasta, and a veggie for over $5 less!  you would think the server would suggest that!  I truly feel like our server was nickel and dimeing us for her benefit.  My big Birthday was never acknowledged, which was fine since Im not a fan of getting older!   Bottom line. Great food as always!  Everything else a disappointment

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu item

oiPSox2Pdb06P0zBBrhRNg.text: The food was delicious! We came here one late Saturday afternoon, at what we thought would be an off-peak time but there was a little bit of a wait. I figured busy was a good sign they must be good though! & I was right! Our waitress was laid back & checked on us often enough. Service seemed a little slow but I think that's part of the experience right? Maybe they don't rush the process? The salad & bread we got before our meals came out family style which was fun! The salad was so good we finished almost all of it which I've never seen happen with my crew before! But of course the star of the show was the pasta! I got the Four Cheese Penne & it was great! I also got to sample someone's Baked RigaTony which was amazing! Next time I'm getting that!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Four Cheese Penne

diGmGH0mSdIjUu9ZEZcfaw.text: We have been customers of The family owned Rigatony's since moving to the SE Valley 21 years ago. We love, love, love Rigatony's Italian Food. Their quality is as high as it was 21 years ago!! Love their endless antipasto salad (always fresh) and warm bread. We eat at Rigatony's about once a week. When family comes to visit - Rigatony's is a must dinner visit. All their entrees are all excellent. Can't beat their spaghetti with meat sauce & meatballs! Do call and make a reservation if planning ahead for dinner. Rigatony's is very busy 7 days a week. Have excellent lunches, too!

xaER5kBYlUP1zyaYFRhttw.text: This was my first time here and it was amazing! We sat next to people from Chicago who also loved it. I think that's speaks for itself. They do get busy but we snagged a table in the bar so our wait only ended up being 2 min instead of 45 min for a table. Either would've been worth the wait. Dinner started with the delicious bread and salad and it only got better from there. I had angel haired pasta with scallops and shrimp and they were cooked perfectly. Be warned they're huge portions and unfortunately it was our last night in town so I couldn't take it with me. I will definitely be back when we come to town again and would recommend this to everyone!

zchgi4iXh67hDAS6w3tiNw.text: I thought I had put this review up sooner. I love to eat at Rigatoni's, I actually go by myself once a month and turn off my phone and sit in a corn booth and have a dinner alone.  It's quite nice, for me.  So when I got married I decided to go with RigaTony's. I paid the little bit extra to have it delivered and they where on time, helped put food in place, brought everything we needed. The food was amazing, my guests loved it. My food was perfect!!! Thank you.

o1FpPHHC5n0kIPpBfkGJZw.text: I can't believe it's taken me so long to get here.  I received a gift card for here.  I know that my other family members really liked it.  We got two dishes and was shocked at how large the salad was for us during lunch.  It was so good.  The pasta and bread came out along with oil for dipping.  The place was packed during lunch (we waited nearly 30 minutes).  Now I understand why.  We will be back.

UuN5zDz2cNjHHalj4q7KIQ.text: I suspect their is always a wait for a table. We went on a Sunday night ar 7:45, saw many people waiting and were told we would have anywhere from 45 min to an hour before we would be seated. Maybe it was because it was a cold night and only 1 couple braved the temperature rather than waiting?  They did have infrared heaters, but it was rather chilly even with that. When we were seated we were greated by a friendly server, and were told to peruse the menu while she got our salad and breadsticks ( they come with the meal). When we inquired about the dressing, she told us there was raw egg in it.  To me, that can be risky- some raw eggs can have salmonella, though the egg industry has cleaned up their process over the last few years. But why take the chance?  We selected a different dressing just to be cautious. Other than that issue, we had a good meal. Everyone else other than me is ordered pasta dishes, and thought they weres delicious. I ordered the single pork chop with a side of pasta.  I agree the pasta and sauce were delicious, but the pork chop was tough. I was able to eat half of it buy slicing each bite very thinly. I would not order that again

ElPNvU9e4mBlQngHdXNUIw.text: RigaTony's has been one of our favorite restaurants for over 25 years.  Food and service have always been great.  Not so much tonight!  We never got offered a sample of the wine. Our waiter Dillon took our order and delivered it in a reasonable amount of time.  He auctioned off our food not knowing who had what.  I ordered pasta with veggies and got my veggies when I was finished eating ten minutes later.  I also asked for extra sauce and didn't get that either when my food was delivered.  Why bother writing down the order in the first place?  He didn't do a check back to make sure everything was ok either. Won't stop us from returning though.  We just won't sit in his station again!

xh-xkdoQpGRWBEJ7jyFsfA.text: The free salad is bonkers, so delicious. Almost filled up on salad and bread before the entrees came out. I ordered the rigatony and it came out piping hot and full of flavor. The wait staff was beyond pleasant.

SK2zmBt7865MNBMYIZxEyw.text: Although the wait is pretty long, it's worth it! Great menu selection, knowledgeable servers and great and delicious dishes.  Cravings for Italian? Great place to eat!

TK3FKrsgsO0rJiRKrghtPQ.text: After being a loyal customer for over 20 years, sadly we won't be back. The food is wonderful, the management, not so much.  I had made a reservation for the private dining room for a birthday dinner. We moved out of state a few years ago, but still continue our tradition of going to Rigatony's for all of our special occasions. We got to the restaurant along with all of our local family and were told that we would be seated in the regular dining area.   Apparently, the girl who made the reservation made an error and gave me a time for the private room that wasn't available. I asked to speak to the manager and it went downhill from there. Bryce came out with an attitude, was unapologetic, and made no attempt to make anything right. Note at the time, there was no party in the private dining room and wouldn't be for another hour. He rudely told me that we could sit in the regular dining area or leave. When I mentioned we had been customers for years, he made a smart aleck response.  Even though our experience in the main dining area vs. the private room would not have been what we wanted (it's way too loud to have large group conversations in the main room), we would have stayed had he not been so condescending and rude.   I tried to call the restaurant several times that evening to speak to Chrissy, the owner. I kept getting a recording to call back later. I ended up sending Chrissy an email about our experience and received no reply.  Rigatony's has gotten so popular over the years that apparently customer service is of no importance to them. We ended up leaving that evening and going to a restaurant that actually appreciates their customers.

aQ0imU2SFfg2ElefohcoVw.text: This was a great experience all around. My husband and I came for a date night. The food was tasty. The server was attentive. The only reason I didn't give five stars is cause of the confusion with  the wait time. We were told over an hour and waited that time frame, but then I guess they opened up another area and started seating us along with people that were just walking in the door. It was kinda annoying wait when we could have been sat much earlier. All in all- very good though!

ZsODpL7IxLM1_bu6PnZIBg.text: We've been coming to this establishment since they were in another location! The food has stayed the same which usually isn't the case for most places.   Capellini Checca if you aren't into sauces and want a great pasta. My favorite has always been the Baked Rigatony with Sausage. Never fails!

eXigxMBp_TyhOIIhQG7Tcg.text: We had a very nice experience here and I have to wonder why we hadn't been here before? We came in for a relatively early dinner and were immediately seated in an area with a pleasant, efficient, and knowledgeable server. The salad that was served ahead of our entrees was oh so good! YUMMY!!! The meal itself was very good as well. Everyone in our party enjoyed their meal and we will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

tMgdxZ7mubSWkXhK_UCj1Q.text: One of my favorite Italian restaurants, and it's close to home. They have excellent specials. I recommend signing up by liking the Facebook page and you will see lots of specials, especially on holidays. When I go I usually get lasagna. The salad and bread are excellent too. They have a nice selection of "vintage" sodas that you can order too. I would say best Italian restauant in Chandler. I have been going here for several years - both at their current location and at the former location.

PmKdH8oXR8qY6DYivQ_rlw.text: What I love about this place is that it is real authentic Italian food, the kind we used to eat on vacations there when I was a kid, nothing has changed, not even the decor. Go for lunch and order a dish that comes with the antipasti salad (that salad is a meal in itself and the reason you will be coming back for more, you have been warned). The portions are generous and their lunch specials are a great deal so don't tell everybody. My personal favorites are the chicken picante, the lamb cutlet dish, any pasta with marinara sauce and the tiramisu.

Xnl1SKqkB5woEQ_ICGDyyQ.text: Friendly staff, clean location, and food is prepared quickly. Extremely affordable. It is a nice place to take a date and seems to be kid friendly.

Y9g73cIELN2zH5gqX2Cccg.text: Their house salad is the bomb!  I always order salads from here whenever I'm doing a get together or pot luck.  Yummmy!  The rest of the food is good as well!

12oGIT_Ska2xqWHQpxgRRw.text: Our first time here and we really enjoyed the great service and food.  We had a large group as part of a birthday party (made reservation) but they were able to quickly take orders and serve the food. They also allowed us to bring in a cake and they cut it for us, and bring it out in plates with forks. I was really impressed with the food and the service, we will be back.

m_1cD7MXbv42VaaNsOahkg.text: Great place for atmosphere and friendly service. Standard dishes seasoned well. Salad and bread with entree are just right.  Great desserts   Long wait at peak hours

OU2iJs-CFnvrH9Dx2e4q7A.text: Great food. 1st time here and we are sure to return. A great menu. We loved the Sangria and bread. We even had a 2nd helping of their fantastic salad. I had the chicken parmigiana and it was filling and delicious.  Waiter was wonderful to us. Very cordial and prompt. I wish I could remember his name and mention him.  If you like Italian food, you will love this place!!!!

93NFe9mVOueDfgBl_IMvuQ.text: What can I say that all the other 4- and 5-star reviewers haven't already said? I guess this: What are you waiting for? This is the best Italian food in the East Valley. Pro tip: don't stuff yourself early with their delicious bread. Save room for the wonderful spumoni ice cream for dessert. It is one of the best I've ever tried. Highly recommended.

k0XA_QYGjPfJq1XHUY4Hog.text: RigaTonys has a very good atmosphere and the food is great! Very good local spot if you want to get away from going to chain restaurants. We didn't wait to be seated long at all and food came out promptly and staff was friendly.

M4GlQBAclrx3Sp6hXii1jg.text: Waited for over an hour to be seated, but was definitely worth the wait. I don't think I've been served a better entree salad and bread in my life! Our server, Mary Katherine, was a delight. Food was prepared fresh and hot. Calamari was exquisite and pasta plates were served cheesy and full of sauce. Recommend asking for their frequent diner's card before leaving because you'll be back for more! Seating was comfortable and spaced out enough to where you aren't right next to anyone else. Atmosphere makes you feel like you're right at home. Definitely nice to know this place lived up to what all my friends have been talking about. Will be back soon!

k9Pmn2-OsTHJiYe5o4JSYw.text: I absolutely love this place. The food and service are fantastic. I've eaten here a couple of times now and I enjoy it more and more. I would recommend it to anybody looking for a fun dining experience.

inNufRBKsDndQJlwDrvNNw.text: Phenomenal as always. I recommend calling ahead and making a reservation. This place gets very busy for dinner time. The salad and bread are always very tasty. Tried the white pizza with clams this time around. Usually I order the pasta. Everything I've come here I've had a wonderful experience. Both the service and food are always great.

WabYQsrf7s9s3wPUXDCwvg.text: This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in the valley! Rigatonys is perfect for family dinners, birthdays, girls nights, or date night with the boyfriend.   My sister and I went tonight and everything was so yummy it struck me that I've never written a review for this place... Weird!   We shared the Fried Ravioli to start with. SO good. We both had the Baked Rigatony, hers with sausage, and mine plain. (vegetarian-yay!) The Bills won their game today so we also celebrated with some Cappuccino Pie, wayyy too delicious!  Our server was Natalie H, we love her. She's a really good server so we always try to ask for her when we go in.   Love Rigatonys!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. All that was left of our Cappucino Pie!

E99k_kreDsJ2H0U_0vBFqQ.text: The food is always superb and the atmosphere is just as on would imagine a cozy family Italian eating establishment to be. Service is always excellent from the moment you are greeted to the end of the visit. They have a nice selection of drinks and European beers to sample as well.

C_17anxiZoKDPysrR6cuxw.text: Waited 30 min on a Friday which is ok IF the food is good which here the food is O-K, nothing special.  My main problem was with service.  How do you forget my order five seconds after I give it to you?  Oh, you weren't listening,  now I get it.  Isn't a waiters only job to listen?  How are we doing with the meal?  Well if you had refilled my drink and brought it back the first time I asked I'd be great.  All you can eat bread and salad if your server remembers to bring it to you after you remind him twice (never did get it).  FFS,  how do two other tables get their food after my table and they have more people and seated AFTER we ordered?  The average food would have been ok if the server hadn't ruined the experience.  That said,  even if the server would have been a rock-star I would only give three stars at most.  I won't be going back.

CcdO25QbsCoP6uqDAnNcwQ.text: I love fired zucchini. Almost as much as I love falafels. This place serves fried zuc as an appetizer and it is just to die for. I come here becuase I actually crave huge plates of fried zucchini fries and a side of their pesto ranch.   Oh, and be careful not to totally ruin your dinner because they serve bread here too. Amazing, hot out of the oven bread with Italian seasonings and lots of butter. This is a rough place to visit if you're an emotional eater or craving carbs or PMSing or all of the above.  Service can be hit or miss, but usually it's pretty average. Depending on when you visit there might be a wait, though it's a pretty large dining area and the turn around time is decent. I know this is an Italian restaurant I've never actually had their pasta - my go to is the salmon salad with the pesto ranch. It is definitely not a healthy salad, so if that's what you are wanting, have them put the dressing on the side.. they are very generous with it!

1dnv3Z06bO_TUurNu6PNzg.text: RigaTony's is our go to lunch spot but they also have great dinners. If you want a classic Italian meal at a family place with lots of character, this is a great option in south Tempe.   Their lunch specials can't be beat. They have a "create your own pasta" deal for $7.95 and the regular lunch menu is extremely reasonable as well. My boyfriend almost always orders the chicken Parmesan ciabatta sandwich even though they took it off the menu a year ago. They are always willing to make it for him. Our meals also come with salad and bread so we get out of there for under $30 for lunch for two people and that's before the discount for being a frequent diner. It's a great value. You could easily pay the same or more elsewhere and not get salad and bread included. Did I mention the bread is freshly baked? It's the best if you get lucky enough to get it while it's still warm from the oven.   Dinner is always busy. We've come in at 5 and seen a line on a weeknight. Forget about eating here on a holiday without a reservation! We came here for lunch on Father's Day and it was an hour wait! (I'm telling you so you plan ahead. I'm glad RigaTony's is so busy because that means it'll be open for as long as I want to keep eating there.) We've only been here for dinner a couple times but we've always had a good time. The sangria is amazing! The baked Rigatony is my go to for dinner. I wish they had a veggie lasagna. Their drink prices are very reasonable so we've never broken the bank having dinner here.   They have a lovely patio with heaters if it's cold. My boyfriend took me here when we first started dating and I felt like we were in this little intimate cafe.   The waitstaff has always been courteous and friendly. We usually sit in the bar if we can and Tracy remembers that I like Dr. Pepper and always asks us if we need menus when we sit down. (We usually don't because we have the menu memorized.)   They also do takeout and sometimes if we want a light dinner we order salad to go and a few appetizers. They have two takeout parking spots so pickup is a breeze.   If you haven't been here yet, you should make plans to go!!

yP229qSxxhAwDraRAnNWew.text: The food is delicious. The staff is friendly. The ambience is nice. What more is there?! We will be going back again and again and again. It's my new favorite Italian eatery.

sEof4W4r2H4pQwVlC7M_Gg.text: First time here and it was awesome! We got the chicken Fettuccine and Baked Rigitony, both were fantastic!  The salad and bread to start off was great also!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fettuccine
Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baked Rigatony

pucDKTiDZ2Xw5DxVP-ST4A.text: Another one of my favorite places for lunch. I always get the Cicero Street sandwich and every time its just as good as it was before. They have the best salad around as well. Friendly and happy people, clean place, and great food!

dDYgXsZtPHW-BuGVXAAJFQ.text: We loved it so much the first time that we had to come back for more. Eggplant is excellent. Ravioli with tomato cream sauce was to die for! Bread is excellent. Service was excellent.   On trip #2 my husband wasn't impressed with the pizza crust. I had the chicken piccata. It was good but not amazing. Server this time was ... Forgetful but pleasant    Love their bread and salad that comes with the meals but would appreciate if they checked before delivering it whether we want all the ingredients in it. One person didn't eat onions, another didn't eat pork so we had to send it back both times. Felt bad wasting good food, and it caused our food and salad to come out simultaneously.

qmlj6NMc0YXyvbv1ItLDTA.text: Food wasn't bad and for lunch special at 8.95 was a good deal. Monday lunch special was chicken parmesan and comes with saled and bread all for 8.95. Sauce was good and chicken and pasta was cooked good not the best if had but for the price it was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken parmesan. Monday special $8.95

380KerxYHzKJJ5S3VXqK_A.text: Been wanting to go here for a long time. There is always a 1 to 2 hour wait. We made reservations (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED) for a Friday night. They got us right in! We were super impressed with the salad and the bread was very good too. The service was excellent.  My husband got the sampler plate I can't remember what it is but the one thing that was really good on it was the manicotti. Everything else kind of lacked flavor. My dish was some kind of pasta dish with chicken and vegetables. It had a light creamy sauce but it was really flavorless.

iRdyFJuU0uyKcS05eDR5zg.text: We brought three boys under 9 and had a delicious Italian dinner. Great food, great service, only a 15 minute wait.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Try the penne rosa. The sausage adds a tiniest hint of spice and the peas and broccoli give it great flavor.

dpr6SM6EOTTjucj2YBN6ww.text: Great atmosphere, service and delicious food! The patio area is beautiful in the fall for outdoor dining.

5c-9FirHnNdkeTgRxbny_A.text: Great sauce and home town ambiance. The wait is long on the weekends, but that's only proof positive how good the food is here. As a Sicilian kid, this is the best spot I've found in AZ. Try it out lunch or dinner for great Italian food.

h3LYRG2MrVtIuPbJuWyHzg.text: This was such a great experience! There was a wait but it was super quick and no where near what the quoted time was. Our server was GREAT and went above and beyond to make sure our food was perfect. The food was awesome and totally reasonably priced. I can't wait to go back!

oFeHNufBfs7L30CGoxg1ng.text: Rigatoni's the best restaurant!!! We love everything here!!! The food and wine pairing dinners are the best.  Staff is always amazing and friendly. This is our go to!

37N7JQozQmVfGBUQqKhInA.text: HIT OR MISS good one time terrible the next take your chances If it's bad try again... if it's good YAY has potential just really wish they would get it together and be consistently delicious!

TX25FUuyvhPWn4wfmyvQcw.text: Love love love Rigatonys! We drive all the way from Tucson to come here! Good service & owners are very welcoming & friendly. Great food too, amazing salad!!!!! The price is right as well.

LcLXlpAz5ZRuLZNcxZUSkg.text: Pretty depressing experience. Service was terrible. They skimp on the salad dressing so salad is dry and tasteless. Food was ok except for my eggplant, two small rounds of eggplant extremely under cooked so it was tough, tasteless and chewy. But the real kicker? My daughter really wanted to go there before she gives birth next week so she could indulge in the cappuccino pie for dessert. But they didn't have any because someone walked in and purchased 4 whole pies and they had none left to sell to their patrons. You know, those people who came in and spent a good $100 plus on tasteless food. If someone needs 4 pies, that should be a special order item. What kind of a place sells all of their desserts to one person leaving none for their diners to order? A place that doesn't care about the people eating in their establishment.

O0_Bulf2AZoAlBDHodrjQw.text: The Ceciro Sandwich is the freeking bomb.  I dream about it!!!!!  Never again will I go to the chain in the same complex for lunch......RigiTonis all the way!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States. Outside is beautiful

RR6_LIzBGdTNtLxbryNu-A.text: Service was good until one of the managers there acted aggresivly and rude towards me. Than tried to mad dog me on the way out and than wanted to call the police when he was unsuccessful at intimidating me. He really needs to work on their customer relations. Never going there again.

6aDmj5kJtaN-M9iR0cg4yQ.text: We get takeout quite often and the food is always good.  Love the salad and bread fresh and yummy! House salad dressing is addictive!

oIFymHN7Jj6lFOELjIBuRA.text: I love Italian food, but this place doesn't have good food,  and that's being nice. Everything tastes like it's bought from the grocery store, and is overly buttered and salted. The inside is cozy, but old and dated.

Ps2C7Q8srH-oczYHBoSaZA.text: Ate here for dinner tonight; food was pretty good.  Had the fried ravioli appetizer w salad and bread and then the penne rosa w sausage entree.  All of it was good, I liked it but it was pretty loud inside.  And the front lobby while waiting was very small; I was elbow to elbow w other people.  Wait staff was great.  Would definitely go back

DTcEQuKbBs5Rkk4EIXmoig.text: This place was hoppin' on a Wednesday night! After perusing the weird items at the adjacent Tuesday Morning as we were waiting for a table, we eventually got a seat on the patio, some of the only people to brave the chilly 70 degree evening in Arizona. We got calamari, the capellini pescatore, and the baked rigatoni. All the main dishes come with their antipasti salad and ciabatta bread. Now, my home town is largely Sicilian and I lived in Italy for a bit. Rigatony's is super solid, homey Italian American food. It's like what Macaroni Grill should be with a bit more soul and liberal use of garlic. The marinara sauce for dipping or on the pasta has a nice kick of fresh garlic, the ciabatta was delicious, and I hoovered down my rigatoni with ultimate ease. My partner in dining/life and I both agreed this would go in our rotation for easy comfort food. We're fans.

zvqiOZzZQwLBrHiZ75B-xg.text: Excellent food and great hospitality from everyone. Always a pleasure to dine here. The atmosphere is very pleasant. We love the daily lunch specials.the devoted dinners club helps keep us coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of RigaTony's Authentic Italian - Tempe, AZ, United States

McOvV0hJ5y__hUSAEdAbJw.text: Wanted to get some italian food so we thought of going to Olive Garden. Thankfully, i decided to look something up on Yelp! and I'm excited to say I'm glad I used the app to find this place.   We all ordered the eggplant parmesan with salad. The salad and the dressing that it comes with compliments each other very well! I do not remember how many refills of salad we had gotten that day.  The eggplant itself was amazingly good! There was also sufficient amount of eggplant that was given. Definitely quality italian food.   Our server was also really great! She also gave us a slice of espresso cake, which was probably one of the best cakes I've had in a while. I could be exaggerating but it really did taste good.   Check it out for yourself. You will not be disappointed.

68_Bb0FTKyItkRCKO0lB4A.text: This place is popular, be prepared for a wait at dinner time.  I snagged a seat in the bar area.  If the wait is too long for you, try to grab a table in the bar area, they serve the full menu.  The clams were so delicious... I could have picked up the bowl and drank the broth... Yum! I was super disappointed that the restaurant did not have a lot of low calorie or gluten free options.  They don't even have a salad section on the menu.    I ordered the chicken with lemon, artichoke and capers with out the breading.  Of course it came out with breading.  The cutlet was chewy and lacked flavor....
